loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beams, wood, cement, sand and gravel to repair the roof and floor of her home

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 45-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself as focused and trustworthy. He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a busy commercial place and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of working capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy tools and other equipment to use in the garage. He hopes that in the future, he will be a successful businessman. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy tools and other equipment to use in the garage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and raw materials

loans.name: Philly

texts.en: Philly is a 59-year-old married man. He has five children. He describes himself as strict. He operates a welding business where he makes metal doors, windows, etc. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be power shortages. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy metal sheets and other items for welding. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have financial freedom. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and other items for welding

loans.name: Juralyn

texts.en:
Juralyn is 35 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is a widow and a part-time tutor with one school-aged child.

Juralyn is engaged in fishing, in particular operating a fishing boat and “payaw” for their means of living. She is also receiving a monthly pension as the surviving spouse of her late husband. Juralyn earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional fishing equipment.

Juralyn has been a member of PMPC for almost eight years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Irina Isabel

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Irina quien con su credikiva, logró iniciar un nuevo negociode venta de mercancia variada, enfocandose en esta actividad comercial compró mercancías varias, como fantasías y productos que en su catálogo vinieron con muy buenos descuentos que trasladó a su clientela. Con su credikiva cumplió con los pedidos solicitados y esto es una muestra de un buen y oportuno servicio.  Su negocio se ha incrementado, así como sus ventas y  se apalanca con sus recursos propios generado por el negocio y no con los de su esposo. Ella dice a los financiadores de Kiva :” Gracias, a Kiva, hoy su negocio de venta de mercancía es más sólido y tiene un capital estable para invertir.” En la actualidad requiere comprar textiles, calzado, y fantasías variadas, para ofrecer a su clientela diversidad y continuar aumentando sus ventas.
texts.en: Thanks for supporting Irina, with her Kiva loan she managed to start a new business selling an assortment of goods. Focusing on this commercial activity she purchased various merchandise such as costume jewelry and products that from her catalogue come with very good discounts which are given to her clientele. With her Kiva loan she fulfilled the requested demands and this is a demonstration of a good and timely service.  Her business has increased, as well as her sales and leverages with her own resources generated from the business and not her husband. She tells Kiva lenders “Thanks, to Kiva, today her merchandise selling business is more solid and has a stable capital to invest.” Now she needs to purchase textile, footwear and a variety of costume jewelry to offer to her diverse clientele and continue increasing sales.

loans.use: to purchase textile, footwear and assortment of costume jewelry.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia es una joven pujante, soñadora emprendedora que ve en cada situación de la vida una oportunidad para crecer como persona y empresaria, una mujer que desde su mayoría de edad decidió irse de su hogar, buscar su horizonte, pero se encontró con un problema; como mantenerse, como cubrir sus gastos y necesidades. Caminando por su sector residencial identifico que carecía de un café Internet, y es así como nació la idea de tener su propio negocio, un pequeño café Internet con el cual inicio con un solo computador pero por sus buenos resultados pudo ampliar su negocio y anexarle tres computadores más y por pedido de sus clientes comenzó a vender películas en formato DVD, sus ventas iban mejorando y le surgió la necesidad de contratar una persona a la cual le paga 25.000$ diarios, pues sus ventas y buen servicio le atraían muy buena clientela. 
Hoy en día solicita una ayuda para adecuar cabinas de llamadas internacionales en su negocio, comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus películas y tener un local muy agradable para sus clientes pues su principal sueño es tener su negocio adecuado, posicionado a nivel municipal y que este tenga todos los elementos de un café Internet: (servicio de Internet, llamadas nacionales e internacionales, venta de películas entre otros). María es la mejor representación de la cultura antioqueña una persona que no ve impedimentos en sus sueños que solo ve oportunidades para  salir adelante que su principal reto es el posicionamiento de su local en su municipio, esa ambición sana de tratar de ser el mejor negocio de sacar su proyecto adelante con trabajo y humildad.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is a young vibrant, entrepreneurial dreamer who sees in each life situation an opportunity to grow as a person and business owner. A woman, who at a young age, decided to leave home and broaden her horizons but she was faced with a problem, how to support herself, to cover her expenses and needs. 

Walking through her residential area she noticed that it lacked internet cafes and that is how the idea was born, of having her own business, a small internet cafe which she began with only one computer and with good results she could expand her business and add three more computers and because of customers’ request she began selling DVD movies. Her sales were improving and it became necessary to hire a person whom she pays $25.000 (Colombian pesos) daily. Her sales and good service attracts a very good clientele. 

Now she is requesting help to put international telephone booths in her shop, purchase a display window to show her movies and have a very accommodating location for her clients. Her main dream is to have a suitable business positioned on a municipal level and that it has all the elements of an internet cafe (internet service, national and international calls, movie for sale among others). 

María is the best representation of the Antiochian culture. A person who doesn’t see obstacles in her dreams, she only sees opportunities to come out ahead. Her main challenge is the positioning of her shop in her town; a healthy ambition of being the best shop to get her project ahead with work and humility.

loans.use: to get international photo booths, purchase a display window to show her DVD movies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Manuel en su negocio de venta de sacos. Con su credikiva pudo comprar muchos e incrementó  su inventario y así mismo sus ventas y utilidades. Está entusiasmado y ha iniciado un nuevo negocio en compañía de su esposa para que sea atendido por ella y es el de venta de bebidas.  Manuel dice a sus financiadores de Kiva “Agradezco su ayuda que me ha permitido crecer y mejorar mi situación económica. En la actualidad se propone con su nuevo credikiva comprar sacos y bebidas, para incrmentar  una vez más su potencial de ventas, que es justamente el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Manuel in his business of selling sacks. With his Kiva loan, he was able to buy a lot, and he increased his inventory and similarly his sales and profits. He is enthusiastic, and he has begun a new business with his wife so that she can tend to it, and it is the sale of beverages. Manuel says to his Kiva funders, "I appreciate your help, which has allowed me to grow and improve my economic situation." Now, with his new loan, he proposes to buy sacks and beverages to once more increase his potential for sales, which is rightly the schievement of his Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es:
Marlene de 28 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos menores de edad, es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañía de sus hijos, y pasar tiempo de calidad. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a  trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad  económica  la crianza y venta de cerdos en pie. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la comprar y venta de cerdos en pie, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Marlene agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Marlene, 28, is married and has two young children. She is from Sauce, located in the northern area of the region. She is known for being hard working, responsible, and with a strong drive towards personal development. In her free time she enjoys spending quality time with her children.  Unfortunately, because of lack of economic resources she couldn’t go to school. She saw the obligation to work from a very young age to help with household expenses. Now, she strives daily to provide a better future for her children.

Thanks to her efforts and to her drive to get ahead, as an economic activity she raises and sells pigs. Her business is located in her house. The objective for the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business in the buying and selling of pigs, so that in the near future she can gain a better income. Marlene is grateful for the support of Kiva lenders who provide to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua, to have a dignified way of earning a living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business in the buying and selling of pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her graduate and postgraduate courses.

loans.name: Victoire Group

texts.fr: Le groupe VICTOIRE  est composé de trois personnes, qui sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe Zénabou (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) âgée de 36 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Zénabou est mariée à un boucher nommé Karim. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Zénabou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. C’est pour cette raison que, Zénabou vend du akpan(bouillie à base de maïs fermenté) et du tapioca dans sa région depuis cinq ans environs. Zénabou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Zénabou ensemble avec les membres du groupe VICTOIRE un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The Victoire ["Victory"] group is composed of three members who are friends living in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Zénabou (the one raising her hand in the photo) is 36 years old. She did not attend school.  Zénabou is married to Karim, a butcher. They have two children, both in school. Zénabou lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various household needs. This is is why Zénabou has been selling "akpan" [corn patties that are dipped in sauce] and tapioca in her region for about five years.   Zénabou stocks up in Benin. With the goal of meeting customer demand,  Zénabou, together with the other members of the Victoire group, is seeking a second loan from ALIDé. Their prior loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, milk and peanuts.

loans.name: Ivoga

texts.en:
Ivoga is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She plans to extend a business, selling tin fish, powder, flour, sugar, salt, ice cream, ice pop, chicken leg, etc. 

She has requested a loan to buy more goods, such as boxes of tin fish, corned beef, noodles, sugar, rice, flour, soaps, coffee, tea, snacks, chicken leg quarters, etc. to restock her shop, and pay school fees for her children's education. 

Ivoga will save some of her profits and provide for her family's daily needs and children's education expenses. Ivoga joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy boxes of tin fish, corned beef, noodles, etc. and pay school fees.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 40-year-old married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are the general public. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a tuk tuk (a motorcycle-based taxi) within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will have money. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be spiritual. She operates a retail business where she cooks potato chips to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a slum area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a stock of potatoes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a stock of potatoes.

loans.name: Grafort

texts.en:
Grafort is 49 years old and lives in Bobongan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. He is married with nine children.

Grafort works in the fish industry, and sells/catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for 30 years. He has requested a loan for additional fishing capital.

Grafort has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Grafort hopes to expand his fishing net to catch more fishes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing net.

location.town: Liloy- Bobongan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Fany Clemencia

texts.es:
Fany de  30 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañía de su hijo. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar  una carrera, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar laboratorio clínico. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su hijo.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos como body, perfumes, crema corporal, rubor, vanidades, lápiz labial, delineador, anti ojeras. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El negocio lo desempeña de forma ambulante y por encargo a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Fany agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Fany is 30 years old. She is a single mother with a minor son. She is originally from Sauce, a place that is located in the northern zone of the region. She is known for being hard-working and responsible, with the will for personal achievement. In her free time, she likes to enjoy the company of her son. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources, she was not able to study for a career, but she would have liked to study in the clinical laboratory program. Now she works day after day to offer a better future to her son.

Thanks to her effort and her will to advance, she has a business of selling cosmetics such as body wash, perfumes, body lotion, blush, compacts, lipstick, eyeliner, and anti-dark circle creams. She works in her business some eight hours a day, offering her products. She carries out her business as a street vendor and through orders from regular and prospective customers. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business so that in the not-too-distant future she can obtain better income. Fany appreciates the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her cosmetics business with products such as body wash, perfumes, body lotion, blush, compacts, lipstick, eyeliner, and anti-dark circles cream.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 54 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children.

Rosie works in the fish industry and sells fish for living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She requested a loan for additional capital to purchase more boxes of fish to sell. Rosie has been a member of PMPC for four years, and in the future, Rosie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Alan

texts.es: Alan vende cervezas, refrescos fríos desde el año 2012. Él tiene 28 años de edad y habita en un barrio muy alegre donde el sonido de la música y compartir con vecinos los fines de semana son muy frecuentes. Por eso aprovechando este potencial de ventas creó su propio negocio que había aprendido desde los 7 años de edad cuando ayudaba a un familiar en una actividad similar. Cuando decidió ser un emprendedor, fue apoyado por sus padres, con el fin de que Alan generara sus propios ingresos y pudiera pagar una parte de sus estudios, los cuales realizaba en horario diurno. Desde el local donde Alan atiende a su clientela, sueña con grandes metas,  como la de tener la propiedad de un local y poder realizar otras actividades que le generen más ingresos. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen, canastas de cervezas, gaseosas, jugos etc. Con más inversión tendrá mayor posibilidad de incrementar sus ventas y poco a poco cumplir su sueño de prosperidad y esto será gracias a Kiva
texts.en: Alan sells beer and soft drinks since 2012. He is 28 years old and lives in a very happy neighborhood where the sound of music and spending time with one's neighbors on weekends are very frequent. This is why, taking advantage of the potential for sales, he started his own business, which he had learned about since he was 7 years old by helping a relative with a similar activity. When he decided to be an entrepreneur, he received his parents' support, as they wanted Alan to generate his own income and be able to pay for part of his studies, which he pursues during the day. From the place where Alan serves his customers, he dreams of achieving great goals, such as owning a store and being able to conduct other activities that could generate a higher income. Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, which he will use to buy larger quantities of beer, soda, juice, etc. With a higher investment, he will have a better possibility of increasing his sales and slowly achieve his goal of being prosperous, which will be thanks to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of beer, soda, juice, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Estela

texts.es:
Vilma de 48 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, que busca siempre aprender algo nuevo y ponerlo en práctica. Ella pudo culminar sus estudios universitarios y se graduó de profesora. Es una madre soltera que le toco criar a su única hija sin la ayuda del padre. Su hija está estudiando y cuando le queda espacio le ayuda en el negocio (panadería). 

Ccomo profesora tiene 27 años de ejercer su profesión, además de este trabajo, desde hace 7 años se dedica a elaborar algunos tipos de pan, estos los realiza en la casa, solo por pedidos, este negocio lo atiende después del mediodía, al venir del trabajo. Este oficio lo aprendió gracias a  que ella está siempre en la búsqueda de aprender nuevos oficios, para aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presenten. 

El préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de insumos y equipo: azúcar, harina, moldes, una batidora, 
ha buscado financiamiento porque en este momento ha tenido otros gastos personales en los cuales la dejaron un mal económicamente y tiene varios pedidos de los clientes y necesita invertir, comprando insumos en cantidades mayores para obtener estos a un precio más cómodo, además de algunos materiales que desea adquirir.

En un futuro quiere que su hija pueda terminar sus estudios universitarios, que se convierta en una profesional y encuentre un trabajo digno y que además, pueda  seguir con el negocio/(panadería) y la fortalezca.
texts.en:
Vilma, 48 years old, is an entrepreneurial woman. She is always looking to learn something new and put it into practice. Vilma finished her college studies, graduating as a teacher. She is a single mother who raises her only daughter without any help from the girl's father. Her daughter is studying and when she has time she helps her mother with the business (bakery). 

Vilma has been teaching for 27 years. In addition to this, she has been making various types of homemade breads, filling customers'  orders. She runs this business in the afternoons when she gets home from work. Vilma learned this trade thanks to her disposition to search for new things to learn to take advantage of opportunities that present themselves. She will use this loan to buy ingredients and equipment: sugar, flour, molds, a mixer, etc. 

Vilma has been searching for a loan because in this moment, she has had some personal expenses that left her in a bad financial situation. She also has many customer's orders to fill and she needs to invest, buying her ingredients in larger quantities in order to get a better price as well as some materials she's hoped for. 

In the future, Vilma wants her daughter to be able to finish her college education, become a professional, and find a dignified job. She also hopes to continue strengthening her business (bakery).

loans.use: to buy ingredients and equipment: sugar, flour, molds, and a mixer for her bakery.

loans.name: Rahat

texts.ru: Рахат 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывает 3 детей. У Рахат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она уже много лет занимается животноводством, благодаря упорному труду Рахат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, а также есть земельный надел, на котором она выращивает морковь и помидоры. Ежемесячный доход составляет свыше 10,000 сом (KGS). Рахат является участником группы "Береке",в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. В итоге их трое. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рахат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Рахат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на строительство нового сарая.
texts.en: Rahat is 42 and married with three children. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry for many years as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she now has three milking cows as well as a piece of land where she grows carrots and tomatoes. Her monthly income is over 10,000 KGS. Rahat is part of the group Bereke along with two other people. With the goal of further developing her business, Rahat has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to purchase steers to increase the amount of livestock she has. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further increasing her number of cattle, and wants to save toward building a new shed.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as spiritual. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a slum area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as low sales during rainy season. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy wheat flour. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is a 51-year-old married woman from Molatohan Oroquita City who has one child. She has been a member of Paglaum-MPC for almost seven years. Thelma owns and manages a small restaurant in front of her house, which is on a national road that many people pass through looking for places to eat. Due to the improvements to her city, many people travel in and out of the vicinity, so she has decided to expand her business to cook more dishes in order to draw more people to visit her eatery. To fund this project, she needs additional capital, so she has requested a loan from Paglaum-MPC to purchase a larger inventory of basic commodities.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of basic commodities

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 26-year-old married man, and he has one child. He describes himself to be down to earth. He operates a retail business where he sells scrap metal, and he has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a slum area and his primary customers are the general public. James will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of scrap metal, and his business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that he will be successful in the future. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of scrap metal.

loans.name: Medy

texts.en:
Medy is 46 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married but has no dependents. For their means of living, Medy has been engaged in rice palay trading for three years, and earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to purchase six sacks of palay for drying, milling and wholesaling. Medy has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Medy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of palay (rice) for drying, milling and wholesaling.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is a 25-year-old married man. He has two children aged four and six years. He describes himself as optimistic. 

Shadrack operates a retail business where he sells scrap metal. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a populated area. He will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of scrap metal. He hopes that in the future, he will have frequent cash flow and a good lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more stock of scrap metal.

loans.name: Meleya

texts.en:
Meleya is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as realistic. 

Meleya operates a retail business where he sells sugar, sweets and other items. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a semi-urban area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of stock. He will use this 10,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, sweets and other items. His business goal is to own a bigger shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, the business will grow. This is his first loan with SMEP DTML.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, sweets and other items.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 12 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes and oranges. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more oranges and tomatoes. She hopes that in the future she will have a good life.

loans.use: buy more oranges and tomatoes.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Judith con su anterior credikiva, mediante el cual compró mercancía variada, como sabanas, perfumes, bisutería y hasta planes de celulares. Hoy tiene más clientes, pues cambió de residencia. Ella se siente feliz por la llegada de un nuevo miembro de familia a su vida, que cuenta con 5 meses de nacido. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una vitrina y repuestos para motos, y también productos de belleza con los que surtirá su otra vitrina.  Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Agradezco a las personas que me han ayudado, a sacar adelante mi negocio, y que continúen para que sigan ayudándome al igual que a otros microempresarios. “
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Judith with her previous Kiva loan, which helped her to buy various merchandise such as sheets, perfumes, jewelry, and cell phone plans. Today she has more customers and she changed her residence. She is happy about the arrival of a new member of her family, who is now 5 months old. Currently, Judith is applying for a Kiva loan with which she will buy a new display case, spare auto parts, and beauty products to stock her other display case with. 

Her message to lenders is the following: I am very grateful to the people who have helped me to move forward with my business and I hope that they continue to help me and other small business owners.

loans.use: she will buy a display case, spare auto parts, and beauty products.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 46-year-old married man. He has six children. He describes himself as focused. 

Andrew operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low supply. He will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful and rich. This is his first loan with SMEP DTML.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Masturazhan

texts.ru: Мастуражан 57 лет, замужем, есть дети. У Мастуражан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав более 30 лет назад с покупки скота на 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Мастуражан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 25 овец. Есть все условия для содержания скота. Мастуражан  также имеет небольшой земельный надел, на котором ежегодно сажает кукурузу, картофель и морковь для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мастуражан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота, также она планирует накопить средства на ремонт жилого дома.
texts.en: Masturazhan is 57 and married with children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started more than 30 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 2,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has two milking cows, one horse and 25 sheep, as well as everything she needs to care for the animals. She also has a small parcel of land where she harvests corn, potatoes and carrots every year, both for her own use and for sale. Her total monthly income is 15,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Masturazhan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to purchase sheep to increase the amount of livestock she has. She also plans to save toward renovating her home.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Kanygul

texts.ru: Каныгуль 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Каныгуль - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Каныгуль на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Каныгуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 10,000 сом (KGS). Каныгуль входит в группу "Береке", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. В итоге их трое. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Каныгуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Каныгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на расширение сарая для животных.
texts.en: Kanygul is 39 and married with three children. She has a high school education and for many years has been working in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she now has two milking cows with a monthly income of 10,000 KGS. Kanygul is a member of the group Bereke along with two other people. With the goal of further developing her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to purchase cows to increase the number of cattle she has. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further increasing her number of livestock and wants to save toward increasing the size of her cattle shed.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is a 34-year-old married man, and he has three children with ages ranging from one year to ten years. He describes himself to be creative. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy spare parts to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to be successful within five years, and he hopes that he will have a good life in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is a 50-year-old married woman, and she has six children. She describes herself to be trustworthy and humble. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for ten years, and her business is located in a safe and secure location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. Diana will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cereals and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand within five years, and she hopes that she will be able to boost business in the future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals and vegetables.

loans.name: Sari Kencana Group

texts.en:
As the head of the Sari Kencana group, Jro Nyoman is responsible for coordinating all of the members to make their payments. The progress of the pig business this period is quite good and they can sell the pigs together and earn a profit. Jro Nyoman took care of seven pigs and they all sold. She sold each pig for 650,000 IDR, so she earned 4,550,000 IDR. After deducting the loan and paying for the feed, she can use the rest to fulfill her family's needs. 

Seeing a significant result from the last period, the group asked for a new loan, and MUK approved that. Now the group will receive 10,000,000 IDR and each member will get 1,000,000 IDR. Jro Nyoman's primary job is being a farmer. She does the pig business in the morning and after coming home from her farm. She will use her loan to purchase superior piglets. To reduce the cost of feed, she’s also giving the pigs traditional feed made from various kinds of leaves such as banana leaf and cassava leaf. She hopes this new loan gives her more profit and welfare for her family. One member left the group for several reasons and she was replaced by a new member.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a hundred chickens and four pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 32-year-old married woman. She has six children. 

She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a viable location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) loan to buy fabric, threads, and materials for making furniture. Her business goal is to own a store selling tailoring materials within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, and materials for making furniture

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 44-year-old man, and he has 4 children with ages ranging from 6 to 28 years. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he makes ropes to sell. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more materials for making ropes to sell. His business goal is to be successful within five years, and he hopes that he will have a good lifestyle in the future. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making ropes to sell.

loans.name: Clarice

texts.en: Clarice is a 30-year-old married woman, and she has five children. She describes herself to be philanthropic. She operates a retail business where she sells groceries and charcoal. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of groceries and charcoal to sell. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ana Viviana

texts.es:
La joven Ana Viviana, está muy interesada  por la salud, siendo hoy en día Auxiliar de enfermería con deseos inmensos de ser esteticista y ayudar con las herramientas de ser enfermera, para así poder lograr una de las tantas metas propuestas, una joven con muchos sueños, emprendedora, cabeza  de familia, quien lucha por el futuro de la hija y también el de la familia, quien tiene muy en claro que el estudio es una herramienta clave para salir adelante  y lograr tantos objetivos, quien enfoca un futuro como profesional muy exitosa, Viviana  considera que sería una buena esteticista  graduada de campo alto. 

En este momento el recurso económico no es muy estable en el hogar de ella, es por eso que se interesó para tener el convenio de kiva, ya que el valor  del as cuotas mensuales serian un poco más económicas y el dinero que se ahorra lo puede invertir en otros gastos que ella tenga en el hogar o necesite en el estudio.
texts.en:
Ana Viviana is very interested in healthcare as she is a nursing auxiliary. She is very keen to become an esthetician and use her nursing skills in this way. She is an enterprising young woman with many dreams, and as the head of the household she works hard to provide a good future for her daughter and the rest of the family. Ana Viviana realizes that education is the key to getting ahead and achieve her goals such as becoming a successful professional, which, in her case, would be an esthetician with qualifications from a good college.

At this time Ana Viviana's household economic situation is not secure so she is interested in entering into an agreement with Kiva as the monthly payments would be a little more manageable. The money she saves can be used for other household expenses or educational necessities.

loans.use: Pay for a semester of college

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a 29-year-old married man, and he has three children ranging in age from two to six years. He describes himself to be dedicated. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area, and he describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. Alfred will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that he will have improved living standards in the future. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM, and his previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other items.

loans.name: Karla Fabiola

texts.es: Los años no han sido un obstáculo para que Karla logre triunfar en su carrera y culminarla. Madre de dos hijos y 40 años de experiencia en esta vida ella sabe lo que quiere y es culminar su carrera con méritos. Con esfuerzo y sacrificio y el apoyo de su familia Karla ha logrado llegar a su quinto año de su hermosa carrera. Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de un Motor Endodontico. Su plan futuro es establecer su propia clínica y realizar una especialización en Endodoncia.
texts.en: The passing years have not been a problem for Karla as she has managed to have a successful career as well as be a mother to two children. As a 40 year old woman she knows what she wants: to complete her career with distinction. With hard work, sacrifice, and support from her family Karla has completed five years of work as an orthodontist specializing in root canals. She now needs a loan to buy specialized equipment for her work. Her future plans include a wish to establish her own clinic specializing in endodontics.

loans.use: Buy specialized equipment for root canals

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 52 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Alma has been engaged in a hog raising activity for 30 years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing two sacks of feed for her hog raising activity. Alma has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. 

In the future, Alma hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of feed

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 31-year-old single man. He describes himself as goal oriented. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a business friendly area and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather challenges. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more charcoal. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have a sustainable source of income. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was repaid successfully

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Diógenes José

texts.es:
Diógenes, un reconocido personaje de su sector pues su local de venta de verduras lo inicio su padre hace 40 años, cuando inauguraron la plaza de mercado en su sector residencial, es un hombre de 51 años de edad que tiene como principios la humildad, el respeto, la honradez y por encima de todos estos el carisma, sus raíces como vendedor de verduras lo inicio hace más de 30 años cuando le ayudaba a su padre con su negocio familiar, poco después heredo el negocio y desde ese entonces lo trabaja con una intensidad de 12 horas diarias en semana, tiene como principal ventaja que es muy reconocido en el sector debido al tiempo que lleva laborando, ya los residentes y compradores habituales lo consideran como uno más de su familia lo cual es muy importante para un micro empresario pues inconscientemente logra una de las metas más importantes en mercadeo la cual es meterse en el corazón de sus compradores, lo que le genera clientela fiel. El señor Diógenes utilizara el micro crédito para pago de impuesto industria y comercio, comprar una puerta para su local; este problema es el cuello de botella de su progreso ya que por la carencia de esta puerta ha tenido robos a su mercancía dejándolo en varias ocasiones con el dinero suficiente solo para surtir su negocio, y por ultimo compra de surtido.
Diógenes siempre ha anhelado continuar la tradición del negocio pues ha sido este el sustento de su familia por más de 30 años y no solo eso expandirlo ser un negocio perdurable en el  tiempo convertirse en un icono un referente en la plaza de mercado donde actualmente trabaja.
texts.en:
Diogenes is a well-known person in his neighborhood.  His food stall for local vegetable sales began with his father 40 years ago, when they opened the marketplace in their residential sector. He is a 51- year-old whose characteristics are humility, respect, honesty and above all charisma. His roots are as a seller of vegetables which he started over 30 years ago when he helped his father with the family business. Soon after he inherited the business and since then he works rigorously 12 hours daily each week.

The main advantage he has is being well-known in the marketplace due to the length time he has been working. Residents and frequent shoppers consider him as one of their family. This is very important for a micro entrepreneur as he has unconsciously achieved one of the most important goals in marketing which is getting into the heart of their buyers and thus generate loyal customers. 

Diogenes will use the loan to pay the business tax and to buy a door for his stall.  The problem which is the bottleneck of his progress is that without this door, he has had goods stolen repeatedly leaving him with only enough money for restocking, and finally to purchase inventory.

Diogenes has always wanted to continue the tradition of the business as this has been the livelihood of his family for over 30 years and also expand it to be a lasting business over time, becoming a leader in the marketplace where he currently works.

loans.use: to pay the business tax, buy a secure door for business, and buy inventory for his stall.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 35-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 6 years to 12 years. He describes himself as creative and flexible. He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes to sell. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a business friendly area and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be less stock. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fabric, thread and other tailoring materials. His business goal is to have a sustainable business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en: Jacklyne is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as success oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a semi urban area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be less stock. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy various products (canned goods, fabrics, etc.)

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 42 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now of school age. 

Arlene has been engaged in rice “palay” trading for five years and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase 20 sacks of palay for drying, milling and wholesaling.  Arlene has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Arlene hopes that all her children will finish their education.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sacks of palay for drying, milling and wholesaling

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a 28-year-old single woman with one child. She describes herself to be goal oriented. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a business friendly area and her primary customers are regular customers. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy beauty products and salon equipment. She hopes that in the future, she will have a sustainable business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and salon  equipment

loans.name: Kouami

texts.fr: Homme de 56ans, Kouami est marié et père de 05 enfants. Il est revendeur de cartes de recharges au bord de la route. Afin de renflouer son activité, il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES. Il espère avec le profit accroitre son activité et assurer la prospérité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kouami is 56 years old, married and the father of five children. He is a roadside retailer of phone cards.

To bolster his activity, he is requesting  a first credit loan from Wages. He hopes the profit will enable him to increase his activity and ensure his family's prosperity.

loans.use: Buy phone cards

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en: Wilkister is a 32-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fabric, threads and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Amirulloh

texts.en:
Amirulloh runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Amirulloh lives in Jakarta, an urban area.  Amirulloh is married and lives with two people in the family house.

Amirulloh began working with Ruma seven months ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Wangninan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAN est composé de trois personnes, qui sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe Sènoumè (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) âgée de 26 ans a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau primaire. Sènoumè est mariée à un matelassier du nom de Florent. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Sènoumè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. C’est pour cette raison que dame Sènoumè vend de la nourriture (de l’akassa accompagné de sauce) à son domicile depuis huit ans. Sènoumè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Sènoumè ensemble avec les membres du groupe WANGNINAN sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Wangninan group consists of three people who are friends and live in the same neighborhood. The representative of the Sènoumè group (the one whose hand is raised in the photo) is 26 years old and attended school at primary level.

Sènoumè is married to a mattress-maker named Florent. The couple has two children, both in school. Sènoumè lives with her ​​husband and children, and the couple shares various household expenses.

For this reason Sènoumè has been selling food preparations (akassa [a thick cornmeal porridge] accompanied by sauce) from her home for the past eight years. Sènoumè gets her supplies from one of Benin's markets.

In their quest for customer satisfaction, Sènoumè and the other members of the Wangninan group are requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. Previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy corn, fish and condiments.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya  est  majoritairement composé de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Hamdallaye l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits de beautés (mèches, pommades et parfums) de meilleures qualités et habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Salimata (femme assise à l’extrême  droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits de beautés (mèches, pommades et parfums) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 35 paquets de mèches,  à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Hamdallaye à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Salimata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The majority of the women who make up the Danaya group live in monogamous families.  On average, they are 30 years old, with three children each.  They all live in Hamdallaye, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and they know one another through neighborhood ties.  They are involved in small retail business and sell clothes as well as high quality beauty products (hair extensions, ointments and perfumes).  Eager to increase their businesses, the members of the group have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their second solidarity loan.

Salimata is a well-known seller of high quality beauty products (hair extensions, ointments and perfumes).  In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the right.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 35 packages of hair extensions.  She will buy her goods in Bamako and resell her merchandise in Hamdallaye.  Her customer base mostly consists of women.

Thanks to this loan, Salimata is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her business.  Through her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to buy a plot of land on which to build a house.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées équitablement dans des ménages monogamiques et polygamiques  les quatre membres du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 38 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sirakoro Dounfing dans la commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sirakoro Dounfing. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de savons, de pagnes et des produits cosmétiques. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djénèba  (femme  debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de savons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40 cartons de savons en poudre au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail Sirakoro Dounfing et à  en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Djénèba compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married in both monogamous and polygamous households, the four members of the Benkadi group are on average 38 years old with six children. They all live in Sirakoro Dounfing in the Mande district, part of the Kati circle, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Sirakoro Dounfing market.

Group members are small retailers of soap, clothes and cosmetics. With the intention of increasing their working capital, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle.

Mrs. Djénèba (the woman standing at the far left in the photo) is a great retailer of soap. She intends to use her loan to buy 40 boxes of soap powder at the grand market. Retail sales are conducted in Sirakoro Dounfing and through itinerant sales to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Mrs. Djénèba expects this loan will generate average monthly profits of 90,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet small household needs.

loans.use: To buy boxes of soap

loans.name: Saran

texts.en: Saran is 28 years old. She is a married woman who has two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a factory laborer and her husband is a farmer. Both of them earn approximately $9 per day. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of $700 to purchase farmland to grow rice. This loan helps her reap more harvest as it will enlarge her land area.  In the future, she hopes that she will grow her farm business further to support her children to get their high school diplomas.

loans.use: To purchase farmland to grow rice

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: Cissy is married with nine children of which five attend school. She takes care of additional family members (grandchildren) and has a retail shop. She has applied for a loan of 2,200,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO  to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, bags of rice and maize flour and bread to sell.  She generates additional income from renting out rooms.  She works in a shop seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation, defaulters and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build more rental rooms. She resides in her family house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, bags of rice and maize flour and bread to sell

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Nièta ont en moyenne 30 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Hamdallaye l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Hamdallaye. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax, basins et brodés) de meilleures qualités, de colliers et de sacs. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une  vendeuse de habits (pagnes wax, bazins et brodés) et de colliers de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter   25 pagnes wax à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Hamdallaye et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatoumata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and living mainly in monogamous families, the four members of the Nièta group are on average 30 years old with three children. They all live in Hamdallaye, one of the popular quarters of Bamako, and met through living in the same neighbourhood and through their income generating activities at the market in Hamdallaye. The members of this group work in small business selling clothing (wax pagnes, hand-dyed polished cotton called bazins, and embroidered fabric) of excellent quality, necklaces and handbags. Hoping to increase their business capacity, the members of the group decided to collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution and this is their second solidarity loan.
Mrs. Fatoumata (the woman standing on the extreme left in the photo) sells clothing (wax pagnes, bazins and embroidery) and necklaces of the best quality. She plans to use her loan to buy 25 wax pagnes in Bamako. She sells her merchandise retail in Hamdallaye and as an itinerant saleswoman to her mainly feminine clientele. With this loan, Mrs. Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and to provide for petty expenses in her home.

loans.use: To buy wax pagnes.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 39 year old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 8 years. He describes himself to be determined and focused. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a bicycle. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. This will enable him serve more customers faster and increase his income. He hopes that in the future, he can buy a piece of land. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 60 year old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells bicycle spare parts. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of bicycle spare parts. Her business goal is to be the best provider of bicycle parts in the area within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will raise the living standard of her family. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spare bicycle parts

loans.name: Ouindinmanegde Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTA est la représentante du groupe OUINDINMANEGDE. Elle se porte très  bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 02 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend des plats plastiques  depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché de son quartier. 
Elle veut s’acheter  05 grandes  fûts en plastiques, 10 plats et 15 seaux.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne  toujours s’acheter une parcelle et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Binta is the representative of the Ouindinmanegde group. She is doing well. Married, she is a mother of three children. The eldest is 13 years old and the youngest is four years old. Two of the children go to school.

Binta has been selling plastic plates for six years. She procures her goods from a local market.

She wants to buy five large plastic containers, 10 plates, and 15 buckets.

Binta wants to save her earnings. Her main hope is to one day buy a piece of land and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy five large plastic containers, 10 plates, and 15 buckets

loans.name: Kayira Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kayira est majoritairement composé  de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sirakoro Dounfing dans la commune du Mandé  dans le cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce du lait, de la restauration et d’ustensiles. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme debout en 2ème  position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du lait de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 500 litres du lait  avec les éleveurs de bétails dans les villages environnant de Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Sirakoro Dounfing et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame  Fatoumata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Kayira group consists for the most part of monogamous women. They are on average 44 years old with four children. They all live in Sirakoro Dounfing in the Mande district in the circle of Kati, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Group members are small retailers of milk, food preparations and kitchen utensils. In order to resupply using cash, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle.

Ms. Fatoumata (the woman standing in the second position from the left to the right in the photo) has a great reputation at selling the best quality milk.

She intends to use her loan to buy 500 liters of milk from cattle farmers in the villages surrounding Bamako. Retail sales are conducted in Sirakoro Dounfing and through itinerant sales to a mixed clientele.

Ms. Fatoumata hope to achieve with this loan average monthly profits of 90,000 CFA francs to be reinvested in the business. Her objective in this relationship with Soro Yiriwasoto is to buy a lot for residential usage.

loans.use: buy milk

loans.name: Kokoe

texts.fr: Kokoé marié, vit avec son conjoint et leurs 04 enfants tous scolarisés à Lomé. Afin de contribuer au bien- être du foyer, elle revend des produits d'alimentation générale(liqueurs, eau minérale, canette...) depuis 2009 et s'approvisionne généralement au Grand Marché de Lomé. Le profit lui permettra d'agrandir son activité et assurer au mieux aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Kokoé is married and lives with her husband and four children in Lomé.  The couple's children all go to school.  In order to contribute to her family's well-being, Kokoé has been reselling general food products (liqueurs, mineral water, cans...) since 2009.  She usually stocks up at the Grand Market in Lomé.  With her profits, she will be able to increase her activity and better meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy liqueurs, mineral water and other goods.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine  is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She has a restaurant and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice and Irish potatoes. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to have a fully stocked restaurant and also to educate her children up to university level. She resides in her family house and the  family has no access to  electricity or  piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches  of green bananas, beef, rice and Irish potatoes for her restuarant.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia is 48 years old and married with 7 school-aged children.  She is from Del Pilar, Baliangao, Mis. Occ. Emelia sells fish for a living. This is how she supports her family. She joined Paglaum this year because she needed additional capital. She applied for a loan from Paglaum to buy kilos of fish to sell.  The profit she earns from her business she saves in Paglaum because she plans to buy a motorcycle to use for fish delivery in the future.

loans.use: to buy kilos of fish to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates rental houses where she rents houses she owns. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy materials to renovate rental houses. Her business goal is to be financially stable within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate rental houses

loans.name: Windingoudi Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZALISSA est la représentante du groupe WINDINGOUDI. Elle se porte très bien ainsi que les membres du groupe.  Mariée, elle est  mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et  le moins âgé a 06ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes à sa charge.
Mme est couturière. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 16ans. Mme vend aussi des bijoux et du savon. Elle s’approvisionne au marché  de son quartier. 
Mme veut  s’acheter 06 rouleaux de popeline, 01douzaine de fermeture, 03douzaines de bouton.
 Elle veut  épargner ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne  construire son propre atelier et mieux scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zalissa is the leader of the Windingoudi group. She and the other members of the group are doing fine. She is married with three children. The oldest is 12 and the youngest three years old. All three go to school. She has five people who are dependent on her.
Mrs. Zalissa is a seamstress. She has been in this business for 16 years. She also sells jewellery and soap. She buys her stock at the local market. Mrs. Zalissa would like to buy six rolls of poplin, a dozen zips and three dozen buttons.
She wants to save up the profits. Mrs. Zalissa's ambition is to build her own workshop and obtain better schooling for her children.

loans.use: to buy six rolls of poplin, a dozen zips and three dozen buttons.

loans.name: Filwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTOU représente le groupe FILWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 28ans et le moins âgé a 12ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 05personnes en charge.
Mme vend des ignames  depuis 15ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. 
Elle veut s’acheter 06sacs d’ignames.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne construire sa parcelle et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Bintou represents the Filwende group. Married, she is a mother of four children. The eldest child is 28 years old and the youngest is 12 years old. One of the children goes to school. She has five [additional] people under her care.

Bintou has been selling yams for 15 years. She procures her goods from a local market.

She wants to buy six sacs of yams. 

Bintou wants to save her earnings. She hopes build on her piece of land and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy six sacs of yams

loans.name: Ndèye Mbathio

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur s’appelle Ndèye Mbathio, elle est âgée de 60 ans, veuve et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 filles et 3 garçons, elle a aussi eu 4 enfants qui sont décédés. Malgré son âge, Ndèye Mbathio, ne veut pas arrêter son activité pour au moins deux raisons : d’abord, le fait d’être sédentaire sans activité l’ennuie et n’est pas bon pour sa santé ; la deuxième chose est qu’elle veut toujours soutenir ses enfants dans leurs petits besoins quotidiens, elle a donc besoin de faire cette activité pour générer des bénéfices et pouvoir disposer de liquidité.
Son activité consiste à vendre divers produits comme de l’huile de palme, à faire un peu d’élevage de poulets de chair. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans ce domaine. L’huile de palme est placée par ces filles mariées qui vivent dans d’autres localités. En amenant la marchandise, elle passe un bon bout de temps chez elles et en rentrant, elle ramène des légumes en venant pour revendre ici. 
Ndèye Mbathio n’a pas de charges car c’est son beau fils qui gère la dépense quotidienne pour la famille.
Comme souhait, cette mère de famille veut stabiliser les conditions de vie de ses enfants et petits enfants ; devenir autonome jusqu’à ne plus prendre de crédits.
texts.en:
The borrower Ndèye Mbathio is 60 years old, a widow, and a mother of six children, of whom three are girls and three are boys. She also had four children who have died. 

Despite her age Ndèye Mbathio does not want to stop working for two reasons: first, a sedentary lifestyle is boring and is not good for one's health and second, she wants to always be able to help her children in their small everyday needs. She therefore needs to keep working so that she can have some extra earnings.

Ndèye Mbathio works selling various goods like palm oil and also raises a few chickens. She has been doing this for twenty years.

She takes the palm oil to where her married daughters live. After spending some time at their homes, she returns and brings back vegetables to resell in her home town.

Ndèye Mbathio does not have any expenses, because her son in law takes care of the family. 

Ndèye Mbathio would like to stabilize the living conditions of her children and grand children. She'd also like to become independent and not have to take further loans.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and other goods to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets and bed covers to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric to resell

loans.name: Twifashe Group

texts.fr:
Jeanne d’Arc  fait partie du groupe Twifashe  et habite à  Gitega. Elle a 26 ans et est mariée  à Jean Bosco un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant.

Elle fait le commerce de la bière et de tomates  depuis  7 ans.

Elle est à son onzième crédit avec Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle  obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bière et de tomates   à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait  construire une villa en ville.
texts.en: Jeanne d’Arc is a member of the Twifashe Group and lives in Gitega. She is 26 years old and is married to Jean Bosco, a shopkeeper. They have had one child together. Jeanne d'Arc has been selling beer and tomatoes for the last seven years. This will be her eleventh loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, she plans to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of beer and tomatoes. She will then resell them at a profit. In the coming years, she would like to build a villa in town.

loans.use: increase their capital and buy a large quantity of beer and tomatoes, which will then be resold at a profit

loans.name: Albert

texts.fr:
Monsieur Albert est un fonctionnaire en retraite âgé de 71 ans. Il est marié et père de 7 enfants dont 4 garçons et 3 filles toute mariées elles aussi. Après sa retraite, il est rentré dans sa région natale où il a construit une grande maison. Il y habite avec sa femme, un de ses fils et ses petits enfants. A chaque grande fête, toute la famille est réunie auteur de lui, ce qui le comble de joie de revoir et de rassembler tout le monde. Vu que c’est un nombre important de gens qui se réunissent et que les travaux des toilettes et douches restaient un peu, il a du faire recoure à l’IMCEC pour un crédit de 400 000F qui lui permettra de terminer et d’embellir l’espace.
En ce qui concerne les charges, Albert est appuyé par ses enfants qui presque tous se débrouillent dans la vie. Son vœu le plus cher présentement serai de construire un étage et de laisser les enfants et petits enfants en disposer toujours dans l’esprit de rassembler sa famille qui est un bonheur immense pour lui.
texts.en:
Mr. Albert is a retired civil servant aged 71. He is married with seven children, of which four sons and three daughters who are all married. After retirement, he returned to the region of his birth where he built a large house. He lives there with his wife, one of his sons and his grandchildren. At each big celebration, the whole family reunites around him. This fills him with joy to see them all and get everyone together. In view of the fact that there are many people in the house on these occasions and that the works in the shower and toilets were not finished, he had to resort to requesting a loan of 400 000F from the IMCEC which will enable him to finish the works and make the area look nice.
As for the expenses, Albert is helped by his children who all get by in life. His dearest wish at present would be to add a floor to his house and allow his children and his grandchildren to use it hoping to gather together the family that is such a huge joy for him.

loans.use: to renovate the shower and toilets of his house.

loans.name: Makombe Group

texts.fr:
Isaïe  fait partie du groupe Makombe et habite à Bujumbura. Il a 40 ans et est marié à Virginie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  1 enfant de 15 ans qui étudie.
Il a sous sa charge son beau frère qui étudie.

Il fait le commerce de poissons (ndagala) depuis 2 ans.

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de  poissons (ndagala )à revendre   pour gagner plus.

Dans les années  prochaines, il voudrait devenir un importateur des habits en provenance  de l’Uganda et voir son enfant étudier.
texts.en:
Isaïe is a member of the Makombe Group and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 40 years old and married to Virginie, a vegetable grower.  Together they have a 15-year-old child who attends school.  Isaïe is also supporting his brother-in-law who is currently studying.

Isaïe has been selling fish (ndagala) for two years.  This will be his first loan with the field partner, Turame.  He will use it to increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of fish for resale.  

In the coming years, Isaïe would like to start importing clothing from Uganda and would like to see his child continue to study.

loans.use: to increase their working capital and buy a large quantity of fish (ndagala ) for resale.

loans.name: Kigoma Group

texts.fr:
Marcien fait partie du groupe  Kigoma et  habite à Bujumbura. Il  est marié à Anastasie, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de  7  à  15 ans, tous étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de  tomates et de l’huile de palme,  depuis 8 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de tomates  et beaucoup de litres d ’huile de palme à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait faire l’élevage de vaches et voir ses  enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Marcien is a member of the Kigoma group and lives in Bujumbura. He is married to Anastasia, a shopkeeper. They have four children between the ages of seven and 15, all of whom go to school.
He has been selling tomatoes and palm oil for eight years.
