This is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that he requests, he will increase his capital and purchase a bigger quantity of tomatoes and several litres of palm oil for resale, to earn more.
In the coming years, he would like to take up cattle farming and see his children continue their studies.

loans.use: to increase his capital and purchase a bigger quantity of tomatoes and several litres of palm oil for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Tugirumwete Ii Group

texts.fr:
Rénovat fait partie du groupe  Tugirumwete  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il est marié à Georgette, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants  âgés de 2 mois à 15 ans, dont 4 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de poissons (ndagala) depuis 2 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de poissons (ndagala) à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait avoir la capacité de satisfaire les besoins familiaux (logement, alimentation, soins de santé,…) et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Renovat is a member of the Tugirumwete group and lives in Bujumbura. He is married to Georgette, a farmer. They have six children between the ages of two months and 15 years, of whom four go to school.
He has been selling fish (ndagala) for two years.
This is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that he requests, he intends to increase his capital and buy a bigger quantity of fish (ndagala) for resale to earn more.
In the coming years he hopes to manage to provide for his family's needs (lodging, food, healthcare) and see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a bigger quantity of fish (ndagala) for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Vamwitiro Group

texts.fr:
Salvator fait partie du groupe  Vamwitiro  et  habite à Kayanza. Il a 44 ans et  est marié à  Clothilde, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants  âgés de 16  à  20 ans, dont 6 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de bière de banane depuis 19 ans. 

Il est à son quatorzième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes pour préparer  beaucoup de litres de bière de banane  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait acheter un terrain cultivable  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Salvator is a member of the Vamwitiro group and lives in Kayanza. He is 44 years old and married to Clothilde, a farmer. They have eight children between the ages of 16 and 20, of whom six go to school.

He has been selling banana beer for 19 years.

This is his 14th loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that he requests, he intends to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for the preparation of many litres of banana beer for resale, to earn more.

In the coming years he hopes to buy a plot of arable land and see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for the preparation of many litres of banana beer for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Twishingane Group

texts.fr:
Tharcisse fait partie du groupe  Twishingane  et  habite à Gitega. Il a 34 ans et  est marie à  Estella, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de 7  à  14 ans, dont 3 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de haricot, de l’huile de palme, du riz,  depuis 19 ans. 

Il est à son troisième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande  de riz, haricot, de l’huile de palme   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait multiplier les articles.
texts.en:
Tharcisse is a member of the Twishingane group and lives in Gitega. He is 34 years old and married to Estella, a farmer. They have four children between the ages of seven and 14, of whom three go to school.

He has been selling beans, palm oil and rice for 19 years.

This is his third loan from Turame. With the Kiva credit that he requests, he intends to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans and palm oil for resale, to earn more.

In the coming years he hopes to increase the variety of products that he offers for sale.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans and palm oil for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es: Doña Lucrecia es una mujer con 56 años de edad, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad y vive en unión libre con el padre de ellos. Es una señora muy trabajadora y con deseos de superación y crecimiento. Inició su actividad hace muchos años con la finalidad de generar ingresos y tener independencia económica, además de ayudar a su compañero en los gastos del hogar, debido a que su salario en ese momento era muy bajo. Es clienta de la Fundación con trayectoria y se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad y responsabilidad. Su negocio es la venta ambulante de ropa, sandalias, perfumes y más. Sus clientes son familiares, vecinos y trabajadores de diferentes instituciones de la comunidad limonense. Gracias a su buena forma de ser, trato y facilidad de pago que le brinda a sus clientes le va muy bien. Ahora está un poquito enferma pero ésto no le impide trabajar mucho y superarse por eso busca nuevamente financiamiento para reforzar su negocio, ya que su meta es vencer su enfermedad, un problema familiar, asi mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia.
texts.en: Lucrecia is a 65 year old woman. She has two grown children and she is in a common law marriage with their father. She is a very hardworking woman who really wants to get ahead and grow. She started her activity many years ago in order to generate income and have financial independence as well as to help her husband with the household expenses. His salary at that time was very low. She has been a client of the Fundación for awhile and she has been described as punctual and responsible. Her business is selling clothing, sandals, perfume and more. Her customers are relatives, neighbors and workers indifferent institutions of the Limon community. Thanks to her good character, service and the ease of payment she offers her customers, it is going well for her. Right now she is a little bit sick, but this doesn't stop her from working a lot to get ahead. That is why she is asking for a loan again to reinforce her business. Her goal is to beat her illness, a family problem, as well as improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: clothing, sandals and perfumes.

loans.name: Gavina Deysis

texts.es:
Gavina de 59 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad, el cual estudia en la universidad. Ella es originaria de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos desde muy joven trabajara para ayudar con los gastos de hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para cumplir con sus sueños de ver formado en profesional a su hijo, fruto de su esfuerzo su entrega, y dedicación a su negocio y su familia.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, jugos, gaseosas, tiste, pozol, hielo. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Gavina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y  países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Gavina is 59 years old. She is a single mother who has one son under her responsibility. He is in college. She is from Malpaisillo, a place that is located in  the western part of the country. She is described as hardworking, responsible, and eager to get ahead personally. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, sine she was very young, she has worked to help with the household expenses. With her activity she fights day to day to make her dreams come true and see her son graduate from college, a result of her dedication to her business and family.  

Thanks to her hard work and eagerness to get ahead, she has the financial activity of a "pulpería", which is a small store where she sells food products such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juice, soda, tiste, pozol, and ice. She works at her business about 12 hours a day offering her products. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling food products so that in the near future she can obtain better income. Gavina is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer people of low income and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling food products. such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juice, soda, tiste, pozol, and ice.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
Martha de 29 años de edad, no tiene un grado académico alto solo estudio hasta 3º grado,esta acompañada; su compañero de vida trabaja de albañil,  son padres de 3 hijos, dos hijos van a la escuela el mas pequeño se queda con ellos.

Ella se dedica  a vender tamales de elote y pisques ya tiene mas de dos  años de realizarlo, lo aprendió de su madre. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar maíz, elote, frijol, para elaborar sus tamales,  ya que tiene bastante encargo,mejorara porque tendrá mejores ingresos y cubrirá las necesidades de su familia.

El objetivo es que sus hijos tengan mejor vida y darles una mejor educación, ya que ella no pudo,las ganancias las utilizara para el estudio de sus hijos y cancelar las cuotas en credicampo.
texts.en:
29-year old Martha doesn't have a very high level of education as she only attended school to grade 3. She is married; her husband works in construction. They have three children, two of whom attend school and a third who stays at home.

Martha sells stuffed corn tamales and has already had the job for two years. She learned the work from her mother.

She plans to use the loan to buy maize, sweet corn, and beans to make the tamales. She has many orders which will lead to a bigger income and the ability to buy what her family needs.

Martha hopes that her children will have a better life and education than she had. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education and pay off her loan.

loans.use: Buy maize, sweet corn, and beans to make tamales

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara de 39 años de edad,  no estudio mucho hasta 6º grado ya sus padres no la apoyaron,esta acompañada su esposo trabaja de albañil,vive con sus dos hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela.


Ella se dedica desde hace  años a la elaboración y venta de tamales de pollo,el negocio se lo inculco su madre y también debido a la situación económica, su hija la mayor le ayuda a repartir su venta en el mercado.

El préstamo lo utilizara para poner otro puesto en el mercado de tamales y pagarle a otra persona para que le venda,de esa forma tendrá mejores ingresos y la necesidad quedara satisfecha.

El objetivo de la cliente es seguir incrementando su negocio y que su familia no le falte nada y seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Sara is 39 years old. She doesn't have a lot of schooling and only went up to the 6th grade because her parents didn't support her. She is married and her husband is a bricklayer. She lives with her two children who are in school. 

For several years, she has worked making and selling chicken tamales. Her mother taught her the business and her older daughter helps her sell in the market. 

She will use the loan to open another tamale stall in the market and to pay for another person to sell them. This way, she will have more income and she can fulfill her needs.

The client's objective is to keep growing her business and for her family to lack for nothing and keep working with the institution.

loans.use: to open another tamale stall in the market and to pay for another person to sell them.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 22-year-old single man, who is the sole breadwinner to two members of his family.  David has a pickup which he started driving for the past three years to transport anything from one place to another in his region. David's responsibilities are increasing, that's why he has to work on developing his business in a well managed way to make its income enough to cover his family's needs.

To develop his business, David has to cover more regions, that's why he has to register his truck in order to have the license to cover wider regions.  Thus, for this reason David is requesting a YOUTH Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to register his car legally so that it can be used freely over the Lebanese borders, and to change its tires to keep it a good shape.

He hopes to expand his business more and more so that he can buy a bigger truck in the future.

loans.use: To register his car legally so that it can be driven freely over the Lebanese borders, and to change its tires to keep it a good shape

loans.name: Analie

texts.en: Analie is 27 years old, married with 2 children and they live in Del Pilar, Baliangao, Mis. Occ.  She has been engaged in hog raising for the past 3 years.  She joined  Paglaum this year and applied for a loan in Paglaum for the amount of 3,000 PHP to use to purchase bags of feed for her piglets.  The profit she earns from her business will be saved to Paglaum in preparation for college tuition for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is a 35 year old married man. He has 2 children.  He describes himself to be humble, honest and focused.  He operates a food café where he cooks food for sale.  He has been involved in this business for 7 years.  His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are individuals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices.  He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy stocks of ingredients for preparing food he sells.  His business goal is to have more business outlets within 5 years.  He hopes that in the future, he will be successful.  This is his sixth loan with SMEP DTM.  Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy stocks of ingredients for preparing food he sells

loans.name: Floredelyn

texts.en: Floredelyn earns a living from selling goods in her retail store while working in a private company.  Her parents help her in watching her store.  She earns a good income from this business.  To add inventory capital, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more grocery items to sell.  She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of providing better living and to improve the general situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat is a 36-year-old married mother of two children, whom she works hard to provide the necessary living needs and the best education. 
Mirvat is a hard worker; six years ago she started her own business from her house by selling women's accessories in order to support her husband in covering their children's educational expenses. 

She is well known in the region with her special prices and quality of products sold. Today, and as usual, Mirvat is applying for her seventh loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, where she is a member in good standing as a borrower who has successfully paid back loans..
Her applied for loan is requested to pay for her children's increasing school tuition fees and will invest part of the loan in increasing her business merchandise with newly released collections.  Her previous loans were all invested in paying for school tuition fees, since education is their main aim.

loans.use: To pay for her children's increasing school tuition fees and invest part of the loan in increasing her business merchandise with newly released collections

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 32-year-old married father of two children.  He is a Palestinian refugee, who has been working as a barber for the past fourteen years. 
Mohamad is well known in his region with the good reputation he has developed and special talents in his domain.  He seeks perfection in both his social and economic situations, especially to provide his family and beloved children the best living and education ever.

Thus for this reason, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children's increasing school fees.  Mohamad hopes to stay capable of improving his family's socioeconomic situation to make sure their dreams come true.

loans.use: To pay for his children's increasing school fees

loans.name: Rosemay

texts.en: Rosemay has been involved in a variety store business.  She has run this business for the past four years.  Rosemay is happily married with two children.  She aims to have a profitable business and have a better standard of living.  In realization of her dreams, she is seeking financial support amounting to PHP 5,000 which will be used to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, beverages, canned goods and soft drinks to sell.  She will be grateful if her requested loan will be granted.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as cooking oil, beverages, canned goods and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Diana Paola

texts.es:
Existe una persona llamada Diana Paola, la cual tiene en el corazón ayudar a las personas que sufren, ella cuando era pequeña sufrió mucho, cuando la tuvieron que operar por algo que ella sufría, ella fue maltratada en diferentes aspectos así que quería ayudar a las personas que también sufrieran de algo que doliera, ayudar con palabras dulces, ya que las enfermeras que la atendieron a ella no lo hicieron con el amor que ella quería. Termino de estudiar y empezó a trabajar para poder ayudar a la persona que más quería, la mama, en el trabajo siempre la regañaban y le decían que no servía para nada., un día decidió renunciar y conseguir otro trabajo, en ese tampoco le fue muy bien, así que decidió nuevamente renunciar. Fue así hasta que un día le salido un trabajo el cual era para cuidar un abuelo de 93 años., ella comenzó a trabajar desde los 12 años así que para ella no era tan difícil el entender el trabajo, después decidió renunciar porque el sueldo no le alcanzaba para estudiar ya que ese era el sueño, consiguió otro trabajo al cual le pagaban mas pero era muy pesado ya que le tocaba cuidar a un señor de noche y el horario era un poco pesado, en este tiempo ella duro un mes sin trabajo, peor se dio cuenta que todos los trabajos eran para cuidar señores de la tercera edad, es por eso que un día ella decide averiguar en Campo Alto por el programa de AUXILIAR DE ENFERMERÍA, ella muy entusiasmada averiguo todo sobre ese programa y decidió que era lo que quería estudiar, pero ahora ella se encuentra en un pequeño dilema y es que como trabaja muy lejos no le alcanza la plata, ya que vive pagando deudas y una pequeña parte de arriendo, es por eso que ella se entera del convenio de kiva y le parece una buena opción para ella poder terminar la carrera y salir adelante. 

Ella realmente quiere estudiar, ya que el mayor anhelo es ayudar a que los pacientes tengan un mayor trato de parte de las enfermeras, ella cuando trabajaba con los abuelos se dio cuenta que el trato a los pacientes no era el adecuado, ya que ella tuvo que cuidar en clínicas a los abuelos y las enfermeras no los trataban con cariño, ella espera que todo le salga bien y que pueda tener el propio hogar para cuidar a los abuelos que necesitan mucho amor.
texts.en:
There is a person named Diana Paola, who has a big heart and wants to help people who are suffering. When she was younger, she suffered a lot. She required an operation and was mistreated in various ways, so now she wants to help people who are suffering from something. She wants to help with kind words since the nurses that treated her did not treat her with the love that she wanted.

She finished school and began working so that she could help her mother, who is the person who loves her the most, but her bosses always scolded her and told her she was good for nothing. One day, she decided to quit and look for another job. This didn't go well for her either, so she decided to quit again. One day, she got a job caring for a 93-year-old grandfather. She began to work when she was 12 years old, so it wasn't difficult for her to understand the work. Later, she decided to quit because the salary wasn't enough to cover her education, which was her dream. 

She found another job that paid more, but was very difficult since she had to care for a man at night and the schedule was difficult. This time, she did not have a job for a month, and she realized that all of the jobs involved caring for senior citizens at night. This is why she decided to look into Campo Alto for their nursing assistant program. She was very excited to learn about this program and decided that this was what she wanted to study.

Now, she has a small dilemma because she works far away and does not have enough money, since she has debts and needs to pay rent. She learned about Kiva and it seems to be a good option so that she can finish her studies and move forward.

She wants to study since her dream is to help patients to be treated better by nurses. When she worked with senior citizens, she realized that the treatment of patients was not adequate. She worked in clinics and the nurses did not treat the senior citizens with care. She hopes that everything goes well and that she can have her own home to care for senior citizens, who need love.

loans.use: to pay school fees for a semester.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: Dora es socia del grupo “Mujeres Triunfadoras” constituida por 08 personas activas y responsables la cual pasan a su 7mo ciclo. Dora de 48 años es casada. Hace 10 años que Dora se dedica al reciclaje de madera. Este negocio le ha permitido a  Dora apoyar a sus padres, pues ha tenido que esforzarse con su pareja para salir adelante. Su mayor deseo es de poner un puesto fijo donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito pues comprará pintura, thinner y goma.  El grupo “Mujeres Triunfadoras” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito, pues le  permite su desarrollo. Dora se encuentra en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado derecho,  viste polo celeste.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the "Mujeres Triunfadores" ("Triumphant Women") group, which is made up of 8 active and responsible people, who are on their seventh loan.

Dora is 48 years old and married. Ten years ago, Dora began working by recycling wood. This business has allowed Dora to support her parents, since she has had to work with her husband so that they can move forward.

Her dream is to open a stand where she can sell her products. With the goal of continuing to improve, she has requested this loan to purchase paint, paint thinner, and rubber.

The Triumphant Women group thanks everyone who made this loan possible because it has facilitated their development. Dora is the woman wearing the blue polo, second from the right in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase paint, paint thinner, and rubber.

loans.name: Fakhri

texts.en:
Fakhri is a 24-year-old married father of one child. He is a Palestinian refugee who has been working as a taxi driver for six years. His business is his only source of income. That's why he is working hard to develop it properly, in order to work freely to make sure that his income is increasing which is necessary to develop his family's socioeconomic situation.

Fakhri is applying for his fifth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, as a YOUTH loan in order to pay what is left on the price of his car in order to register it legally as his own and to work in a wider region.

Fakhri's previous loans helped him a lot in developing his family's living, and he is working hard to keep on developing it as much as he can.

loans.use: To pay what is left on the price of his car in order to register it legally  and to work in a wider region

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
Jawad is a 25-year-old married father of one child. He is a Palestinian refugee who lives and works in a Palestinian camp since he was born in Lebanon. Jawad is a hard worker who is putting much effort toward developing his family's living, since Palestinians are suffering from limited access to some businesses, working sectors and services in Lebanon.

Jawad has been an Al Majmoua borrower for six consecutive cycles. His previous loans helped him in developing his family's living through buying a car and using it for rental purposes as an additional income business, which reflected positively on his beloved family's socioeconomic situation.

Jawad has worked as a barber for thirteen years. He was only twelve years old when he had to quit school and start working for his family's living. In 2006, he established his own barber shop, which he is currently running. He is working hard on developing it in a well-managed way.

Today, Jawad is acquiring a  YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his business merchandise through starting selling perfumes as an additional income business which is attractive to his current customers, and is a step forward towards developing his business career and diversifying his services.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise through starting selling perfumes

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old single man, who has been working as a car mechanic for eight years. In January, 2013, Ahmad established his current business, in order to increase his income and develop his beloved family's living, since he is the sole breadwinner to three members of his family.
Ahmad is a man with a very good reputation in his region.  His special talents in his domain provided him with customers' trust and support.
Today, Ahmad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary spare parts that he needs to develop his business and reply faster to customers' needs and requests.
He is willing to keep on expanding his business through buying advanced and developed machines and tools, in addition to special scanners.  That will improve his work and satisfy his customers.

loans.use: To buy necessary spare parts that he needs to develop his business and reply faster to customers' needs and requests

loans.name: Lmc Group

texts.en:
Limbania is the featured borrower of LMC group.  She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been best friends since they arrived in Lebanon to work as house keepers in order to help their beloved ones' living conditions.

Limbania is a 38-year-old married mother of three children.  She is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her beloved children's increasing school tuition fees. Education is very important for her.  That's why she is working hard to cover its increasing fees to make sure that her children will benefit from a brighter future.
Limbania is the first lady at the far right side of the picture.  As for the other group members, Maribel is the lady at the center of the picture, and Carlyn is the one standing at the far left side of the picture.

loans.use: To pay for her beloved children's increasing school tuition fees

loans.name: Smart 2 Group

texts.en:
Lea is the featured borrower of Smart 2 group.  She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been best friends since they arrived in Lebanon to work as house keepers, in order to help their beloved ones' living conditions.
Lea is a 47-year-old divorced mother of three children.  She is a Filipino citizen who is acquiring a loan to pay for her beloved children's increasing school tuition fees. Education is very important for her.  That's why she is working hard as a housekeeper to cover its increasing fees, to make sure that her children will benefit from a brighter future.
Lea is the lady at the center of the picture.  As for the other group members, Jenny is the lady at the right side of the picture, and Estelita is the lady at the far left side of the picture.

loans.use: To pay for her beloved children's increasing school tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to make mugs and other products.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 28-year-old single man, who is the sole breadwinner for five members of his family. He has been selling and repairing mobile phones, SIM cards and electronics such as DVDs and CDs for eleven years.

Bilal opened his own business in 2004 and he's very proud that he took this step forward since his family's needs are increasing and he has to make sure that he is capable of covering them in a well-managed way.

Bilal is requesting a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua for the fifth time, in order to increase his business merchandise with specially priced mobile phone prepaid cards and new released accessories to increase his income and develop his business.

His previously acquired loans helped him a lot in diversifying his products and increasing his business capital. Bilal is a borrower in good standing. He's a man with a good reputation and is recommended to deal with. 

He seeks the best for his family members and for friends. Bilal hopes to expand his business and to have a small family of his own in the future.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with specially priced mobile phone prepaid cards and newly released accessories

loans.name: Emelina Gladis

texts.es: Emelina tiene 52 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 27 años, hijo de de 26 años y su pequeña nieta de 5 años de edad. Como muchas mujeres Salvadoreñas la principal fuente de ingresos de Emelina es la venta de tortillas (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz) las cuales comercializa en su hogar de habitación. Este negocio es el que por muchos años le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar a sus hijos lo necesario quienes ahora son mayores de edad y apoyan con la economía del hogar. Emelina ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un muro de retención y para construir el techo del patio de la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro.
texts.en: Emelina is 52 years old and lives in her own house with her 27 year old daughter, her 26 year old son and her young granddaughter who is 5 years old. Like many Salvadorean women, her main source of income is selling tortillas (food preparation based on corn dough), which she sells from her house. For many years this business has allowed her to support her household and give what is needed to her children, who are now adults and help with the household finances. Emelina has made the decision to request a loan to FUSAI in order to invest it in building a retaining wall and to build the roof of the patio of her house. For this she needs materials such as: galvanized sheet, cement, sand, brick and iron.

loans.use: To buy galvanized sheet, cement, sand, brick and iron to build a retaining wall and the patio roof of the house.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 49 years old, presently residing in SWP, Calamba, Mis.Occ. She is married and has four school-aged children.  She earns a living with floral gardening and earns Php 5,000 every harvest. She joined Paglaum in 2012.  She applied for a loan through Paglaum  to purchase floral fertilizer. 

Hannah hopes to live comfortably and have enough savings in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase flower fertilizer

loans.name: Cool Girls 2 Group

texts.en:
Mabrenda is the featured borrower of Cool Girls 2 group.  She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been best friends since they arrived in Lebanon to work as house keepers, in order to improve their beloved ones' living conditions in their home in the Philippines.
Mabrenda is a 44-year-old divorced mother of two children.  She is a Filipino citizen who is acquiring a loan to pay for her beloved childrens' increasing university tuition fees. Education is very important for her.  That's why she is working hard as a housekeeper to cover its increasing fees, to make sure that her children will benefit from a brighter future.
Mabrenda is the lady standing at the far left side of the picture with a jeans jacket.  As for the other group members, Jovilyn is the second from the right with the white top, Connie is the lady at the center of the picture, Angelita is the lady at the far right side of the picture with a yellow top, and Maria Carla is the second from the left.

loans.use: To pay for her children's increasing university tuition fees

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is an 18-year-old single Palestinian refugee, who lives and works in a Palestinian Camp.  Hanan has been running a clothes sale shop for the past year.  She also sells at the same shop, furniture as an additional business sector, which is extremely different from clothing, so that she can fulfill customer's different needs.

Hanan is ambitious and seeks to develop her family's living standards, that's why she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with newly released spring/summer collections to develop her business and attract new customers.  Her good reputation in her region supports her a lot and keeps her willing to improve her business and develop her living.  Hanan is very anxious about this loan since it will be her first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower and she is planning based on her future expected loan.  She will work hard on managing both businesses in a more organized way.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with newly released spring/summer collections to develop her business and attract new customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more grocery goods and renovate his shop.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 49 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children who are now at adult or school-aged. 

Rosita has a little store and sells groceries and other consumable products and earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. 

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries and consumable products for retailing

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business, transporting customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are of all types. 

Anthony describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy fuel and spare parts to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk (motorcycle with a covered sidecar) within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Verdun 2 Group

texts.en:
Rose Marie is the featured borrower of Verdun 2 group.   She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been best friends since they arrived in Lebanon to work as house keepers.  They wanted to improve their beloved ones' living conditions in their hometown in the Philippines.
Rose Marie is a 49-year-old  divorced mother of two children.  She is a Filipino citizen who is acquiring a loan to pay for her beloved children's increasing school tuition fees. Education is very important for her.  That's why she is working hard as a housekeeper to cover its increasing fees to make sure that her children will benefit from a brighter future.
Rose Marie is the lady at the center of the picture.  As for the other group members, Bethel is the first lady standing at the right side of the picture, Shalimar is the second lady from the right with a white top, Jerlyn is the second lady from the left with a white top, and Nila is the lady standing at the far left side of the picture, with eyeglasses.

loans.use: To pay for her beloved children's increasing school tuition fees

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old married father of one child, who has been working in selling glass and mirrors since nine years ago. Ahmad is a hardworking man who seeks perfection in his domain. He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. It will be his fourth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower with a good standing paying back history.

Ahmad works in selling and installing glass panels and mirrors. His acquired loan will be invested in developing his business through buying a special car necessary for his business development so that he can transport his business materials from one project to another.

He hopes to establish a wider working place and increase his business capital.

loans.use: to develop his business through buying a special car necessary to transport his business needs from one project to another.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 50-year-old married mother of five children. She has been working in a tailoring business since 25 years ago to help her husband with their income and covering their children's expenses.

Fatima is a hardworking woman with a very good reputation in her region because of her long experience in her domain. She is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy necessary fabrics requested for a project she is working on. 

This is Fatima's second loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Her previous loan was requested for the same reason and it came with a positive impact on her business development. Her business is located at home to make sure that she is taking care of both her family and her business development at the same time.

She hopes that the future loan will be also invested in developing her business more and more.

loans.use: to buy requested fabrics for a project she is working on.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 64 años de edad, soltera sin hijos menores de edad, es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar estudios,  desde muy joven trabaja, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad sigue luchando día a día para mantenerse económicamente.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de granos básicos, como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, cereal, cacao, aceite, jabón,  El dedica a su negocio una diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. el negocio lo desempeña de forma ambulante y por encargo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de granos básicos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Juan agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juan, age 64, is single and doesn’t have dependent children.  He comes from Leon, a place located in the western part of the country.  He is known for being hardworking and responsible, with a desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, he couldn’t go to school.  He worked from a very young age to help with the household expenses.  Currently, he keeps fighting day to day to support himself financially.

Thanks to his efforts and his desire to get ahead, he works selling staples such as beans, rice, sugar, cereal, cacao, oil, and soap.  He works ten hours a day selling his merchandise.  He carries out his business by special order and as a mobile vendor.  

The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and to stock his business buying and selling staples, so that in the not-so-distant future he can have a better income.  Juan is thankful for the help that Kiva investors give to people with limited resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua, to be able to have a decent way to work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock his business buying and selling staples such as beans, rice, sugar, cereal, cacao, oil, and soap

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es:
Esta la historia de Imelda, una madre cabeza de hogar la cual entrego toda su vida a Dios, a su trabajo y a sus 6 hijos, los cuales los crió, alimento y educo con su negocio de venta de legumbres. Pero que hace tan especial a esta mujer? -Imelda nunca tuvo un negocio fijo pues ella vende sus productos por todo Medellín, si, esta es la historia de una madre soltera que día a día madruga a las 4 de la mañana a la plaza para surtir una carreta la cual empuja por diferentes zonas residenciales de la ciudad de Medellín, una mujer de admirar, un claro ejemplo de una madre preocupada por sus hijos que se sacrifica diariamente para darles la mejor calidad vida posible, ella es un claro ejemplo de por qué los hombres no son el sexo dominante, de que una persona con determinación, ambición y firmeza puede lograr cada meta que se propone con los recursos que tiene a la mano. Hoy en día se enfrenta con diferentes dificultades, una de ellos es el invierno el cual hace que su carreta sea más pesada y difícil de llevar, disminuye sus ventas y le genera mayor cansancio debido al esfuerzo físico que tiene que emplear para transportar su carreta por su acostumbrada ruta de trabajo.
Los recursos solicitados son para comprar una motocicleta y así sea más fácil el desplazamiento por  la ciudad, generando un empleo a uno de sus hijos y aumentando las ventas, ya que sueño es dejarle un negocio estable y rentable  a su descendencia.
texts.en:
This is the story of Imelda, who is the head of her household. She has handed over her life to God, her job, and her 6 children, whom she has raised, fed, and supported with her vegetable sales business. 

What makes this woman special? Imelda never had a fixed business location, so she sold her products all over Medellín. This single mother wakes up every day at 4 a.m. to stock her cart, which she pushes all over different residential zones in Medellín. She is an admirable woman and a perfect example of a mother who worries for her children and makes sacrifices every day to give them the best quality of life that she can. She is a perfect example of why men are not the dominant sex. She is a determined, ambitious, and tenacious woman who can achieve any goal with the resources that she has.

Today, she faces many challenges. One of them is winter, which makes her cart heavier and more difficult to push. It reduces her sales and causes her to be tired due to the physical exertion of pushing her cart along her route.

The loan that she has requested will be used to purchase a motorcycle so that it will be easier for her to take her products around the city. It will also provide one of her children with a job and will increase sales. Her dream is to leave a stable and profitable business to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle so that it will be easier to move her products around the city.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 45 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married and has three adult-aged and two school-aged children.

 Julieta  has a retail business. She has been doing this for five  years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional inventory like canned goods, rice and noodles.  Julieta  has been a member of PMPC for  six months. In the future, Julieta hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory like canned goods, rice and noodles

loans.name: Barcha

texts.ru: Барча, 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Старшие дети самостоятельны, а младшие учатся в школе. У Барчы- среднее образование,она знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. Барча в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством  животноводством. Стартовав 16 лет назад с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Барчы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 80 овец. Для содержания скота есть все условия: сарай и отгонные пастбища.  Сено и корма для скота заготовлены в достаточном количестве. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Барча обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом на покупку минеральных удобрений, на вспаханной и удобренной земле она планирует выращивать хлопок и арбузы. Доходы от кредита позволят  Барче нарастить активы и улучшить уровень жизни. В дальнейшем, она планирует построить дом для сына.
texts.en: Barcha is 51 and married with four children, two of whom live on their own while the other two are still in school. She has a high school education and knows how to correctly use and budget her income in order to reach financial goals. Barcha works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began 16 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has two milking cows and 80 sheep as well as everything necessary to care for them properly, including a shed and pasture and sufficient hay and feed, with a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Barcha has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to purchase fertilizer. On the land she ploughs and fertilizes, she plans to grow cotton and watermelons. Profits from the loan will allow Barcha to increase her assets and improve her quality of life. In the future, she plans to build a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mohammaf

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man from Qabatya, a small village near Jenin city. His family has worked raising sheep for the past fifteen years. It is a very good business and profitable and all the family cooperate together in it. Mohammad would like to improve the farm and expand it.
 
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for the family farm. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve the farm and increase its productivity.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for the family farm.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: Oscar tiene 22 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, su madre, hermana y su pequeña hija de 3 meses de edad. Oscar trabaja como empleado en una empresa cercana a su localidad lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar a su familia lo necesario. Actualmente, en la vivienda no poseen el servicio de agua potable y luz eléctrica para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación del servicio del vital líquido y de la energía eléctrica y así poder dar a su familia principalmente a su hija mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Oscar is 22 years old and lives in a house he owns together with his life partner, his mother, his sister, and his 3 month old daughter.  Oscar works as an employee of a nearby business in his town, which allows him to support his household and give his family what they need.  

Currently, his home does not have potable water or electricity services, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the installation of water services and electricity so that he can give his family and his daughter better living conditions.

loans.use: to install potable water and electricity services in his home.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es: Felicitas de 49 años de edad es separada  con 03 hijos independientes, actualmente pertenece al grupo “Virgen De Copacabana”  conformada por 13 socios responsables y emprendedores. Felicitas se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Con el fin de mejorar su local y ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar y aceite. Su mayor deseo es de seguir implementando su negocio.  El grupo “Virgen De Copacabana” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Felicitas es la tercera del lado izquierdo, y viste blusa negro.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 49 years old, separated, and has three adult children.  She is a member of the Virgen de Copacabana group, made up of 13 responsible and enterprising members.  

Felicitas works selling groceries.  With the goal of improving her store and helping with the household expenses, she is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar, and oil.  Her greatest wish is to continue working at her store.  

The Virgen de Copacabana group is grateful to everyone who made this loan possible.  Felicitas is the third from the left, dressed in a black shirt.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Obaida

texts.en:
Obaida is a 23-year-old single man from Tubas, a small village near Nablus city. He lives with his parents in a small house. Obaida's family works in agriculture. They have a piece of land where they plant seasonal fruits and vegetables. Obaida is a student, studying Business Administration. 

Obaida took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Obaida will be able to complete his studies and find a job in the future.
 
Obaida appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Kumush

texts.en: Kumush is kind woman who is a widowed. She is a careful mother of 3 children. Kumush has been busy growing agricultural products during many years. Kumush has her own land where she grows agricultural products. She grows vegetables such as potatoes, onions, carrots, etc. Kumush has great experience in this field. She manages the business alone. Her business is the only source of the family income. She wants to make new sowing but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the new season.

loans.name: Sumbuloy

texts.en: Sumbuloy was born in 1981. She is a hardworking and industrious woman. Sumbuloy is married and has 5 children. Sumbuloy’s children are not adults. Her husband is an entrepreneur. He sells food items. Sumbuloy has never had her own business. She always dreamed of starting a business. Now, she is going to start a business selling fabrics. She will sell her goods in a local market and her husband will help her to manage the business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy fabrics for starting the new business. This loan will help her to organize a little business in Tajikistan.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for starting a new business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a single mother of four children, two of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 9 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from rental rooms and bricklaying. She works in a market seven days out of every week and sells both at retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She is aspiring to own a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to sell at  wholesale only. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO to acquire more capital and because it was caring for low income people. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 56 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 4 adult-aged children.

Marilyn has a buy and sell business which she has personally taken care of for 10 years. Recently, she has been busy tilling her farmland for added income. In need of additional capital, she has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs. Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Marilyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more livestock in order to raise and resell them.

loans.name: Nohora Hidali

texts.es:
Esta es la historia de una  señora llamada Nohora Hidali que vivía en una casa con los hijos, eran solos porque no tenían el apoyo del esposo, pero ella trabajaba incansable para sacar a los hijos adelante junto con el hijo que le colaboraba, ya que él trabajaba los fines de semana para ayudarlas a pagar los gastos de la casa y de la hermanita menor, ella quiere superarse y decide estudiar COSMETOLOGIA Y ESTETICA CORPORAL para así en un futuro tener el propio spa para poder darle una calidad de vida mejor a los hijos y a ella misma, ya que trabajaba mucho y ganaba muy poco por no tener profesión alguna y así cumplir este sueño.

Ella necesita del subsidio con kiva ya que los pagos que ella puede realizar mensualmente son un poco altos y los gastos que ella tiene en el hogar se incrementan un poco, es por eso que ella quiere ser beneficiada con el convenio que kiva le puede ofrecer. 

Esta es la historia de una persona con deseos de ser alguien en la vida, para no tener necesidades en un futuro y poder brindarle a los hijos una mejor estabilidad.
texts.en:
This is the story of a woman named Nohora Hidali, who lived in a house with her children.  They were all alone, because they didn’t have the support of a husband, but she worked tirelessly to get her children ahead.  She collaborated with her one son, because he worked weekends to help them pay the household expenses and the expenses of his little sister.  She used to work very hard and earn very little, thanks to not having a profession.  
 
Nohora wanted to improve herself and so she decided to study Cosmetology and Body Esthetics, so that in the future she can have her own spa.  In this way, she can give a better quality of life to her children and herself, and so make her dream come true. 

She needs a Kiva loan because the monthly payments that she makes are a little high and the household expenses that she has are increasing a little.  Because of this, she wants to be the recipient of one of the loans that Kiva can offer her.

This is the story of a person with a desire to be someone in life, so that she doesn’t have so many needs in the future and can give her children more stability.

loans.use: to pay for one semester's fees

loans.name: José Edicto

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, solo tienen un hijo el que vive con ellos. 

Él se dedica a la venta de leña (carbón), ya tiene más de 5 años de realizar el negocio, por medio de su padre fue aprendiendo bien el trabajo, también fue de su padre que aprendió que la vida solo es más llevadera cuando se trabaja honradamente. También se dedica a la agricultura, por lo demás no ha tenido otro negocio antes, las distancia que recorre es 1km diario, el recorrido lo hace a pie, también paga quien le ayude a realizar la actividad, el horario de trabajo es de las 6 am a 12 md.  

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de 14,000 metros cuadrados de carbonera, la mejora que tendrá, es el comprar el carbón hoy que esta barato, también con esto mejorara la economía de la pareja ya que no compraran más caro el carbón, la necesidad satisfecha será el tener ya un capital de trabajo.


Los sueños que tiene a futuro es el poder mejorar su casa de habitación, y que su hijo crezca en mejores condicione a las que él se creció,  la ayuda será el poder tener su capital de trabajo, las ganancias serán invertidas en el pago de la cuota y en mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
José, who is 28 years old, went to school through sixth grade. He has a partner, who does the household tasks. They have only one son, who lives with them.

He sells charcoal. He has already had this business for more than five years. He learned this work well through his father. It was also from his father that he learned that life is only more bearable when one works honorably. He also works in agriculture. As a matter of fact, he hasn't had any other business before that. The distance that he travels is 1 km daily. He makes the trip on foot. He also pays whoever helps him to do this work. His work schedule is from 6 am to 12 pm.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of 14,000 square meters of [charcoal from a] charcoal kiln. The best that he will have is the purchase of charcoal today, when it is cheap. With this he will also improve his partner's economy, since they will not buy any more expensive charcoal. The need that is satisfied will be to have working capital.

The dreams he has for the future are to able to improve his house and for his son to grow up in better conditions than those he grew up in. The help will be being able to have his working capital. The earnings will be invested in making the payments and in improving his house.

loans.use: to buy 14,000 square meters [of charcoal] from a charcoal kiln

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
El sonido de las chispas de fuego golpeando sobre el carbón y la pared de piedra del horno de doña Blanca, nos avisa que el pan está listo. Sus marcados 40 años como fabricante y comerciante de pan,  muestran el conocimiento especializado de cuándo es el momento perfecto para producir un producto de calidad. 
Ahora, en sus 58 años de vida, piensa seguir creciendo con el apoyo de su esposo y sus seis hijos; por lo tanto, necesita un préstamo donde pueda cubrir los gastos de la compra de harina, maíz, aceite y todo lo básico para incrementar su producción. Así mismo, pretende reparar su horno, ya que este está deteriorado. Entre sus metas está construir otro horno y comprar uno industrial para repostería, y así seguir dándose a conocer en zonas cercanas, que le permitiran incrementar sus ingresos, mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia y tener la oportunidad de ahorrar por cualquier emergencia.
texts.en:
The sound of the sparks of the fire hitting the coal and the wall of Blanca's brick oven tells us that the bread is ready.  Her 40 years as a bread maker and seller shows her specialized knowledge of when is the perfect moment to produce a quality product.

Now, in her 58 years of life, she wants to continue growing with the support of her husband and six children, so she is requesting a loan to cover the costs of purchasing flour, corn, oil, and all of the supplies to increase her production.  She also wants to repair her oven since it has deteriorated.  Her goals are to build another oven and purchase an industrial oven to make pastries so that she will continue to be well known in nearby areas.  This will allow her to increase her profits, improve her quality of life and her family's and have the opportunity to save for an emergency.

loans.use: to purchase flour, corn, oil, and all the supplies to increase her production.

loans.name: Turibamwe Group

texts.fr:
Lazare  fait partie du groupe Turibamwe  et habite à Gitega. Il a 62 ans et est marie à Claudine, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de  1 an 4 mois  à 11 ans.

Il  fait le commerce de restartant depuis 15 ans.

Il est à son  dix-huitième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital en achetant une grande quantité de haricot,  de riz,  de l’huile de palme à  revendre cuits dans son restaurant, pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, elle voudrait que ses enfants parviennent à réussir les etudies.
texts.en:
Lazare belongs to the Turibamwe group and lives in Gitega. He is 62 years old and married to Claudine, who is a farmer. They have three children together, ranging from one year four months old to 11 years old.

He has been running a restaurant business for the past 15 years and is on his 18th loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is granted he is going to increase his capital by buying a large quantity of beans, rice and palm oil, which he will resell in his restaurant, once cooked, so that he can make more money.

In the coming years, he would like to see his children manage to complete their studies successfully.

loans.use: to increase his capital by buying a large quantity of beans, rice and palm oil, which he will sell once cooked in his restaurant, so that he can make more money.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to care for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, a generator and fabric.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María tiene 55 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 13 años y 4 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de gallinas y además junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo de maíz y frijoles. Son personas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y visionarias quienes desean mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida María ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea invertir en la construcción de un muro de retención, encementar el piso y comprar una ventana con su respectivo balcón. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, una ventana y un balcón.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her husband and their two children, ages 13 and 4.  She works raising and selling chickens, and she also works with her husband growing corn and beans.  They are hardworking, enterprising and visionary people who wish to improve the living conditions of their children.  

With the goal of improving their living conditions, María has decided to request a loan from FUSAI because she wishes to build a retaining wall, pour a concrete floor, and purchase a window with a balcony.  With the requested amount, she will purchase cement, sand, brick, iron, a window and a balcony.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, brick, iron, a window and a balcony to build a retaining wall and pour concrete on the floor of her home.

loans.name: Kilombero Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her late thirties, is single.  For twelve years Rehema has owned a beauty salon.  She depends on this business to pay for her daily welfare.  Rehema works from 08:30am to 08:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Rehema's twelve loan request.  She will the money to buy salon hair products and manage her daily demands. 

With the previous loans all of which she paid back successfully, Rehema improved her business with new working equipments (bought a drier and hair products).  She dreams of improving her business, service more people and generate more income.  Rehema will use the extra income to cover school fees for her young sister and food expenses. 

Rehema will share this loan with her loan  group, ”Kilombero” which included two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon hair products and manage her daily demands.

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en:
Jacklyne is a 33-year-old woman. She has one child. She describes herself as being reliable. 

Jacklyne operates a transport business where she has employed someone to transport customers using her motorcycle. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a residential place and her primary customers are local residents. 

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her child and live comfortably. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of KES 50,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en: Monicah is a 36 year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 12 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells drinks, bread, sweets and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, washing soap, sweets and other items. Her business goal is to have a mini supermarket within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will generate more income. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, washing soap, sweets and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy curtains and other clothes.

loans.name: Haragakiza Group

texts.fr:
Christine  fait partie du groupe  Haragakiza et  habite à  Bubanza. Elle a 33 ans  et est mariée  à  Daniel un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 6 à 14 ans  dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  riz  depuis  10  ans. 

Elle est   son  deuxième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, elle  voudrait  devenir importatrice des habits  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Christine belongs to the Haragakiza group and lives in Bubanza. She is 33 years old and married to Daniel, who is a trader. They have six children together, whose ages range from six to 14 years old; three of the children are at school.

She has been trading in rice for the past ten years and is on her second loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she is granted she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of rice that she can resell to make more money.

In the coming years she would like to become an importer of clothing and see her children through school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of rice to resell, so that she can make more money.

loans.name: Salama Ii Group

texts.fr:
Evariste  fait partie du groupe  Salama II et  habite à  Bubanza. Il a 34 ans  et est marié  à  Suzanne, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de  9 mois à 9 ans  dont 1 étudie.

Il fait le commerce de  poules  et  de charbon de bois   depuis  4  ans. 

Il  est  à son  deuxième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de poules et  de sacs de charbon de bois à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les  prochaines années, il  voudrait  faire l’élevage de vache, acheter une moto et une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Evariste belongs to the Salama group and lives in Bubanza. He is 34 years old and married to Suzanne, who is a trader. They have four children together, whose ages range from nine months old to nine years old; one of the children is at school.

He has been trading hens and charcoal for the past four years, and is on his second loan from Turame. With the loan he gets from Kiva he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of hens and sacks of charcoal which he will resell to earn more money.

In the coming years he would like to start raising cows, buy a motorbike and a plot of land, and also see his children through school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of hens and sacks of charcoal to resell and make more money.

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.fr:
Léonie fait partie du groupe  Amini et  habite à Kayanza. Elle  a 39 ans et  est marié à  Adelin, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants  âgés de 16  à  20 ans, dont 4 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de bière  dans son bistrot  depuis 10 ans. 

Elle est à son quinzième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  bière  à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait acheter un  véhicule  de transport  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Léonie, age 39, is a member of the group Amani. She lives in Kayanza. She is married to a merchant named Adelin, and they have five children aged 16 to 20, four of whom go to school.  

For the past 10 years, Léonie has been selling beer out of her pub. This is her 15th loan cycle with Turame. She plans to use the credit to strengthen her working capital and buy a large supply of beer to bolster her sales and revenue. 

For the coming years, her plans are to purchase a transportation vehicle and see her children continue their education.

loans.use: to strengthen her working capital and buy a large supply of beer to bolster her sales and revenue.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 39 year-old married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be goal oriented. He operates a tailoring shop where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in good environment for the business and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough resources. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more fabric, thread and other tailoring materials. His business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more fabric, thread and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy tools for repairing motor vehicles

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is a 30 year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 6 years. He operates a retail business where he sells livestock. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to add more stock of cows, goats and sheep for sale. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be satisfied. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: add more stock of cows, goats and sheep for sale

loans.name: Al-Habib 3 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Habib 3 and is comprised of six women. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They work as much as they can to improve their living conditions. As a group they applied for a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB.

Rim is the leader of the group. She is 26 years old and married woman with two children. She lives with her children in Hodeidah, Yemen. Her oldest child is five years old and the youngest is age three.  Rim is a hardworking woman who dreams of providing her children with a better future. 

Many years ago, Rim's husband expatriated in Saudi Arabia to provide his family with a lot of money.  Due to the difficult emigration, Rim's husband came back to the home with a little money.  For this reason, Rim started her business as a door to door selling perfumes, incense, and accessories.  She's been in business for three years.

Unfortunately, Rim doesn't have enough money to grow her business, so she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER, from the team's loan amount, to purchase perfumes and incense and resell to customers. 

Rim looks forward to providing her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and incense.

loans.name: Twiyunguruze Iii Group

texts.fr:
Michel  fait partie du groupe Twiyunguruze II  et habite à Bubanza. Il a 56 ans et est marié à Rose, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants dont 2 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de bière de banane depuis  6 mois.

Il est à son  deuxième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière de banane à  revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il  il voudrait faire le commerce de boutique et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Michel belongs to the Twiyunguruze II group and lives in Bubanza. He is 56 years old and married to Rose, who is a trader. They have five children together, two of whom are at school.

He has been trading banana beer for the past six months and is on his second loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he gets he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of banana beer which he will resell to earn more money.

In the coming years he would like to run a shop and see his children through school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of banana beer to resell so that he can earn more money.

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынаре 38 лет, замужем, 2 детей, семья активно помогает по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения хорошие. У Чынары среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2004 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Чынара в хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы и 10 овец, а также есть земельный надел размером 1 ГА, где она выращивает арбуз и кукурузу. Ее сельскохозяйственная деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Чынара входит в группу "Чынара", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. В итоге их трое. Чынара является лидером группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку минеральных удобрений, семян элитных сортов, клеенки, часть средств пойдет на обработку земли и закупку скота. Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в постройку большого сарая для скота, а в будущем хочет приобрести автомобиль.
texts.en:
Chynara is 38 years old, married and has two children.  Everyone in her family pitches-in with the farm work.  Her entire family is very united and everyone is amicable.  Chynara has a high school education and her livestock and farming business provides the main income for her family.  She started this business in 2004 with 20,000 som (KGS).  Thanks for Chynara's hard and persistent work, she currently has two cows and 10 sheep.  She also has a plot of land, with an area of one hectare, where she grows watermelon and corn.  

Her farm work brings approximately 10,000 som (KGS) every month, which is mainly used to purchase food and the necessities for her family.  Also, Chynara is the leader of the "Chynara" group which currently includes two other people.  In order to expand her business, Chynara turned to the bank of Bai Tushum for a loan to purchase fertilizer, seed, and plastic ground cover.  Another part of the loan will be used to purchase livestock.  Profits from her business, Chynara is planning to use for building a barn for the cattle and in the future, she is planning to purchase a car.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed, plastic ground cover and cattle.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 27 year-old single man, living with his family in Taiz, Yemen. He is a University graduate. Because of the unemployment in the country, Mohammed couldn't find a job in order to improve the income of his family. Fortunately, his grandfather assisted him to buy a taxi transport. Now Mohammed works as a driver on the taxi. Because of the spread taxi transports inside the city, the income from this business is very low. Mohammed works 20 hours daily and 7 days a week. He is very active and dynamic. Mohammed wants to improve the condition of his family, but he doesn't have enough money for that. For this reason, Mohammed applied for a loan of 160, 000 YER from AMB in order to purchase refrigerator for the house.
Mohammed looks forward to purchase another taxi transport in order to provide his family with more money.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator for the house.

loans.name: Mkolani Kwanza Mwanza Group

texts.en:
Edwin is aged in his early 30's and is married with three children who are in school. For three years now, Edwin has had a business selling beans, rice and maize. He works from 7 AM to 6 PM per working day and is able to make a small monthly profit.
 
This is his third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Edwin used the previous loans (all of which he paid back successfully) to buy business stock which sold out.  He manages to receive an extra income which he used to cover part of school fees and household expenses. With his new request, he will use to buy stocks of food (rice, beans, and maize).  Edwin dreams of becoming rich. 

He will share this loan with his loan group Mkolani Kwanza which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of food (rice, beans and maize)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a 41 year old married woman who has one child.  She describes herself as a visionary and determined. 

Penina operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services.  She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are individual clients. She describes her biggest business risk as economic challenges. 

Penina will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy beauty products for use in the salon.  Her business goal is to have a large scale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.  Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira was born in 1984. She is married and brings up two little children. 

Shoira is also a business lady. She sells sim-cards in a store. She began this business two years ago. Shoira lives and works in the south part of Tajikistan. Her family’s income is little so she lives poorly. 

Now, she is going to increase working capital and in this way to develop business and maximize profit. From the profit she is going to improve living conditions and send her children to school. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy sim-cards for increasing working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy sim-cards for resale

loans.name: Atse

texts.en:
Atse is a 42-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be industrious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells groceries, washing soap, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years.
