Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are of all ages. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of groceries and other items she sells. Her business goal is to have more business outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of groceries and other items she sells

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Gustavo quien con su credikiva logró comprar mercancías varias y generar utilidades sobre su venta, su negocio ha progresado y cambió su situación económica, lo que ha generado más bienestar familiar. Él está “muy agradecido y pide a los financiadores de Kiva que sigan así”.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva mediante el cual comprará mercancía como ropa camisas, suéteres y cervezas por volumen que traerán a su negocio más utilidades pues estas últimas tienen una buena rentabilidad, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión efectiva
texts.en: Thanks for your previous support for Gustavo, who received an earlier loan with Kiva credit to buy various products in order to generate better sales, and his business has prospered and it has changed his economic situation.  That has led to greater well-being for his family.  He is "very thankful and hopes that the Kiva lenders will continue with their work."  Currently he is applying for a Kiva credit in order to purchase merchandise for his store such as clothing like shirts, sweaters, and also beer in bulk.  These items will help make his business even more profitable, since in recent months he has had brisk business.  This will make his Kiva loan an effective investment.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store such as clothing like shirts, sweaters, and also beer in bulk.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es: Doña Luciana es una mujer de 71 años, dedicada a la actividad comercial desde el año 1963, cuando decidió generar ingresos por sí misma y emprendió su aventura de negocios, vendiendo mercancía variada que le solicitaban sus clientes a un plazo que estos últimos pudieran pagar. Sus principales productos  son los cosméticos, calzado, perfumería, detalles para el hogar y para toda ocasión, que ofrece directamente al consumidor final, mediante ventas de contado y a crédito a través de guías especializadas de productos, durante 8 horas diarias en la vivienda donde habita. Su meta es continuar apoyando a sus hijos en la educación formal, pero du mayor desafío es tener los ingresos suficientes para lograr fortalecer su negocio, generar utilidades y cumplir su sueño de prosperidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará calzado, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios femeninos en el marco de los pedidos que han solicitado a Luciana su más apreciada clientela y que ella está dispuesta a responder, para consentirla y fidelizarla.
texts.en: Luciana is a 71-year-old woman. She has worked as a merchant since 1963, when she decided to generate her own income and launched her business venture. She sells a variety of merchandise which her customers request, on terms they can afford. Her main products are cosmetics, shoes, perfumes, decorative items for the home and for all occasions. She offers these items directly to the final consumer, through cash sales and credit sales through specialized product guides. She works 8 hours a day, and her business is based in her home. Her goal is to continue supporting her children in formal education, but her greatest challenge is to have sufficient income to strengthen her business, generate profits and achieve her dream of prosperity. Currently, Luciana is applying for a Kiva loan to buy shoes, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories, to respond to orders which her best customers have placed with her, and which she would like to fulfill, in order to satisfy them and keep them loyal.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories.

loans.name: Twikenure Group

texts.fr:
Chantal fait partie du groupe Twikenure et habite à Gitega. Elle a 33 ans et est mariée à Désiré,un  menuisier. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 7 à 15 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de sorgho depuis 15 ans.

Elle est à son vingtième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de sorgho à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, elle voudrait que ses enfants parviennent à réussir les étudies.
texts.en:
Chantal, age 33, is a member of the group Twikenure and she lives in Gitega. She is married to a carpenter named Désiré, and they have five children aged 7 to 15 years old.   

Chantal has been a reseller of sorghum for 15 years. This is her 20th loan cycle with Turame. She plans to use this credit to strengthen her working capital and buy a large quantity of sorghum to bolster hers sales and revenue. 

In the coming years, she hopes to see her children pursue their studies successfully.

loans.use: to strengthen her working capital and buy a large quantity of sorghum to bolster her sales and revenue.

loans.name: Tunezerwe Group

texts.fr:
Etienne fait parti du groupe Tunezerwe et habite à Gitega. Il a 66 ans et est marié à Hélène une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants  dont 4 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de clous depuis 45 ans.

Il est à son dix-septième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de kilos de clous à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Etienne, age 66, is a member of the group Tunezerwe and he lives in Gitega. He is married to a farmer named Hélène, and they have six children together, four of whom go to school.  

Etienne has been selling nails for 45 years.  

This is his 17th loan cycle with Turame. He plans to use this credit to strengthen his working capital and buy many kilos of nails to bolster his sales and revenue.

loans.use: to strengthen his working capital and buy many kilos of nails to bolster his sales and revenue.

loans.name: Francisco Adan

texts.es:
Francisco, requiere de más capital para comprar leña por mayor, para luego revenderla a sus clientes, espera seguir aumentando sus ventas e ingresos, con su economía establecida cumplirá con sus compromisos económicos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar su inventario y obtener más ingresos, su familia se encuentra en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en: Francisco needs a loan in order to purchase firewood in bulk.  He then will resell it to his customers.  He hopes to continue increasing his sales and income.  With his business established, he will be able to meet the repayment terms for his loan.  His previous credit was used to increase his inventory and to obtain more earnings.  His family is in a good situation now.

loans.use: To buy firewood in bulk.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, desempeña varias actividades con el fin de tener recursos económicos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, se dedica a la albañilería y es jornalero estos oficios los aprendió de amistades, cuenta con 13 años de experiencia; además desde hace 3 años vende semilla de marañón, vive con su compañera de vida.
El financiamiento será de utilidad para comprar semilla de marañón, bolsas y mano de obra, tendrá la materia prima elaborar la venta, espera finalizar los procesos de su productos en menor tiempo, aumentar sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos que serán el respaldo para cancelar su deuda.
Su visión es fortalecer el negocio con otro rubro, para tener la oportunidad de comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
José works in various activities with the aim of having enough income to cover his family's needs.  He works as a brick layer and is a day laborer.  He learned these jobs from friends.  He has 13 years of experience.  In addition, for the past three years has has sold cashews.  He lives with his life partner.  

His loan will be used to purchase cashews, as well as bags and manual labor.  That will give him the raw materials for his sales.  He hopes to finish the processing of his products in less time, to increase his sales and to have better income that will allow him to repay his debt.  His vision is to strengthen his business in order to be able to buy his own home.

loans.use: To buy cashews and bags, and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Delmy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Delmy, ha tenido un aumento de clientes, ventas y ganancias, pues con el crédito anterior surtió de productos frescos y de calidad su negocio. Su familia vive en mejores circunstancias.
Requiere de un nuevo préstamo para comprar queso, crema, cuajada, leche, etc., le será de ayuda para satisfacer a sus clientes y continuar mejorando su servicio.
texts.en:
Delmy has seen an increase in her clientele, sales and earnings, since the previous loan allowed her to stock her business with fresh, high-quality products. Her family now lives in better circumstances. 

She needs a new loan to buy cheese, cream, curds, milk, etc. This will be useful to her in order to satisfy her customers and continue improving her service.

loans.use: to buy cheese, cream, curds, milk, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Para María el maíz es su principal fuente de trabajo. Su jornada diaria consiste en ir a moler el maíz muy de mañana para obtener la masa, la que es el ingrediente principal para la elaboración de sus riquísimos tamales. Ella es originaria del departamento de Chinandega y tiene tres hijos. Con la ayuda de su madre, logró administrar bien el dinero recibido por una pensión, lo que la ha llevado a sobrevivir económicamente desde hace nueve años.
Ella solicita el financiamiento para incrementar la compra de maíz, materia prima con la que sobrevive, además anhela aumentar la venta de sus tamales. María es una mujer soñadora y capaz; sus hijos son su fuerza, ella quiere brindarles un futuro prospero. Una de sus metas es comprar un activo fijo, como una caponera para poder distribuir su producto a toda Chinandega.
texts.en:
For María, corn is her primary source of work.  Her daily routine consists of going to mill the corn early in the morning to make masa, which is the main ingredient for making her delicious tamales.  She is a native of the Chinandega region, and has three children.  With the help of her mother, she was able to properly manage the money she received from a pension, which has allowed her to survive financially over the past nine years.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase more corn, the raw material with which she survives, she also wants to increase her tamales sales.  María is a dreamer and a capable woman.  Her children give her her strength, and she wants to give them a prosperous future.  One of her goals is to purchase a fixed asset such as a cart to be able to distribute her products throughout Chinandega.

loans.use: purchase corn.

loans.name: María Víctorina

texts.es:
María  de 42 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tres de sus cuatro hijos, de los cuales dos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad el nivel básico, su esposo trabaja en la elaboración de hamacas desde joven y también en la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y sorgo), de ella dependen sus tres hijos que están con ella en el hogar.

María se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas desde hace ya mas de 25 años, cuando su madre y luego su esposo le enseñaron las artesanías de hilo y es así como ella ha ido mejorando cada día su oficio principal pues de las hamacas de donde ella obtiene  ingresos para el desarrollo de la familia, además hace ventas de pan y de tamales que posteriormente sale a vender  a la comunidad, en la elaboración de hamacas le ayuda su esposo y sus hijos quienes apoyan en el trabajo para terminarlas mas rápido y así ir a comercializarlas a la ciudad los fines de semana.
Trabaja generalmente por las tardes cuando ella ha terminado de hacer los oficios en el hogar.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar materiales de construcción, ya que esta en proceso de construcción de una fosa donde hacer los baños para el hogar, comprara arena, bloque, cemento, hierro, piedra y para cancelar la mano de obra que le construira los baños.

El crédito le permitirá tener  su propio baño y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.


María sueña con apoyar a sus hijos para salir adelante con sus estudios y que ellos logren un mejor nivel académico, pues ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, además esta dentro sus objetivos seguir trabajando en las artesanías y la venta de tamales y pan para con ello ir mejorando su vivienda poco a poco, pues tiene ya dos años de estar trabajando con créditos y es así como ha ido mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three of their four children.  Two of her children study at the local school at the basic level.  Her husband has worked making hammocks since he was young and also works as a farmer planting corn, beans, and sorghum.  The three children who live at home depend on her for support.

María has worked making hammocks for more than 25 years when her mother and later her husband taught her the art of making thread.  She has been improving her work every day since making hammocks is how she supports her family.  She also sells bread and tamales in her community.  Her husband and her children help her make hammocks so that they can finish more quickly and sell them in the city on the weekends.  She generally works in the afternoons when she finishes her house work.

She is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials since she is in the process of building a septic tank for the household bathrooms.  She will purchase sand, blocks, cement, iron, and stone, and pay for laborers to build the bathrooms.  The loan will allow her to have her own bathroom and give her family a better quality of life.

María dreams of supporting her children so that they can continue forward with their studies and achieve a higher level of education, since she did not have the opportunity to attend school.  She also hopes to continue working on her handicrafts and selling tamales and bread so that she can continue improving her home little by little.  She has been working with loans for two years and it is how she has been improving her home.

loans.use: to purchase sand, blocks, cement, iron, stone, and to pay laborers to build bathrooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies to care for her crops.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is a woman who has a kind heart. She is a careful mother of two children. Her children are little. 

Shoira’s husband is a migrant in Russia, so Shoira manages all the home’s problem alone. Her children Muhamadnaby and Safina go to school. Shoira has been busy with selling children's clothing for more than three years. She develops her business little by little. 

Shoira sells children's clothes in a local market. She is going to buy children's clothes for the new season but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy children's clothes for new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes for new season

loans.name: Elym Beatriz

texts.es: Elym tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre dado que su esposo se vio obligado de emigrar al extranjero en busca de mejores condiciones de vida. Elym es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora ya que no se queda sentada esperando la remesa de su esposo si no que se gana la vida por medio de la comercialización de gallinas y por medio de la venta de desayunos y almuerzos en un pequeño comedor que ha logrado establecer. Tiene 8 años de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya cuenta con mucho reconocimiento y experiencia en el área. Desea construir un muro de retención y pagar por el derecho de la energía eléctrica dado que hasta la fecha no cuenta con el servicio. Elym  solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo y para pagar la conexión de la energía eléctrica que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en:
Elym is 30 years old, and lives in a house that she owns with her mother because her husband had to emigrate in order to find better living conditions.  Elym is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  She does not stay seated, waiting for her husband's remittance, instead she goes out and earns a living by selling chickens, and selling breakfasts and lunched in a small eatery that she has opened.  She has worked in this business for eight years, and she is very well known and has a lot of experience in the area.  

She wishes to build a retaining wall and pay for electricity, as to this day, she does not have electricity.  Elym is seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, brick and pay for the electrical connection that she is greatly missing.

loans.use: purchase cement, sand, bricks, and pay to install electricity, which she truly needs.

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Merina is in her late thirties and is married with two sons who are in school. She has been running a business of mamalishe (inexpensive 'fast food') for twelve years now. She operates her business from 06am to 10pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Merina's thirteenth loan request which she will use to buy cooking ingredients for her mamalishe.  She used the previous loans to buy cooking ingredients (rice, cooking oil, maize flour, baking flour and others). Merina has repaid successfully all of her previous loans. 

She used the increased income to cover school fees and household expenses. She also used the money to buy a mattress, TV, radio, saucepans for her business and a plot of land. Merina will use this loan to buy cooking ingredients for her mamalishe. She dreams of one day owning a big hotel servicing more people.

She will share this loan with her loan group "MOMELA" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients for her mamalishe.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a retail business to sell cereal, cooking fat, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a competitive place and she has all types of customers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. She will use 30,000 KES to buy cereal, bread, sugar and other items. 

She hopes that in the future, she will own a big apartment. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to restock her inventory.

loans.use: to buy cereal, bread, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Truphena

texts.en:
Truphena is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as determined.

She operates a retail business to sell potatoes, cabbages, spinach and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are local people. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of capital. 

She will use 40,000 KES to buy potatoes, cabbages, and other groceries. 

Her business goal is to be very prosperous within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She successfully repaid the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, cabbages and other grocery items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereal, sugar, flour and other items.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 48 year old married woman with 8 children. She describes herself as industrious. 

She operates a farm to raise dairy cows and produce milk to sell.  She also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 17 years. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are local people. 

She will use 30,000 KES to buy seed, fertilizer, and animal feed. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will increase the size of her farm.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and animal feed.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 46-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 15 years. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business selling charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing the food she sells.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a widowed woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be focused and a go getter. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a busy residential area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of working capital. 

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a big boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business and have a happy family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of Kes 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Kutsikivi Group

texts.fr:
André fait partie du groupe KUTSIKIVA  et habite à Bubanza. Il a 31 ans et est marié à Espérance, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 2 à 7 ans, dont 1 étudie.

Il  fait le commerce de l’huile de pame  et des noix de palme depuis  3 mois.

C’est son premier  creditIl  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  l’huile de palme été  de noix de palme  à  revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait il voudrait faire  augmenter  les articlas et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
André, age 31, is a member of the group KUTSIKIVI and he lives in Bubanza. He is married to a merchant named Espérance, and they have three children aged 2 to 7 years old, one of whom goes to school.   

André has been selling palm nuts and palm oil for three months. This is his first loan cycle with Turame. He plans to use this credit to strengthen his working capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil and palm nuts to bolster his sales and revenue. 

In the coming years, he hopes to expand his business and see his children pursue their education.

loans.use: to strengthen his working capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil and palm nuts to bolster his sales and revenue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase swimming trunks, shirts, shorts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, and other items.

loans.name: Blanca Liseth

texts.es:
Blanca, necesita un nuevo crédito con el que comprara güisquiles, pepinos, papas, mangos, naranjas, fresas, papayas, coliflor, entre otros para ofrecer  productos frescos y de calidad a sus clientes.
Con el capital que se le facilito antes se ha mantenido trabajando en un negocio bien surtido de frutas y verduras, su situación económica ha mejorado un poco, en su familia todo marcha bien.
texts.en: Blanca needs a new loan in order to purchase güisquiles (chayote - a vegetable like summer squash), cucumbers, potatoes, mangos, oranges, strawberries, cauliflower, and other fresh produce items of high quality for her customers.  With the loan that she received previously she has been able to continue working in her business, supplying fresh fruits and vegetables.  Her economic situation has improved a little, and her family is doing well.

loans.use: to purchase chayote (a vegetable like summer squash), cucumbers, potatoes, mangos, oranges, strawberries, cauliflower, and other fresh produce items of high quality for her customers.

loans.name: Iris Yaneth

texts.es:
Iris de 35años de edad, estudio hasta el bachillerato en el año 2000, cuando logro culminar sus estudios. Es madre de 2 hijos de 3 y 9 años de edad quienes estudian el nivel básico el centro escolar de la comunidad. Su esposo trabaja de seguridad en la ciudad y quien siempre esta pendiente de ella y de sus hijos, juntos han creado una familia muy unida y sus padres siempre la han apoyado. Crecio junto a sus padres quines trabajaban en la agricultura y ganadería en pequeño.

Iris se dedica desde que salio de estudiar a la venta de productos de lencerías, lociones, cremas y otros, gracias a las ganancias que obtuvo en las primeras ventas que realizo y los incentivos que recibió por parte de la proveedora de productos, fue así como ella inicio su propio negocio, hoy en día tiene su propio local en su vivienda y también sale a vender a la comunidad y alrededores pues ya es conocida por los clientes.Vende todos los días de la semana.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a  credicampo, es para la compra de una vaca, valorada en $600.00 el cual siempre ha sido uno de sus sueños desde joven, el resto lo necesita para la compra de mas productos que le permitan surtir mucho mas su negocio, ya que tiene que realizar sus pedidos y así podrá tener mas variedad que le permita realizar mas ganancias económicas para darle a sus hijos mejor calidad de vida y apoyarle en los estudios.

Iris sueña comprar su casa donde vivir con su familia, pues a pesar que tiene una propia con su esposo, esta lejos de sus padres y el sueño de ella es estar cerca de su familia que la apoyo desde su infancia, además quiere ampliar su negocio y extenderse en la zona pues conoce del negocio.
texts.en:
Iris is 35 years old, and earned her high school diploma in 2000.  She is the mother of two children ages three and nine, who are in primary school in the community school.  Her husband works as a security officer in the city, and he is always attentive to her and their children.  Together, they have created a very close-knit family, and her parents have always supported them.  She grew up with her parents who worked in agriculture and livestock on a small scale.  Since she finished school, Iris has worked selling linen goods, lotions, creams, and other items.  Thanks to the earnings she generated from her first sales, and the incentives she received from the distributor of the products, she was able to start her own business.  Today, she has her own retail space in her home, and she also goes out to sell in the community and neighboring communities.  She is very well known by her customers.  She sells everyday day of the week.

The loan that she is seeking from credicampo will be used to purchase a cow (valued at $600), which has always been a dream of hers.  The rest of the loan will be used to purchase more products to stock her business because she has order to fill, and this will allow her to have more variety that will allow her to generate more earnings to provide her children with a better quality of life, and support them in their education.

Iris dreams of buying her own home where she can live with her family.  Although her and her husband have their own home now, it is far away from her parents, and her dream is to be close to her family who has supported her from her infancy.  She also wants to expand her business and learn more about business.

loans.use: purchase a cow, and to purchase other linen goods, lotions, creams, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an over-sewing machine, and fabric.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Doña Consuelo tiene 33 años de edad quien es agricultora y ama de casa con un grado de educación cursado en la primaria hasta su quinto año y madre de 3 hijos quienes estudian en la primaria en la escuela de la comunidad. Junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo y producción de café teniendo una experiencia aproximada de 15 años en dicha actividad ya que fue su padre quien le enseño a trabajar y el mismo le heredo la tierra que hoy en día junto a su esposo trabaja. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a media hora aproximadamente desde su casa de habitación a la cual se traslada caminando aportando todos como familia su pequeño granito de arena para el desarrollo y bienestar.
Sus planes a futuro es ayudar a sus hijos a que puedan salir de su primaria como primer proceso de estudio y posteriormente en la secundaria tratando de hacer realidad cada una de sus sueños hasta verlos convertidos en profesionales con éxito poniendo en práctica lo aprendido y que puedan hacerse cargo de la tierra que hoy en día trabajan. Como productora de café ella tiene como meta seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de tierra y seguir produciendo mayores cantidades cada cosecha. Ella solicita apoyo económico para la compra de abono, fertilizantes y compra de nueva chapola de café para sembrar, limpiar una parte de sus cultivos de maleza entre otras dando a esta un excelente mantenimiento para esta nueva temporada.
texts.en:
Doña Consuelo is 33 years old. She is a farmer and a housewife. She went to primary school through her fifth year, and she is the mother of three children who attend the community primary school. Along with her husband, she raises and produces coffee, having approximately 15 years of experience in this business, since it was her father who taught her to work and who also gave her the land that she works today along with her husband. Her coffee plantings are located approximately half an hour from her home, a distance that she walks, doing her part for everyone as a family for their development and well being.

Her plans for the future are to help her children so that they can finish primary school as the first step of their education and later secondary school, each one trying to make a reality of his dreams until she sees them become successful professionals, putting into practice what they have learned and being able to take charge of the land that they are working on today. As a producer of coffee, she has as a goal to continue expanding her plantings of coffee through the purchase of land and continue producing greater quantities with each harvest. She is applying for economic support for the purchase of compost, fertilizers, and new young coffee plants to plant, to clean the weeds from one part of her plantings, among other items, giving this excellent maintenance for this new season.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and young coffee plants to plant.

loans.name: Naili

texts.en:
Naili is 39-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and parents-in-law in a small village of the Sachkhere district. Her family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a pig, four cows and a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. Naili milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell as well as for family use. 

Naili decided to start her own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 3,000 GEL for the trading business. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of shoes and then will resell at higher price. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family as they will have a stable income. Naili is a very hard working woman and thinks that the business will be profitable. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: France Group

texts.en:
Tatu is in her mid-thirties and is married with a daughter who is in school. For three years now, Tatu has been managing a food business, mamalishe (inexpensive 'fast food'). She is also involved with a charcoal store business. She works from 06am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
 
Tatu is requesting a first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy a business fridge and replenish her charcoal stock. She dreams of improving her family life and expanding her business. Tatu will share this loan with her loan group 'FRANCE’ which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a business fridge and replenish her charcoal stock.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a competitive spot and her primary customers are ladies. 

She also owns a farm where she grows crops to sell. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy seeds and other farm supplies for planting on her farm. Her business goal is to buy more land for farming within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 37-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, wheat flour, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances. 

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will improve her living standards. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a 28-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, shoes and handbags. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.en:
Mastona is a young and successful woman. She is 26 years old. Mastona is married and has two little children. She is a businesswoman and the only bread-winner of her family. 

Mastona has an animal husbandry business. She feeds cows. Mastona sells milk to local people since she feeds milk cows. 

Her husband does not have a job in Tajikistan. He is going to go to Russia to find a job and, in this way, to find a source of income. They have very poor living conditions. 

Mastona is asking for a loan of TJS 2,000 (somoni) to buy an airplane ticket to Russia for her husband. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy an airplane ticket to Russia for her husband.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a profitable place and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to be successful within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of kES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a carpentry where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive place and his customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. 

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of timber, nails and other carpentry materials. His business goal is to own a big hardware store within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of timber, nails and other carpentry materials.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 37-year-old married man with 1 child. He describes himself as honest, focused, and God fearing. 

He operates a barber shop where he cuts men's hair. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a busy residential area and his primary customers are individuals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of working capital. He will use 50,000 KES to buy barbering equipment and other items for  the barber shop. 

He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He successfully repaid the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy barbering equipment and other items for the barber shop.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 37-year-old married man with 1 child. He describes himself as optimistic. 

He is a carpenter and makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a vibrant location and he has all types of customers. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of capital. He will use 60,000 KES to buy timber, nails and other materials to make furniture. His business goal is to open another workshop within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will buy land. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. He successfully repaid previous loans.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails and other materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with 5 children between the ages of 5 to 20 years old. 

She operates a retail business to sell second-hand clothing and curtains. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as low stock and theft. 

She will use 50,000 KES to buy used clothing and curtains.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and curtains.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, a 28-year-old married mother of two, describes herself as trustworthy. She has been operating a cyber café offering internet browsing and photocopy services for three years now. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are local residents. Jane describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of sufficient funds. 

Jane will use this Kes 30,000 loan to buy photocopying paper and other computer accessories. This will be her second loan with SMEP DTM, her previous one having been repaid fully. Hoping for a bright future, Jane's business goal is to be prosperous within five years.

loans.use: buy photocopying papers and other computer accessories

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy and convenient place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds. He will use the KES 75,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that he will have a bright future. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona, who raises and sells dogs, previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used to buy dog food and pay for the animals' grooming. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenses.

Rona is requesting a new loan for 40,000 PHP loan to be used to feed and groom the dogs. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rona dreams that her business will be more successful and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She attends the weekly fellowship group* that allows her to listen to the word of God and have a better relationship not only with God but also with her family and community. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy dog food and pay for the animals' grooming.

loans.name: Mubigazi Group

texts.fr:
Evariste fait partie du groupe  Mubigazi et habite à Bubanza. Il a 39 ans et est marié  à Béatrice, une commerçante. 

Il fait le commerce de l’huile de palme  depuis 8 ans.

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il  obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’huile de palme à  revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il  voudrait acheter un véhicule et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Evariste, age 39, is a member of the group Mubigazi and he lives in Bubanza. He is married to a merchant named Béatrice. 

Evariste has been selling palm oil for eight years. This is his first loan cycle with Turame. He plans to use this credit to strengthen his working capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil to bolster his sales and revenue. 

In the coming years, he plans to purchase a vehicle and he would like his children to pursue their education.

loans.use: to strengthen his working capital and buy a large quantity of palm oil to bolster his sales and revenue.

loans.name: Elsa Mejia

texts.es:
Esta es la historia de Elsa Mejia, una mujer con gran fuerza, ánimo y grandes ilusiones por conseguir, luchar por lo que ha querido estudiar y ser una gran esteticista, ella tenía toda la confianza en esta carrera y sentía que esta 
profesión le ayudaría a la familia, especialmente a la pequeña, dulce y tierna Nataly de tan solo 9 años, la hija siempre ha visto a la mama como una guerrera lista para dar la batalla, y luchar por los ideales, metas y ser un ejemplo a seguir.
Es así como las ilusiones y metas de esta mujer, quiere ser independiente y toma un giro al tener la posibilidad de entrar a estudiar a un centro educativo,  donde con la experiencia, calidez y buen trato le ofrecen la oportunidad de cumplir las metas.

Ella decide aprovechar esta gran oportunidad y capacitarse en el campo de la estética y cosmetología integral, de esta forma ella podrá brindar a la gente bienestar y satisfacción a quien requiera de ella, con lo cual está segura que con responsabilidad, empeño y constancia, lograra grandes metas para poder lograr ese camino al éxito y así tener un mejor estilo de vida y un futuro para la familia.
Para Elsa Mejia es una nueva oportunidad que le da la vida y sobretodo dios,  para alcanzar esa gran ilusión hecha realidad y siempre teniendo mucha fe.

El convenio con kiva sería una ayuda grande para ella, ya que puede contar con la ayuda y el respaldo económico y poder pagar las cuotas con un valor mas barato, ya que los gastos que ella tiene son un poco altos y el dinero que se puede economizar lo puede utilizar en otros gastos que ella puede tener en la casa o en el estudio.
texts.en:
This is the story of Elsa Mejia, a woman with great strength and spirit, who is striving to obtain her dream of studying and becoming a great beautician.  She has confidence that by getting this degree and working in this profession, she will be able to help her family, particularly the youngest member: the sweet and loving Nataly, who is only 9 years old.  Elsa Mejia's daughter has always seen her mother as a role model and a fighter who is ready to go to battle and fight for her ideals and goals.

This is how the hopes and dreams of this woman, who wants to be independent, led her to take the turn to start to study at an educational center where, with experience, quality, and good service, they offer the opportunity for her to accomplish her goals.

Elsa Mejia decided to take advantage of this great opportunity and obtain training in an integrated beautician/cosmetology program.  In this way, she will be able to provide people with the well-being and satisfaction that they seek from her.  She is certain that with responsibility, commitment and perseverance, she will be able to achieve her greatest goals, putting her on the path to success.  This way, she will have a better living standard and a better future for her family.

For Elsa Mejia, this is a new opportunity that life, and most of all God, is giving her to make her dreams a reality, always having a lot of faith. This arrangement with Kiva will be a great help to her, because she will be able to rely on help and financial backing so that she can pay her course fees at a lower cost, because her expenses are quite high, and she can use the money she saves to pay for other household or educational expenses that she has.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan  de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta su bachillerato salió en el año 2001, se caso hace seis años con su esposa, con quien ha procreado un niño de 3 años de edad, su esposa trabaja todos los días de la semana vendiendo tortillas en la comunidad.


Juan  trabaja desde joven en la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y sorgo) pues se creció con sus padres y era uno de los oficios principales y aprendió la elaboración de hamacas.
Hoy en día trabaja en construcción con un albañil de la zona y además labora de jornalero en los días que no trabaja en construcción.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para realizar un viaje a panamá donde ira a trabajar en un restaurante, pues él tiene familia en dicho país y sueña con ir a conocer y trabajar para apoyar a su esposa y darle a su hijo lo mejor.


El sueño de Juan es construir su propia casa y que donde reside actualmente están alquilando con su esposa, y él sueña con construir así su vivienda en el terreno que le heredo su padre.

Además quiere darle lo mejor de si a su hijo y a su esposa para que juntos puedan tener mejores condiciones y tener su propio techo donde descansar.
texts.en:
Juan is 31 years old and studied until high school, which he left in 2001. He married his wife, who he has a 3 year old child with, six years ago. His wife works every day of the week selling tortillas in the community. Juan has worked in farming since he was young (planting corn, beans and sorghum), since it was one of the major businesses while he was growing up with his parents. He also learned how to make hammocks. Now he works in construction with a builder in the area, and also works as a day laborer on the days he does not work in construction. 

The loan he is requesting is for a trip to Panama, where he has family, and will work in a restaurant. He dreams of going to get to know the country and work to support his wife and give his child the best opportunities.

Juan 's dream is to build his own home on the land that he inherited from his father, as he and his wife are renting his current home. He also wants to give the best to his son and his wife so that together can have a better life and have their own roof to rest under.

loans.use: to go to Panama where he will work in a restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina lives in Kapan with her husband and two sons (ages 15 and 3 years old). 

Alina's husband teaches at a local school and Alina herself is involved in a retail business. She sells wedding dresses and different goods for wedding parties. Alina has been involved in this retail business for four years already, so she has a number of loyal customers who prefer to use her service. 

Alina applied for this loan to be able to purchase a new stock of wedding dresses and supplies for reselling to customers. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Alina and her small business so she hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of wedding dresses for reselling to customers

loans.name: Hezrone

texts.en:
Hezrone is a 45-year-old married man with 5 children. He describes himself as optimistic. 

He operates a retail business to sell water. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a vibrant location and he has all types of customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of capital. 

He will use 40,000 KES to buy a generator to pump water. He successfully repaid 2 loads with SMEP DTM.

He hopes that in the future, he will own a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a generator to pump water.

loans.name: Apple Group

texts.en:
Hilda is a married woman in her early forties.  She has three children who attend school. 

She has owned a grocery and cafe for eleven years. Hilda employes waitstaff for the cafe. She works daily from 6am to 11pm and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is Hilda's third loan request which she will use to buy bulk quantities of soda and beer for her grocery. She successfully repaid the previous loans which  she used to restock her inventory. Hilda manages to generate an extra income and will use it to cover her household expenses and school fees. 

Hilda dreams of managing stationary and boutique businesses. 

She will share thus loan with her loan group "Apple" which totals two members who hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of soda and beer for her grocery store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 53 year-old single woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy and humble. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area with high demand of the products and her primary customers are individuals.

Grace describes her biggest business challenge to be low supply. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business more. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stock of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a direct selling business and an apartment for additional income.
 
Myrna would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of mineral water. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profit from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Myrna hopes to expand all her business and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of mineral water

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man with 3 children ranging in age from 5  to 15 years old. He describes himself as determined. 

He operates a retail business to sell tires. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a populated place. He describes his biggest business challenge as fluctuating prices. 

He will use 90,000 KES to buy tires and tubes. 

He hopes that in the future, he will have continuous work and a good lifestyle. He will use the anticipated profits to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy tires and tubes.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 64 years old and a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo and they have children. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

Teodora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and then selling in individual quantities. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She requests 15,000 PHP to help her to continue her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her inventory.

Teodora dreams of improving her business and hopes to have a good future.  She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business  and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, es casado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad, por la responsabilidad de salir adelante con su familia ha puesto en práctica los conocimientos que heredo de su papá, los cueles consisten en dar mantenimiento a vehículos, el taller lo abre a las 8:00 a.m. y lo cierra a las 5:00 p.m., por el momento no representa riesgo.
Necesita capital para comprar bujías, pastillas para frenos, interruptores, focos, cables, aceite, entre otros repuestos que son útiles para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes, espera tener más ingresos para mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia y cancelar la deuda.
Su sueño es contar con un negocio debidamente equipado con lo necesario para atraer más clientes.
texts.en: Víctor is married and lives with his wife and two children, aged 8 and 12. With the responsibility of bringing up his family Víctor has put into practice the knowledge he gained from his father which is fixing vehicles. His shop opens at 8 am and he closes at 5 pm. At the moment this is no problem. Víctor needs capital to buy spark plugs, brake pads, switches, light bulbs, cables, oil and other parts that are used to provide good service for his customers. He hopes to have more income to improve the living standard of his family and pay off this loan. His dream is to have a well equipped business to attract more clients.

loans.use: to buy spark plugs, brake pads, switches, light bulbs, cables, oil, etc.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, who lives in Armavir with her two children, ages 19 and 17, is a teacher at a local school. Anna also provides preparatory classes for university applicants in her home. Due to her knowledge and friendly manner, she has a number of students. 

Anna has now applied for this loan to purchase notebooks and stationary needed for her work. The loan will improve her working conditions, and she will be very grateful to lenders for support. 

Anna has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program provides start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for notebooks and stationary for preparatory classes for university applicants

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam would like to take out a further loan to buy new furniture for her stall and food to satisfy her customers. 

Tam's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that, through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her stall and food to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is a single mother hailing from Rwebikona in the Mbarara District of Uganda. She dropped out of school after getting pregnant at a very early age. After that incident, she lost the support of her parents and unfortunately her husband also did not want to take responsibility. She later got a donation from her aunt and started the to work in agriculture in the village to enable her survival--as well as her kid's. She is requesting a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy manure for her plantation. She is confident the manure will boost the productivity of her crops. She is hard working.

loans.use: to buy organic manure

loans.name: Zakrya

texts.en:
Zakrya is a 23-year-old, single man and a hard-working person. He lives with his family in a rented house in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a University graduate man. 

Because of the high rates of the unemployment in the country, he couldn't find a job. Zakrya couldn't surrender to this condition. Fortunately, his family supported him with an amount of money in order to encourage him to begin his own business. 

Zakrya started his business in a small bookstore, beside Dar Al- Salam University, in Sana'a. He prints the handouts and materials for the University students. Previously, he was a student in this University and he was suffering from the costs of the handouts and materials. Recently, he has his own bookstore and he deals with his own business with ease. 

Unfortunately, the income of this business is very low and most of what he earns goes to the expenses of his parents. He doesn't have enough requirements to enlarge his business. For this reason, he applied for a loan of YER 150,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) in order to purchase a Sharp photocopier.
 
Zakrya looks forward to strengthening his bookstore to become very large. Also, he hopes to open another bookstore in Sana'a University.

loans.use: to purchase a Sharp photocopier for his bookstore.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en: Molly is a married woman aged 40 years old, with six children all in school and depending on her for survival.  She is married to a man who does not offer any support to the family as his work is to go and drink; all the responsibilities are left to the wife. Because of such big family and responsibilities, she started a small restaurant; a business that has made her manage to pay tuition for her children and look after the whole family. The business has grown into a big eating place in the town of Mbarara, attracting passers-by from Rwanda to Kampala and this is attributed to her courage and determination to change the trend of things in the family. She is requesting 500 000 UGX to improve on the standards of the restaurant by buying quality and better utensils such as warmers, and also fast cooking machines for the restaurant. This she believes will increase her customers and sales.

loans.use: to buy utensils and cooking machines.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is the age of 44, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, and biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store; he speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his good behaviour, he has built up very good relations among his customers. Due to these good relationships, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. 
Therefore, Musarat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband, so he can buy the sacks of rice, sugar, and flour etc. She is very glad after receiving this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfil each request for any item, and prevent the disappointment of his customers.
She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, and flour for a general store.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma previously accessed a PHP 9,000 loan that she used to buy spare parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 10,000, to buy parts and cover maintenance costs of her computer shop. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vilma hopes to open another computer shop and dreams that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Ut

texts.en: Ut would like to take a further loan to buy new computers and upgrade the old ones for her internet services. Ut's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new computers and upgrade the old ones for her internet services

loans.name: Cristian Orlando

texts.es:
Dinámico, ágil,  activo y  laborioso, todas esas cualidades  identifican a Cristian. Desde muy joven se involucró en el mundo laboral. Sus inicios fueron como mesero en restaurantes populares de la ciudad de Chinandega. Esa misma energía y entusiasmo lo llevó a emigrar con el propósito de conseguir ahorros y  abrir un negocio propio en su tierra.  Siempre ha actuado pensando en sus hijos, ya que son su mayor motivación.
Empezó una pequeña venta de asados en su casa, sin embargo su interés estaba puesto en instalar una pulpería. Es por ello que solicitó un préstamo en KIVA,  para poder suplir  de granos básicos tales como: Arroz, Frijoles, Azucar y Avena su pequeño negocio, puesto a que estos son los que más se consumen.  Su meta es  mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar y brindarles  a sus clientes la mayor comodidad posible.
texts.en:
Dynamic, flexible, active and hard-working are all qualities that describe Cristian. He has been involved in the work world since he was very young. He started out as a waiter in various popular restaurants in the city of Chinandega.

This same energy and enthusiasm lead him to emigrate with the aim of saving money and opening a business in his own country. He has always acted thinking about his children as they are his main motivation. He started with a small barbeque stand at his house. However his interest was to open a store. So he is requesting a loan from Kiva to stock basic grains like, rice, beans, sugar and oats for his small business as these are what are sold most. His goal is to improve the infrastructure of his house and offer his clients as much convenience as possible.

loans.use: to stock his small business with basic grains like rice, beans, sugar and oats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure, and seedlings in order to plant, cultivate, and be able to tend the plants

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
Umeda is a young, industrious woman. She is a responsible mother of 4 children who are 4, 7, 8 and 11 years old. She sends some of them to school. 

Umeda is also a successful businesswoman who makes national women dresses. She makes very wonderful dresses. She works from her home and has run this business for more than 14 years. Umeda's regular customers include her neighbors and local community. 

Umeda wants to increase her working capital and asks for 5,000 TJS to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Topi Group

texts.en:
Jonas is a married man in his mid 40s.  He has two children who attend school.  He has sold agricultural equipment since 2009.  He works from 8am to 5pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be Jonas's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase his inventory and has successfully repaid all of his loans. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva's support to their group, which is doing great.  

He used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy more agricultural equipment.  He dreams of being able to import his products from abroad.

Jonas will share this loan with his loan group " TOPI" which has six members who hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to  buy agricultural equipment.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: Rahima is 43 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia and doesn’t regularly send money to the family. Consequently, Rahima is the main provider for her family. She has been busy growing agricultural products for more than 18 years. She grows crops and sells her harvest in a local market. Rahima’s son helps her with growing crops. Now, she wants to develop a business growing crops. She needs to sow new crops, but she doesn't have enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a  Kiva borrower. He has 5 children and operates a dairy farm to produce milk to sell. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

His business is located in a rural area. He describes his biggest business challenge as a scarcity of animal feed. He will use 95,000 KES to buy animal feed and medicine. 

He hopes that in the future, he will pay for his children's school fees. He will use the anticipated profits to open other businesses.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and medicine.

loans.name: Saul Orlando

texts.es:
Saúl, solicita un crédito nuevo para invertir más en el agricultura comprara abono, semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y pago de mano de obra, será de beneficio para preparar el terreno y proteger el cultivo de plagas.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a tener mejor productividad, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su estabilidad económica, su vida familiar ha mejorado mucho.
texts.en: Saúl is requesting another loan to invest in his farming, purchasing manure seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and to pay for labor. This will benefit his land and protect his crops from infestation. The previous loan helped him to have higher production, increased his sales and his economic stability. His family's life has improved a lot.

loans.use: to buy inputs like manure, fertilizer, pesticides, herbicides, insecticides and seeds.

loans.name: Nanziga Youth Devt Grp Group

texts.en:
Johnson, a member of Nanziga Youth Devt Grp Group, is a 32-year-old man who deals in retail trade and also does brick-laying. He has been in this business for four years. He began this business to acquire income to support his family. 

Johnson will use the loan to buy business stock, like sugar and maize flour. He hopes to expand his business. He faces a challenge of competition, price fluctuations, transport, and fake products. However, he hopes that, with the loan, he will buy good quality products, in bulk, to save on transport. He is hard-working and dependable.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell in his retail shop.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is a married man with 6 children. He describes himself as industrious. He operates a transportation business to transports customers using his motorcycle. He also owns a retail shop and sells household items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an urban area. 

He will use 70,000 KES to buy sugar, soap, flour and other household items to sell in his shop. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will own more motorcycles. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. He successfully repaid his previous loans. He will use the anticipated profits to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, flour and other household items to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 50-year-old married woman with 3 children between the ages of 12 and 21. She describes herself as focused and patient. 

She operates a dairy farm to produce and sell milk.  She also keeps poultry. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a busy area. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as unpredictable weather patterns. She will use 30,000 KES to buy a dairy cow. Her business goal is to have more dairy cows within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and be able to pay university fees for her children. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Moath

texts.en:
Moath is a 20-year-old married man from Jabalia. He lives with his wife and small child in a simple house. 

Moath has worked in construction for the past two years. It is a good business but the income is not stable, due to low demand during the winter. 

Moath would like to improve his business and requests 800 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy raw materials for his construction work. This loan will enable Moath  to increase his productivity and meet his client's demands.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his construction work.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong requests a new loan to buy beverages and rice to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store, increase sales, and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beverages and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy washing soap, flour, and other items he sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida lives in Kapan with her two children who are 14 and 17 years old. 

Aida is a hard working woman and does her best to provide appropriate living conditions for her children. Aida has in retail business and rents a small space in Kapan's market to sell clothing and shoes. 

Aida applied for this loan to be able to increase the variety of items that she sells. The loan will help her to satisfy her customers' needs and increase sales. 

Aida has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with agreeable conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing and shoes for selling.

loans.name: Twunganire Iii Group

texts.fr:
Lydie fait partie du groupe Twunganire III et habite à Bujumbura. Elle a 28 ans et est mariée à Onésphore, un cultivateur. 

Elle fait le commerce du riz, et de haricot depuis 2 ans.

Elle est à son  deuxième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle  obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz et de haricot à  revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait devenir une importatrice des habits, et des aliments et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Lydie, age 28, is a member of the group Twunganire III. She lives in Bujumbura, and she is married to a farmer named Onésphore. 

Lydie has been selling rice and beans for two years. This is her 2nd loan cycle with Turame, and she plans to use the funds to strengthen her working capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans to bolster her sales and revenue.
  
In the coming years, she would like to become an importer of clothing and food items, and she hopes to see her children continue their education.

loans.use: to strengthen her working capital and buy a large quantity of rice and beans to bolster her sales and revenue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and to construct a coop.

loans.name: Kazozakeza Ii Group

texts.en:
Astérie, age 38, is a member of the group Kazozakeza II. She lives in Bujumbura, and she is married to a merchant named Venuste. They have five children aged 3 to 11 years old, 3 of whom go to school. 

Astérie has been selling clothing, palm oil, rice, beans, etc. for ten years. This is her 2nd loan cycle with Turame, and she plans to use the funds to strengthen her working capital and stock up on clothing, palm oil, rice and beans to bolster her sales and revenue.  

In the coming years, she would like to purchase a vehicle to start a transportation activity, and she hopes to see her children continue their education.

loans.use: to strengthen her working capital and stock up on clothing, palm oil, rice and beans to bolster her sales and revenue.

loans.name: Rugenge Group

texts.fr:
Israël fait partie du groupe Rugenge  et habite à Bujumbura. Il a 43 ans et est marié à Jeanine,
 une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 3 à 17 ans, dont 5 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de  boutique (haricot, de riz, de savon,…) depuis  1 an.

C’est son premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  haricot, de riz, de savons,... à  revendre, pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait ouvrir une deuxième boutique et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Israel is a member of the Rugenge group. He lives in Bujumbura. He is 43 years old and married to Jeanine, a farmer. They have six children ranging from three to 17 years of age, three of whom are in school.

Israel has been running a basic goods store (beans, rice, soap etc) for one year. This is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan, he will bolster his capital and buy a large quantity of beans, rice, soap etc for resale, in order to earn more. In the years to come, he would like to open a second store and see his children receive an education.

loans.use: to bolster his capital and stock up on beans, rice, soap etc for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, opta por solicitar más capital que invertirá en la compra de semilla, abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, pago de mano de obra para preparar el terreno en el que cultivara.
La inversión anterior le dio una cosecha abundante y de calidad, su familia está muy saludable, ha cancelado de buena forma su deuda.
texts.en:
Francisco has decided to request more capital, which he will invest in purchasing seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides, and to pay for labor in order to prepare his land for farming. 

His previous loan gave him an abundant and high-quality harvest. His family is very healthy. He has paid off his debt adequately.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, desea seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura por lo que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, pago de mano de obra, para preparar el terreno en el que el sembrara maíz y yuca.
Con el crédito anterior tuvo a su disposición los insumos agrícolas necesarios para aumentar la cosecha y tener granos de calidad, las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
José would like to continue investing in agriculture. He is requesting a new loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides, and to pay for manual labor, in order to prepare the land where he plants corn and cassava.

With the previous loan, José had at his disposition the agricultural supplies necessary to increase his harvest and have high-quality crops. His family's circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides, and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Mariano De Jesus

texts.es:
Mariano, ha tenido resultados positivos con el uso de créditos, su cosecha es de calidad, tiene más  ingresos con los que cubre las necesidades básicas de su familia y cancelo su deuda anterior.
En esta oportunidad el capital que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de herbicidas, plaguicidas, abono y semilla, con ello preparara la tierra y protegerá el cultivo de plagas.
texts.en:
Mariano has had positive results from using the loans. His harvest is of good quality, and he has more income, with which he covers the basic needs of his family and payed off his past debt.

At this time, he will invest the capital that he is applying for in the purchase of herbicides, pesticides, compost, and seeds, with which he will prepare the land and protect his crop from pests.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, pesticides, compost, and seeds

loans.name: José Horacio

texts.es:
Don José ha sido un hombre trabajador y honrado toda su vida, que al lado de su esposa ha logrado darle un sustento a sus dos hijos, el sabe que para progresar es necesario luchar y con sus propias manos a tratado de cultivar el sueño de toda su vida, tener una finca prospera y una vivienda digna.
En este momento Don José esta necesitando recursos para adquirir una vaca de leche con la cual podrá producir productos lácteos como queso y sueros, podrá también generar empleo y contribuir con la economía de su región.
A pesar de perder sus cultivos en varias ocasiones a causa del fuerte invierno que azota la región, el nunca se ha dado por vencido y siempre ha sabido como superar todos estos desafíos. Su motivación mas grande es su familia por la cual lucha y se esfuerza cada día de su vida con el objetivo de verlos felices.
texts.en:
José has been a hardworking and honest man all of his life. With his wife, he has been able to support his two children.
