He knows that to get ahead in life, it is necessary to fight, and with his own hands he has tried to cultivate his lifelong dream: to have a prosperous farm and a decent home. 

Currenty, José needs the resources to purchase a dairy cow with which he will be able to produce dairy products such as cheese and whey. He will also be able to generate employment and contribute to his region's economy. 

In spite of having lost his crops on several occasions due to the heavy rains that ravaged the region, he has never given up and has always known how to overcome such challenges. His biggest motivation is his family, for which he fights and makes an effort every day with the goal of seeing them happy.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow with which he will be able to produce dairy products.

loans.name: Héctor Alonso

texts.es: Él es Héctor una persona que toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura actividad que heredó de su padre y que ha sido el sustento de su familia desde hace décadas. Héctor tiene un terreno cerca del casco urbano donde cultiva hortalizas y las distribuye en la plaza de mercado, pero tiene un gran inconveniente que aqueja comúnmente a los agricultores y es el alto costo de los insumos agrícolas, fungicidas, insecticidas y larvicidas, razón por la cual solicita un apoyo económico pues su negocio se está viendo afectado por este problema e incluso puede estar en peligro. Hoy Héctor Alonso solicita una ayuda, dado que quiere seguir distribuyendo sus productos, seguir manteniendo su familia, quiere heredar sus conocimientos a su hijo, puesto que este humilde hogar es uno de los principales distribuidores de hortalizas en la región y no solo se ve afectada su familia si no las personas que diariamente llevan sus productos. Se han preguntado qué sería de nosotros sin los agricultores?, por eso importante ayudar este gran sector económico ya que es el que provee el alimento diario en todos los hogares.
texts.en: This is Hector, a person who has worked all his life in farming, an activity that he inherited from his father and that has been the sustenance of his family for decades. Hector has a plot of land near the town center where he raises vegetables and sells them in the market plaza, but he has a great disadvantage that afflicts all the farmers, and it is the high cost of the agricultural supplies, fungicides, insecticides, and larvicides. For this reason, he is applying for economic support, since his business is being affected by this problem and it could even be in danger. Today Hector Alonso is applying for help, given that he wants to continue selling his products and continue supporting his family. He wants to leave his knowledge to his son, since this humble household is one of the principle distributors of vegetables in the region, and not only would his family be affected but also the people who buy his products daily. They have wondered, what would become of us without the farmers? For this reason, it is important to help this great economic sector, since it is what provides the daily food in all the households.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, fungicides, insecticides, and larvicides to continue with his business

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
Lizeth:
Lizeth tiene 22 años y nació en Medellín, Antioquia, población ubicada en el oriente de Colombia. Es la hija menor de su familia, su hermana mayor es Contadora Pública, su madre es docente y su padre está retirado, después de practicar por muchos años la medicina. A pesar de las dificultades económicas que tuvieron, Lizeth se pudo graduar como Ingeniera Industrial de la Universidad Nacional de Colombia. 
Lizeth tiene el sueño de realizar una maestría en Investigación de Operaciones en la Universidad de Maastricht y para lograrlo necesita solicitar el apoyo de Kiva, puesto que es la única forma para poder cubrir los gastos de exámenes de idioma y aplicación a las universidades. Una vez realice su maestría y regrese a Colombia, Lizeth anhela trabajar en  el área académica, donde planea compartir su conocimiento e involucrarse en proyectos que contribuyan al crecimiento económico e industrial que lograrían que la región y el país sigan abriéndose a la economía internacional, lo cual impactará favorablemente a la población.
Aquí está su historia: 
A pesar de que cuento con el apoyo de mi familia para cumplir este sueño, mis padres no pueden llegar a cubrir gastos tan elevados como estos debido a su limitada situación económica. Actualmente, soy parte de un grupo de investigación de la Universidad Nacional de Colombia en mi natal Medellín. Durante mi carrera, logré tener varios reconocimientos como ser monitora de diferentes materias, como Estadística II. Además, obtuve matrícula de honor en dos ocasiones, gracias a tener uno de los mejores promedios de su carrera.
El conocimiento es fundamental para el bienestar de los pueblos y yo pretendo ser parte del progreso de Colombia, estudiando una Maestría en Investigación de Operaciones. El mundo de hoy, lleno de acuerdos comerciales entre países ha llevado la competencia de las compañías manufactureras y de servicios a un nivel muy exigente en todos los campos. La logística de las operaciones cada día demanda nuevas estrategias y la ciencia está llamada a resolver estos nuevos retos que el mundo real nos ofrece. 
La maestría de mi preferencia es impartida especialmente en Netherlands, donde la Investigación de Operaciones ha sido objeto de estudio durante una larga trayectoria, razón por la cual quisiera estudiar en el exterior. La inversión necesaria para obtener un cupo en una Universidad en estos países sobrepasa mi capacidad económica actual. Los sueños no sólo necesitan de sacrificio, constancia y ganas, sino del espaldarazo de una sociedad convencida que la educación de un ciudadano permite el bienestar de muchos otros y que de esta manera todos crecemos. 
Kiva sería el apoyo que necesito para superar los primeros pasos de este largo camino y el impulso para poder realizar esta maestría en el exterior, dado que gracias a Kiva podría realizar los estudios que necesito para perfeccionar mi segundo idioma y poder aplicar a la Universidad que me permitirá cumplir mi proyecto de vida.
texts.en:
Lizeth is 22 years old and was born in Medellin, Antioquia, a city located in eastern Colombia. She is the younger daughter of her family. Her older sister is a public accountant; her mother is a teacher, and her father is retired, after practicing medicine for many years. Despite their economic difficulties, Lizeth managed to graduate as an industrial engineer from the National University of Colombia.

Lizeth's dream is to receive a masters degree in Investigation of Operations at the University of Maastricht and, in order to do so, she needs to solicit the aid of Kiva. This is the only way she can cover the costs of language exams and application to the universities.

Once she receives her masters and returns to Colombia, Lizeth hopes to work in the academic area, where she plans to share her knowledge and involve herself in projects that contribute to the economic and industrial growth that will make the region and the country continue to open up to the international economy, which will favorably impact the population.

Here is her story:
Despite having my family's help to complete my dream, my parents can not cover such elevated costs as these, owing to their limited economic situation. At present, I am part of an investigation group at the national University of Colombia in my native city of Medellin. During my career, I received various types of recognition, including mastering different subjects, such as Statistics II. In addition, I graduated with honors on two occasions, thanks to having one of the best grade averages in my career field.

Knowledge is fundamental for a people's wellbeing, and I intend to be part of Colombia's progress, studying for a masters in Investigation of Operations. In today's world, with so many commercial agreements between countries, competition between manufacturing and servicing companies is at a demanding level in all fields. The logistics of daily operations demands new strategies and science is called upon to resolve these new challenges that the real world offers us. 

The masters in my preferred field is offered, especially, in the Netherlands, where the Investigation of Operations has been the object of study for a long time, and that's why I wish to study abroad. The investment necessary to obtain admission to a university in these countries exceeds my present economic capacity. Dreams not only require sacrifice, constancy and desire, but also backing by a society convinced that a citizen's education will lead to wellbeing for many others and that in this manner, all will grow.

Kiva can provide the help I need to overcome the first steps in this long road and the impulse to be able to achieve this masters abroad, given the fact that thanks to Kiva, I will be able to accomplish the study I need to perfect my second language and to apply to the university that will permit me to complete my life's project.

loans.use: pay application costs for a Masters Program in the Netherlands .

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 60 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child, who is now at an adult age. 

For her source of living, Monica has a little store and sells groceries and other consumable products. She earns approximately 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for retailing.
 
Monica has been a member of PMPC for almost six years. In the future, Monica hopes to be engaged in another type of business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for retailing

loans.name: Noz

texts.en:
Noz is hardworking woman from south Tajikistan. She was born in 1968. Noz brings up three children. One of them is a non-adult. Noz has worked in a state organization more than 10 years. She is one of the best workers who does her job well. 

Noz is a higher educated woman, and she always tries to help her children in getting a higher education. Her son is a student, and Noz must pay for his tuition at university. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to pay tuition for her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her son

loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.en:
Mahfirat is 37 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and non-adult son. She has had her own business for seven years, and it is her source of income. She grows onions. 

Mahfirat grows onions on 0.9-hectare of land. Her land is located near her house, and that’s why she goes every morning very early to her land and begins the working process. She sells onions in a local market. 

Mahfirat is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel, and to pay workers. She awaits your support. Her goal is to always keep her business brisk, as it is the source of income for her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel, and pay workers for her onion field

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
Berlinda previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from this business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Berlinda dreams that her business will be more flourishing and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members where she shares stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a 34-year-old, married woman. She has three children, with ages ranging from four years to eight years. She describes herself as being honest and dependable. 

Fridah operates a beauty salon where she offers hairdressing services. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low season. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy beauty products to use in the salon. Her business goal is to have more salons within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy beauty products to use in the salon.

loans.name: Twungubumwe I Group

texts.fr:
Jeanine fait partie du groupe  Twungubumwe I et habite à Gitega. Elle a 33 ans et est mariée  à Emmanuel, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 3 à 13 ans, dont  3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  cacahouètes  depuis  5 ans.

Elle est  à son dix-septième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de cacahouètes  à  revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jeanine, age 33, is a member of the group Twungubumwe I and she lives in Gitega. She is married to a merchant named Emmanuel. They have five children aged 3 to 13 years old, 3 of whom go to school. 

Jeanine has been selling groundnuts for five years. 

This is her 17th loan cycle with Turame, and she plans to use the funds to strengthen her working capital and buy a large quantity of groundnuts to bolster her sales and revenue.

loans.use: to strengthen her working capital and buy a large quantity of groundnuts to bolster her sales and revenue.

loans.name: Ana Sarai

texts.es:
Ana, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comprar abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, semilla, pagara mano de obra para realizar la preparación del terreno y luego sembrar para seguir creciendo con su negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior fortaleció el negocio teniendo como resultado mejores ingresos con los cuales cancelo las cuotas de la deuda, ha mejorado el estilo de vida de su familia, también compro ganado para tener ingresos extras.
texts.en:
Ana has decided to seek a new loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides, seeds and to pay for labor. She wants to prepare her plot of land for cultivation in order to continue growing her business. 

With the previous loan, she strengthened her business. This resulted in a better income, with which she repaid her loan, improved her family's lifestyle and bought cattle to generate extra income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides, seeds and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena lives with her father in Artashat town. It has already been a year since Lena first became involved in the retail business. She rents a small booth in the center of the town and trades there with clothing and dressmaking accessories. 

Lena loves her trade and has permanent customers. By requesting this loan Lena would like to ask Kiva lenders to help her with purchasing new stock of clothing for her booth. 

Lena has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her retail business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Lena has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and a parcel of land

loans.name: Somos Impacto 2006 Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Somos Impacto 2006” está conformada por 09 socios responsables y trabajadores. Este es el caso de Margarita de 54 años separada con 05 hijos independientes. Hace 08 años que se dedica a la venta y confección de prendas de vestir. Con dicho negocio a podido brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de hilos, botones y crochets. El deseo de Margarita es de terminar de construir su vivienda, pues piensa habilitar un espacio donde pueda exhibir sus productos. El grupo “Somos Impacto 2006” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Margarita se encuentra sentada y es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo violeta.
texts.en: The "Somos Impacto 2006" community bank is composed of 9 responsible and hardworking partners. One of them is Margarita, who is 54 years old, separated and with 5 independent children. She has worked for 8 years making and selling pieces of clothing. With this occupation, she has been able to provide a better quality of life to her children. She will use this loan to buy thread, buttons and crochet hooks. Margarita's goal is to finish building her house, as she plans to set up an area where she can exhibit her products. The "Somos Impacto 2006" group thanks all the people who made this loan possible. In the photo, Margarita is sitting down and is the third person on the left, wearing a purple shirt.

loans.use: to buy thread, buttons and crochet hooks.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 33 year old man.  He has 2 children.  He describes himself to be honest.  He operates a retail business where he sells bananas, tomatoes and other vegetables.  He has been involved in this business for 1 year.  His business is located in an area good for the business and his primary customers are of all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of finances.  He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stocks of vegetables and fruits.  His business goal is to invest more within 5 years.  He hopes that in the future, he can improve his family's living standard.  This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.  The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stocks of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 30 year old single woman.  She describes herself to be honest and focused.  She operates a retail busines where she sells juices.  She has been involved in this business for 4 years.  Her business is located in a busy area. 

She will use of the KES 20,000 loan to buy fruits to make juices and also to buy a cooler.  Her business goal is to own a hotel within 5 years.  She hopes that in the future, she can buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy fruits to make juices and also buy a cooler

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is a 32-year-old married mother of 2 children attending school. 

She has been working for five years at her house selling homemade food such as pickles, thyme, and oil… to help her family meet their life requirements. 

Presently, Dalia is asking to get a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase more merchandise for her business to offer her clients a wider tasty variety of goods. She is certain that, thanks to the loan, she will be able to target more customers and thus will obtain higher revenues, and she hopes that, in the future, she will be capable of opening her own food store.

loans.use: to purchase more food goods.

loans.name: Rosela Estela

texts.es: El Cañón de Somoto, una de las formaciones rocosas más antiguas de Centroamérica, se ha convertido en un impresionante sitio, ofreciendo un escenario único en el país, y entre sus paredes rocosas se pueden llevar a cabo diversas actividades extremas que despiertan nuestra adrenalina más escondida. Doña Rósela, es una Señora de 41 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos desde hace 19 años despertó su interés en la búsqueda de una alternativa monetaria que llegase a satisfacer las necesidades que presentaba en su hogar en la actualidad se dedica a la venta de granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, trigo), aceite, dulces entre otros. Su meta próxima es la inversión continua en su negocio. Solicitando un crédito para la adquisición de nuevos productos como calzado para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas así también la compra de artículos personales como ropa (camisetas, pantalones, short), cosméticos para damas. Estimando que el crédito a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá lograr el crecimiento de su negocio y tener más utilidades. Obteniendo como planes a futuro seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para llegar hacer el negocio líder de la ciudad donde habita y de igual manera de las ciudades cercanas.
texts.en:
Somoto Canyon, one of the oldest rock formations in Central America, has become an impressive site. Its unique scenery is unlike anything else in the country, and among its rock walls you can practice the type of extreme sports activities that get your adrenaline running. 

Rosela is 41 years old and married with two children. Ninteen years ago, she became interested in finding a financial alternative that could meet her household's needs. She currently works selling basic grains (rice, beans, corn, wheat), sugar, oil, sweets, and other items. Her next goal is to continue investing in her business by requesting a loan to acquire new products like shoes for men, women, and children, as well as personal items like clothing (shirts, pants, shorts) and cosmetics. She estimates the loan she is requesting will be of great help to her, because it will allow her business to grow and be more profitable. 

Her plans for the future are to continue investing in her business so that it becomes a leading business in the community, as well as in the surrounding areas.

loans.use: to purchase new products like shoes, clothing, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana, who is a 30-year-old, unemployed woman, lives in Zestaponi district. She lives with her school-aged son and daughter and husband, who works at a private company and generates 400 GEL monthly. Ana married at an early age and wasn’t able to get an education, so she has no university degree, which is one of the main reasons for her unemployment. 

Since the existing income is not enough for her four-member family and she can’t find the job, Ana decided to start her own business. After several unsuccessful attempts, Ana applied for the credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of a start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. 

Ana will use the aforementioned loan to start a trading business with clothing. Particularly, she will purchase a stock of clothing at wholesale prices and she will sell the clothes in her community for an increased price. 

With support of the start-up program, Ana will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle with the financial difficulties, as well as to do her bit for the family's welfare. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a trading business with clothing.

loans.name: Tunamerimwe Group

texts.fr:
Spès fait partie du groupe Tunamerimwe  et habite à Gitega. Elle  a 37 ans et est mariée à Jean Paul,
un enseignant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 2 à 8 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de  boutique (haricot,  riz,  savon,…) depuis  1 an.

Elle est  à son premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle  va augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  haricot, de riz, de savon,... à  revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Spès, age 37, is a member of the group Tunamerimwe and she lives in Gitega. She is married to a teacher named Jean-Paul. They have four children aged 2 to 8 years old, 3 of whom go to school. 

Spès has been a shopkeeper for the past year, selling such goods as beans, rice, soap, etc. 

This is her first loan cycle with Turame, and she plans to use the funds to strengthen her working capital and buy a large quantity of beans, rice, soap and other items to bolster her sales and revenue.

loans.use: to strengthen her working capital and buy a large quantity of beans, rice, soap and other items to bolster her sales and revenue.

loans.name: Idalia Mercedez

texts.es:
Idalia tiene el arte de elaborar las piñatas y  artesanías  más finas y vistosas por los detalles que aplica en cada una de sus piezas.  Desde hace siete años se dedica a este negocio, que le ha brindado ingresos para la manutención de sus hijos y de su hogar
Idalia desea seguir en el constante crecimiento de su negocio y solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de papel, pintura, pega y yeso, materiales básicos en sus piezas. El crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que obtendrá ingresos, del cual saldrán beneficiados su familia y  el negocio.
texts.en:
Idalia's art is making the finest and loveliest piñatas and crafts because of the details she adds to each of her pieces. She has worked in this business since she was seven years old, and it has provided her with income to maintain her children and her household. 

Idalia would like to continue steadily growing her business and is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of the basic materials of her pieces: paper, paint, glue, and plaster. The loan will be a great help since she will earn income, which will benefit her children and her business.

loans.use: to purchase paper, paint, glue, and plaster.

loans.name: Samara

texts.ru: Самаре 22 года, замужем, есть ребенок дошкольного возраста. Самара в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав в 2012 году с 15,000 сом (KGS), благодаря упорному труду,  в хозяйстве Самары на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 5 овец, а также есть земельный надел, на котором расположен парник. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Самара является участником группы "Чынара", всего в группе состоят 3 человека. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Самара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку минеральных удобрений,клеенки и подготовки земли к весенне-полевым работам. Доходы от кредита Самара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на строительство жилого дома.
texts.en: Samara is 22 years old, married,  and a child of preschool age. As a main source of income for her family, Samara grows produce and raises livestock. Having launched her business in 2012 with 5,000 KGS, now Samara has five dairy cows and five sheep, as well as a land plot with a greenhouse. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. Samara is a member of the Chynara group, which is composed of three members. In order to develop her farm further, Samara has turned to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution to buy mineral fertilizers and greenhouse film as well as prepare the soil for the spring seasonal work. Samara plans to use the resulting income for an additional increase of livestock. She also intends to save up for buying a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
This is Esperanza, 38, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and she has children. Together with her husband, she manages their household, while operating a business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Esperanza sells dishwashing liquid and detergent powder. She has a supplier who delivers it to her house and she sells it for a little profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Esperanza is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more detergent powder and dishwashing liquid needed in her business.

Esperanza dreams to have her own stall and hopes to have a better living. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more detergent powder and dishwashing liquid needed in her business.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: Don José, es un humilde señor que labora como guarda de seguridad, es padre de dos hijos adolescentes que están estudiando, el solicita el crédito porque desea brindarle mejores condiciones de vida en su hogar para sus hijos y esposa, quiere reparar parte del techo de su casa para recibir este invierno preparado con una mejor infraestructura, ya que ha sufrido de filtración de agua.
texts.en: José is a humble man who works as a security guard. He has two teenage children who are in school. He is requesting this loan because he wants to give his wife and children better living conditions at home. He wants to repair the roof of his house so that he is prepared for the winter with a better infrastructure, since water has seeped through the roof in the past.

loans.use: to buy materials like sheet metal and metal beams.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a married man.  He describes himself to be patient and self motivated.  He operates a food stall where he cooks food for sale.  He has been involved in this business for 4 years.  His business is located on a road side.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices.  He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food for sale.  His business goal is to be a recognized chef within 5 years.  He hopes that in the future, he will provide a quality life for his family.  This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy ingredients for preparing food for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish and charcoal

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 32 years old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines.  Her partner is Wilfredo, a security guard and they have children.  She and her partner are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.  She works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Edna operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns her profits by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales everyday.

She is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Edna hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a happy family.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs that will help her tend her coffee crops.

loans.name: Valida

texts.en:
Valida is a 30-year-old married woman from Tbilisi city. She lives with her husband, who works as a chef at a local restaurant and generates 400 GEL (Georgia lari) monthly; that is the only source of income for family. Valida doesn't have her own activity, in spite of her high education. 

She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows rural poor like Valida to get a chance for starting or re-starting business. 

She will use the requested money for opening a bakery and will lead the business herself. Valida has already found the place and wants to repair it and buy necessary merchandise for her bakery. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent.

The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased. Regards to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Nino

texts.en: Nino is 33-year-old married woman from Gori district. She lives with her husband and two children, who go to school. Nino works as a sales lady at a shoe shop and gets a small monthly salary. Nino wants to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $3,000. With the received credit, she will start trading sand. She will purchase the sand at a wholesale price and then resell at a higher price. This will increase the income of her family, and Nino will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Nino awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase sand at a wholesale price to resell

loans.name: Enrique Porfirio

texts.es: Enrique se dedica a la venta de ceviche por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo limones, pescados, sal, cebollas, lechugas y otras cosas más, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Enrique works selling ceviche, so this time he is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as limes, fish, salt, onions, lettuce, and other items.

He wants to thank everyone who is a part of this dream and makes these resources possible. He values this loan and promises to pay his monthly installments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like limes, fish, salt, onions, lettuce, and other items.

loans.name: Sitoramoh

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Sitoramoh works hard to support her family. She has a clothes sales business in Tajikistan. She has had this business for seven years.  
Sitoramoh has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from the Imon International organization. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money. In the future, Sitoramoh hopes to improve her business to provide for the education of her children.
Sitoramoh is asking for a loan of 2,500 TJS to buy children's clothes for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Hilola

texts.en:
Hilola was born in 1973. She is divorced and has three children. Hilola is the only provider for her children because her former husband doesn’t help her. She has her own business. Hilola sells men’s clothes and shoes. Hilola has been busy with selling clothing and shoes for more than five years. She has her regular customers because she renews the assortment of her goods every season. 

She is going to buy goods for the new season, but she doesn't have the money. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy men’s clothes and shoes. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy men’s clothes and shoes for the new season

loans.name: Azizmoh

texts.en:
Azizmoh was born in 1965. She is a responsible mother of two children. To be a responsible mother, she began her business with cooking and selling flatbreads. She began this business 16 years ago. Azizmoh runs her business well because she has great experience. She sells flatbreads in a local market. 

Azizmoh is a repeat client of IMON. She used her previous loans for developing her business. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy flour, firewood, etc., for increasing her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy flour, firewood, etc., for increasing her bakery's working capital

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es: Pascual se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono y semillas, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad, él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Marticito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Pascual works farming and raising livestock. This time he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. He is grateful to everyone who is a part of this dream by making these resources possible. He appreciates this loan and promises to pay his monthly installments responsibly. He belongs to the communal bank San Marticito of Asociación Arariwa, in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a 24-year-old married woman who has one child. She describes herself as nice and talkative. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to open a hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 37-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Percy Ubaldo

texts.es: Percy vive en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo  y tiene 46 años de edad, él es una persona alegre y carismático que se dedica a alquilar vehiculos por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimientos de los carros, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Percy lives in the beautiful city of Paucartambo and is 46 years old. He is a happy and charismatic person who makes a living by renting vehicles, so at this time he requires the loan to do maintenance on the cars. He thanks those who form part of this dream by this means, as he values the loan and commits to making his monthly payments with a lot of responsibility.

loans.use: to do car maintenance

loans.name: 14 Yên Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thanh is 31 years old and she is married, with two children. She is the group leader of the 14 Yên Trường Group, which consists of five members. 

In 2011, Thanh joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Thanh has successfully repaid three loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Thanh has been involved in this business for seven years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a 34-year-old married woman who has two children, ages 6 and 9 years. She describes herself as focused and God fearing. She operates a  stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to open a hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business and family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 59-year-old lady and is married to Ignatius, a 61-year-old man. They have three children; two of them are married and live with their new families.  Their youngest son, Ricardo, 18, is now in 3rd grade of Senior High School and lives with them.

Imelda runs a chicken-selling business. The business is located at her residence. She has been running the business for more than 2 years. Imelda buys chicks and fodder from the supplier; she needs about two to four weeks to raise the chicks and sell them to the customers. The customers come to her house when the chickens are ready to sell. 

Presently, Imelda needs some capital to buy more chicks and make a bigger chicken coop; therefore she requests a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. It will be spent on chicks and materials to build the coop.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and materials to build the coop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking fat, drinks, eggs and other items

loans.name: Guguli

texts.en:
Guguli is a 44-year-old married woman from village Avralo, Tsalka district. She has a husband and two school-aged and student daughters. Guguli and her husband are extensively engaged in cattle breeding and in cultivating a plot of agricultural land; particularly, they seed potatoes and use it for local trading. For further development, her agricultural business needs some investment. Guguli requested money and was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables people to start or re-start businesses. She will expand her activity, purchase a mini-bus and sell products to the various regions. Guguli also will purchase many kind of fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices and sell at an increased price. Her husband also will help her for generating more income and achieving financial stability for their family. 

Guguli is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure her children have good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Guguli is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to generate more income.

loans.use: To start trading in fruits and vegetables with a mini-bus

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big for her children’s education and in meeting their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in increased profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Noemi hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Meet Beatrice, a farmer living in the rich highlands of Eldoret, which is situated in the north rift side of Kenya. She is married and has 3 children, all of school-going age.

She has been doing farming for over 5 years, and her primary income sources are milk, crops, and a retail business.

Beatrice said that she was interested in Juhudi Kilimo because they offer various products that are farmer-friendly and help farmers in their farming activities. During the training, she learnt that she should always develop a lifestyle of saving for the betterment of her life. She will use this loan for buying a water tank that will provide water for her crops and livestock. This will increase her level of income and thus improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank to provide water for her crops and livestock.

loans.name: Halima & Linus

texts.en:
Halima is 30 years old, married and has two children, ages 3 and 5, who both attend school. She also looks after two orphans by providing all their basic needs like school fees and clothes.
She operates a retail shop at a market street in the city center. She has been in business for the last five years, mostly dealing in the sale of thread, zippers, and buttons. She decided to start up this business to supplement her husband’s income which didn’t sustain the family. 
She has hopes of becoming a famous business lady by expanding her business. If she is able to acquire a loan, this will also boost her sales.
She faces challenges of competition from surrounding businesses which are well stocked, and a lack of enough capital. Pictured is Halima and her husband as joint borrowers.

loans.use: To buy zippers, thread and buttons to sell

loans.name: Ramon Alberto

texts.es:
Ramón, tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su mamá de 55 años de edad y dos hermanos, desde  muy joven aprendió lo relacionado con la agricultura y la crianza de ganado, lo hace con ayuda de sus hermanos, trabaja todos los días.
Solicita capital para comprar abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, plaguicidas, semilla, ya que son los materiales necesarios para preparar la tierra y sembrar en el tiempo indicado. Esperar una cosecha más abundante, libre de plagas, tener más ganancias.
Su aspiración es crecer con su negocio y brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ramón is 24 years old and lives with his mother, who is 55, and two siblings. When he was very young, he started learning about farming and raising livestock. He works every day, and does so with help from his brothers.

He is requesting capital to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and seeds, which are the supplies he needs to prepare the land and plant his crops at the right time. He hopes to have a more abundant harvest, free of pests, and more profitable.

His aspirations are for his business to grow and to give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Remjius

texts.en:
Remjius is a 32-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 8 years. 

He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of tools. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy tools for use in the garage. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will benefit from the business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy tools for use in the garage.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.en:
Jumagul is a kind and hardworking woman. She is married and brings up a daughter. Jumagul has since childhood liked to cook a variety of breads and dishes. 

Nineteen years ago, she began her business with cooking and selling flatbread. She has her own workshop in her house. Jumagul sells flatbread near her house. Her neighbors are regular customers. She has great experience in this field. 

She is going to increase her working capital and in this way, develop her business. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy flour, coal, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy flour, coal, etc. for her flatbread business.

loans.name: Elba Esther

texts.es:
Semanalmente Elba hace entrega a las talabarterías del departamento de Estelí, de donde es originaria, los productos de cuero que son de su creación, los que van innovando con el pasar del tiempo. Tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo. Aprendió el oficio de la talabartería desde temprana edad, con el pasar del tiempo se convirtió en la fuente principal de ingresos en su familia, a la que desea brindarle un futuro prosperó.
Uno de sus sueños más grandes, es acondicionar los servicios sanitarios de su hogar, está es la razón principal por la que solicita el crédito. Elba pone su confianza en Kiva y MiCrédito para brindarle a su familia una vida saludable y grata. Es una mujer visionaria y disciplinada, anhela seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, asimismo llegar a poner su propio puesto de talabartería. Tiene fe en que todos sus objetivos se cumplan.
texts.en:
Elba makes leather products and delivers them weekly to the tack shops in the department of Estelí, where she is from. She innovates her products with time. She is 42 years old and married with one child. She learned how to work leather at a young age and in time this became her family's main source of income. She wants to give her family a prosperous future. 

One of her greatest dreams is to update the bathrooms in her home, which is the main reason why she is requesting this loan. Elba has put her trust in Kiva and MiCrédito in order to give her family a healthy and pleasant life. She is a visionary and disciplined woman who wants to keep investing in her business. She would also like to one day open her own tack shop. She is confident that all her goals will be met.

loans.use: to update the bathrooms in her house.

loans.name: Merlo Manger

texts.es:
Cada mañana el olor a pan recién salido del horno deleita a los vecinos más cercanos de la panadería de Merlo, quien a diario se esmera por ofrecer un producto de calidad para que su clientela quede satisfecha y regrese. Él tiene 58 años y está a cargo de uno de sus tres hijos. Lleva ochos años laborando de panadero, actividad que realiza con mucho esmero y dedicación. 
Merlo solicita un crédito, puesto que anhela aumentar el capital de su producción, requiere comprar harina, levadura, azúcar, entre otros productos. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a obtener mejores ingresos, que le permitirá  ofrecerle estabilidad económica y un futuro grato a su familia, quienes son su prioridad.
texts.en:
Every morning the smell of freshly baked bread delights the neighbors of Merlo’s bakery. Merlo strives to provide a high quality product daily so that his customers are satisfied and return. He is 58 years old, and has one of his three children still in his care. He has worked as a baker for eight years, which he does with great care and dedication.
 
Merlo is requesting a loan, as he wants to increase the capital of his production, requiring him to buy flour, yeast, and sugar, among other products. He feels that the loan will help him get better returns, allowing him to provide economic stability and a pleasant future for his family, who are his priority.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, and sugar, among other products.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal is aged 30, married and a resident of Kyengera, a city suburb. Faisal has three children, aged 7, 4 and 2 years. He, however, also looks after one of his brother’s children, since his brother has no capacity for looking after the child.

Faisal is a boda boda (motorcycle) cyclist in Kampala city center, and this is how he has managed to cater to his family. Faisal wakes up at 6:00 a.m. every day to start his daily routine. In addition, he also keeps poultry, which increases his income; hence, enabling him to cater to his family.

Faisal approached Ugafode Microfinance for a loan to purchase feed for his poultry. 

Faisal is humble, social and cooperative according to his neighbours and workmates.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed.

loans.name: Miguel Angel Coreas

texts.es:
Miguel, manifiesta que por el capital anterior le ayudo a tener los materiales necesarios para cumplir con los diferentes pedidos de la sastrería y construir un muro, con lo que sus utilidades son mayores.
En esta oportunidad el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de telas, zippers, tijeras, hilos, botones, broches, carreteles, etc., para continuar trabajando y ofreciendo buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miguel says that his previous loan helped him to have all the necessary materials to complete various tailor orders and to build a wall, so his profits are higher.

With this opportunity, the loan that he is requesting will be invested in buying fabric, zippers, scissors, thread, buttons, brooches, spools, etc., to continue working and offering good service to his clients.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, scissors, thread, buttons, brooches, spools, etc.

loans.name: Twisununure Group

texts.fr:
Egide fait partie du groupe Twisununure  et habite à Gitega. Il a 44 ans et est marié à Maliane,
 une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  7 enfants  dont 2 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de viande et de haricot depuis  3 ans.

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  haricot et  de viande, à  revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Egide is a member of the Twisununure Group and lives in Gitega. He is 44 years old and is married to Maliane, a farmer. They have seven children together, two of whom attend school.

Egide has been selling meat and beans for three years. He is on his third loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan, he will increase his resources to purchase a large quantity of beans and meat to sell in order to earn more.

loans.use: To increase his resources and purchase a large quantity of beans and meat to sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 300 chickens and build a pen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tents to rent.

loans.name: Carmen Areli

texts.es: Carmen tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 9 años de edad. Carmen trabaja como operaria en una empresa cercana a su localidad desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado que el que tiene se encuentra en mal estado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada y madera. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento dado que no posee la capacidad económica para hacer el desembolso, pero si con la capacidad de pago mensual que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Carmen is 28 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and small 9-year-old child. Carmen has worked as an operator in a business near her local area for a long time. This is how she makes a living and along with her life partner maintains the household’s economy.

With the goal of improving her living conditions, she has made the decision to apply for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the repair of the roof of the home given that the one she has is in bad condition. With the amount requested, she will purchase galvanized sheet metal and wood. She hopes to be able to count on this loan given that she does not possess the economic capacity to cover the expense, but she can with the monthly payment amount that the loan requires.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal and wood to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
Gabina se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora en un local llamado "picanteria", ella desde hacer varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bine y por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, jora, harina, cerveza y otras cosas más, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. 

Ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Gabina makes a living through jora chicha in a business called a “picantería.” For many years she has made a living through this business and it has gone very well for her. 

Therefore, in this opportunity she requires the loan to purchase supplies such as, for example, sugar, jora maize, flour, beer, and others. She is thankful to those who form part of this dream through these means. She values the loan and promises to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

She belongs to the communal bank “San Martincito,” part of the Associación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as, for example, sugar, jora maize, flour, beer, and more.

loans.name: Jeyne Ramon

texts.es:
Extensas olas de hojas verdes de plátano, bordean la cerca construida con palos y alambres de púas de la finca de Jeynez, un joven de 30 años, quien desde pequeño incursionó en la agricultura.
Hace cinco años tuvo la oportunidad de crecer en su ambiente de trabajo, tras la herencia de tierras, por parte de su madre; y como buen trabajador y joven emprendedor, no desaprovechó la oportunidad de salir adelante y empezó solo a cultivar tomate. Poco a poco ha ido incrementando su variedad de productos, así como sus deseos de superación. Su principal motor para salir adelante son sus tres hijos y su esposa. 
Ahora sus principales productos para comercializar en el mercado de Masaya son: plátano, maíz, tomate, limones y mangos, los cuales necesita seguir manteniendo con el préstamo MiCrédito-KIVA y así proveerle a sus clientes un mejor producto. En un futuro espera adquirir un equipo de riego para su finca, y así mejorar su calidad de vida mediante el incremento de sus cultivos.
texts.en: A sea of green plantain leaves enclosed in a wood-and-barbed wire fence: such is Jeynez's farm. He is 30 years old and has been a farmer since he was very young. Five years ago, he had the opportunity to grow in his chosen field of activity, thanks to land given to him by his mother. As the hard-working young entrepreneur he is, he seized said opportunity to get ahead in life and started growing tomatoes. Over the years, he started diversifying his crops, always moved by the desire to improve his lot in life. He finds motivation in his wife and their three children. He now sells a variety of produce at the market in Masaya: plantain, sweetcorn, tomatoes, lemons and mangoes. He needs a loan to keep tending to his crops and sell better-quality produce to his customers. His hope for the future is to buy an irrigation system for his crops, so as to increase his production and improve his life.

loans.use: to tend to his crops.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José, es casado, no tiene hijos, vive en casa alquilada, desde hace un año instalo una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su residencia, lo hace con la ayuda de su esposa, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. a 9:00 p.m., por su experiencia el negocio marcha muy bien.
Comprará azúcar, sal, bebidas, papel higiénico, boquitas, granos básicos, dulces, jabón, entre otros productos que sus clientes buscan en su negocio, espera incrementar las ventas y las ganancias.
Su sueño es tener más estabilidad económica para ahorrar y comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
José is married, has no children, and lives in a rented house. A year ago, he set up a store in his home where he sells basic necessities with the help of his wife. His schedule is from 6:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. As a result of his experience, his business is doing very well.

José will buy sugar, salt, beverages, toilet paper, snack foods, basic grains, candy, soap, and other products that his customers are requesting from his business. He hopes to increase his sales and his earnings. His dream is to have more financial stability so that he can save and buy a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, beverages, toilet paper, snack foods, basic grains, candy, soap, and other products.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a resident of Lukwanga in Wakiso district. He looks after his aged mother and siblings in the village.  

Nelson left his mother and siblings in the village in 1996 and came to Kampala to look for a formal job that would pay him well and enable him to provide for his family since they were starving. Having failed to get a job, Nelson decided to start up a small retail shop business in Lukwanga village, a Wakiso suburb. Due to his honest and good customer care his business has been able to grow at a very fast rate. However, he does not regret having this business because it has helped him support his family and meet all their needs.

Nelson, however, needs a loan to boost his business and enable him to realize his dream of becoming a prominent businessman.

loans.use: To buy household items to sell in the retail shop

loans.name: Mercedes Karolina

texts.es:
Día a día Mercedes trabaja con esmero y dedicación para cumplir uno de sus más grandes sueños, mejorar los servicios higiénicos de su casa. Ella es originaria de Wiwili, Nueva Segovia, está casada y tiene tres hijos. Es una mujer emprendedora y carismática. Desde hace nueve años labora de contadora, junto a su esposo buscan los medios factibles para brindarle un hogar seguro y un futuro grato a sus hijos. 
Mercedes solicita el préstamo para la construcción de su hogar, enfocada principalmente en el perfeccionamiento de los servicios higiénicos, para ella uno de los factores importantes es la salud de su familia. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento de Kiva y MiCrédito, puesto que le serán de mucha ayuda en los cambios que anhela realizar en su hogar. Uno de planes futuros es seguir invirtiendo en el acondicionamiento de su casa y establecer un puesto de comida rápida.
texts.en:
Mercedes works day after day with dedication and energy.  One of her greatest dreams is to improve the hygienic condition of her home. She is originally from Wiwili, in Nueva Segovia Nicaragua, and she is married with three children.  She is a hard-working and charismatic woman.  She has been working as an accountant for nine years.  Along with her husband she is looking for manageable means to make their home more secure and to offer their children a good future.    

Mercedes is asking for a loan in order to complete construction on her house, principally improving the hygienic conditions.  For her an important issue is the health of her family.  She places her trust in the financing from Kiva and their partner MiCrédito.  It will help her make the changes she longs for to her home.  One of her plans is to continue investing in the improvements of her home in order to then be able to start a fast food stall.

loans.use: to complete construction on her house, principally improving the hygienic conditions.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
This is the room where Andrea has been living since his divorce from his wife; he wants to make some repairs to it, to make it more like a one-room tiny home. An amount of 200,000 ALL that he is requesting from Kiva lenders will be just enough to do all the above. 

Andrea does construction for a living with his focus more on the tile-paving type of thing.  According to him, he is content with what he does for a living and for paying his obligations towards his two school-aged children of the age of 15 and 13. Not only that, but he gives it all to them, he said to the branch assistant who interviewed him. In the village where he currently resides and in the surrounding areas, there has been plenty of construction taking place during the latest years; hence, he has earned an income. 

Andrea will very much appreciate any financial help from Kiva lenders through this loan request.

loans.use: to make some repairs to the one-room tiny home where he has been living since his divorce

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El estudiante Alejandro que entra a segundo semestre de la carrera Cocina en el cual ha aprendido varias técnicas  tanto culinarias como personales, entre ellas se encuentran:

Él ha puesto en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos en el primer semestre de Cocina para colaborar en los diferentes eventos familiares.

En lo personal ha aprendido a tener un buen manejo con los alimentos, separándolos en los diferentes métodos, para evitar problemas de salud  en los consumidores.

El estudiante se encuentra preparado para comenzar el segundo semestre y así adquirir muchos más conocimientos para tener unas excelentes prácticas en un futuro y así podrá desempeñarse de la mejor manera en un trabajo a futuro.
La razón por la cual necesita  el convenio Kiva es porque está terminando grado 11 y los gastos se incrementan un poco, ya que como todavía está en el colegio aún les exigen diferentes cosas, más los utensilios que le esté necesitando para la carrera de cocina, seria de una gran ayuda el convenio de kiva, ya que empezaría apagar un valor menor y se puede economizar un dinero para el colegio.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a student who is entering his second semester in a culinary program. He has learned various techniques, both culinary and personal, which include the following:

He has put into practice the knowledge he acquired in his first semester of culinary arts to collaborate on different family events.

Personally, he has learned how to handle foods well, separating them in different methods to avoid health problems for consumers. 

Alejandro is ready to start his second semester and be able to gain more knowledge. That way he will have excellent practices for the future and be able to perform in the best way possible in a future job. 

The reason Alejandro needs the Kiva loan is because he is finishing the 11th grade, and the costs are increasing a little. Although he is still in college, different things are required of him now, including the utensils he will now be needing for his culinary program. The Kiva loan would be a big help, since he would start off with a lower amount to pay, and he would be able to save money for college.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase coal and wood to sell for heating.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala después de alternar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un torito para hacerlo engordar y hacerlo crecer para luego venderlo en alguna feria. 

Pascuala agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella quiere continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio.
texts.en: Pascuala is a housewife, a farmer, and raises livestock. She asks for this loan to buy a young bull that she will fatten and ultimately sell for a profit at the market. Pascuala thanks lenders for the loan and is happy at the idea of receiving such support. She wants to continue her connection to the project because it allows her to build working capital and also because she is motivated to keep working in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy a young bull.

loans.name: Mausauri

texts.es: Mausauri  se dedica  a la  venta de útiles de escritorio por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cuadernos, lapiceros, papeles y otras cosas más, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. Él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Mausauri sells office supplies. He asks for this loan in order to buy said merchandise, such as notebooks, pens, paper, and other items. He thanks those who lend their support to his dream and values their help very highly, which is why he promises to be punctual and responsible in his repayments. He belongs to communal bank "San Martincito" of Asociación Arariwa, in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy office supplies to sell.

loans.name: Nolkiyeku

texts.en: Nolkiyeku is a 56-year-old woman who has five children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to own a large piece of land within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be economically stable. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: 11 Tân  Hưng, Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xinh has a retail business selling dry food and general things. She is requesting a loan to purchase votive objects, dry food and general things to resell.

Xinh is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children. Xinh is the group leader of the 11 Tân Hưng, Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

This is Xinh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Xinh has been involved in this business for 5 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Xinh hopes to build a new house. She also hopes for her business to do well and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase votive objects, dry food and general things to resell.

loans.name: 06 Đông Hòa Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Gấm works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future. She is 37 years old, and she is married with two children. Gấm is the group leader of the 06 Đông Hòa Hưng Lộc Solidarity Group, which consists of six members. This is Gấm’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years. One of her most critical business concerns is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Gấm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nohemi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nohemy, es casada, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 6 y un año de edad, se dedica a vender ropa usada, en su casa y en el mercado municipal de su localidad, trabaja todos los días, su experiencia le ha permitido administrar muy bien su negocio.
Invertirá en la compra de pantalones, blusas, suéteres, trajes, blusas, faldas, vestidos entre otras prendas  para damas, caballeros, niños y niñas, con esta ayuda cumplirá con los gusto de sus clientes y tanto sus ventas como sus ingresos incrementaran.
Su sueño es tener los recursos económicos necesarios para comprar su casa propia y continuar apoyando a su esposo en los gastos famliares.
texts.en:
Nohemy is married and lives with her husband and their two children aged 6 and one. She sells used clothes from her home and in her local town market. She works every day. Her experience has allowed her to manage her business really well.
She will use the loan to invest in clothing such as trousers, blouses, sweaters, suits, shirts, skirts and dresses, for men, women and children. By means of this help, she can get what her customers want and increase her sales and income.
Her dream is to have the necessary economic recourses to buy her own house and continue to help her husband with the family bills.

loans.use: to buy garments including trousers, blouses, sweaters, suits, shirts, skirts and dresses.

loans.name: Ajet

texts.en:
Ajet is a 34-year-old married father of two children, 6 and 4 years old, who resides in a little town with not more than 30,000 inhabitants. 

He is a video camera operator/photographer by profession and the reason why he is requesting this loan is to buy new equipment. He earns okay from this profession when he is called to different events such as weddings, baptisms, engagement parties, etc., to record the events. 

Ajet does agriculture as well for living. Back in his village, where his parents still reside, he’s got a dairy cow, plum orchards and grapevines; he uses the fresh produce for his family mainly and whatever is left, he sells at some local market. Note that a dairy cow produces about 20 kg/day during the production months; thus, a family of four might use up about half of this milk, 10 kg/day, including here the cheese and cottage cheese that require more milk to make.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for his video camera/photography profession

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
This is Dila, a 51-year-old married mother of five children. One of them finished university recently and is trying to go to England to complete the Master's Degree on a scholarship basis. Before all this though, she’s got to do all the papers at the British Embassy in Tirana and the process of completing the papers costs some money that Dila at the moment don’t have. This is the reason why she is requesting an amount of 220,000 ALL.

Dila has been doing agriculture for very long time; planting, harvesting and selling seasonal veggies, wheat, animal fodder, and fruits such as cherries, apples, pears, plums, and peaches; she has livestock and in particular, she’s got cows, chickens, and pigs and sells the products to the local market; she makes and sells approximately 400 liters of homemade alcohol drink (raki) and 300 liters of homemade red wine every year. Through all this rural practice, she makes an okay income to cover for the expenses of the family.

loans.use: to help her daughter to study abroad on a scholarship; the loan will be used to do the papers at the British Embassy

loans.name: Klodiana

texts.en:
Klodiana is 33 years old and had a dairy cow that unfortunately passed away, unexpectedly, some days back. She must replace it by buying a new one soon, because through that cow Klodiana secured the staple dairy products for her family, particularly for her three children ranging in age from 14 to 2 years old. 

Klodiana also has some chickens at home and she sells hens and eggs and plants, wheat  in large quantities and in smaller quantities, seasonal veggies. Her husband works as a prison guard and her mother-in-law, who lives with them according to tradition, gets her pension income. 

Klodiana and her family lived in the very northern part of the country that remained covered in snow most of the year and for rural people that was very difficult. They then settled here at the current location that during summer months is very hot and dry; however, by building their house by a river bank, the water supply from the river has made it easier on the new residents’ agricultural activities.

loans.use: to replace a cow that pased away by buying a new one

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza has been suffering from her kidneys for some years now. The specialists scheduled her for an immediate surgery to remove the left kidney after the unsuccessful results of her first surgery, but she does not have the money to pay for it. A loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek will enable her to go ahead with this surgical procedure. 

Liza is 57 and has a 27-year-old grownup child. The activity that she has pursued for a long time now has been agriculture, just like the majority of rural residents. She plants and sells mostly seasonal veggies and added to that, she has cherry orchards and grapevines. The health issues that she has been experiencing lately though, have made it impossible for her, as she says, to run her daily activities.

loans.use: to pay for surgery

loans.name: Sabella

texts.en: Sabella is a married woman who has two children. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a farm where she grows crops and also keeps poultry. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are farmers and retailers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will open shops to sell her farm products and be rich. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
La señorita Eliana tiene 25 años, vive en Kennedy con el hijo y el esposo,  quiere especializarse en técnico en servicios farmacéuticos de la institución CAMPO ALTO ACESALUD por qué sabe que es una institución conocida y de excelente calidad, además quiere tener una mejor calidad de vida y brindarle al hijo un mejor futuro, ya que  quiere superarse teniendo una excelente formación para seguir con los estudios.
Ella necesita del subsidio con kiva porque es una buena oportunidad para ella, ya que con los gastos del hogar, del hijo y los que ella tiene en el estudio no le alcanza todo el dinero para poder pagar las cuotas mensuales que ella debe cancelar, es por eso que ella al tener el convenio de kiva le serviría bastante porque se puede ahorrar un dinero y eso lo utiliza ejn los gastos del hijo o para lo que necesite en el momento.
texts.en:
The young lady Eliana is 25 years old. She lives in Kennedy with her son and her husband. She wants to study to be a technician in pharmaceutical services at the Campo Alto Acesalud institution, because she knows that it is a well-known institution of excellent quality. In addition, she wants to have a better quality of life and offer her son a better future, since she wants to better herself, having an excellent training to continue with her studies.
