She needs the benefit from Kiva because it is a good opportunity for her, since with the household expenses, those of her son, and those she has in school, the money doesn't go far enough to be able to pay the monthly bills that she should pay off. It is for this reason that having the agreement with Kiva would serve her well, because she could save some money and use it for her son's expenses or for what she needs at the moment.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school fees.

loans.name: Angela Cecilia

texts.es: Angela tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella posee una pupusería (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz, queso, frijoles, etc.) en su hogar de habitación y gracias a su experiencia y carisma ha sabido ganarse a los clientes quienes cada día la prefieren más. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda para el cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Angela is 36 years old and resides in her own home along with her family. She owns a “pupusería” (a shop that sells “pupusas”, a traditional dish made with corn, cheese, beans, and other ingredients) that is set up in her home. Thanks to her experience and her charisma, Angela is able to attract more customers who prefer to do business with her each day.

In order to improve her living conditions, Angela decided to request a loan from FUSAI so that she could invest in repairs to the roof of her home. She will use the money to buy needed materials such as galvanized sheets, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and nails in order to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Mabibo Freedom Group

texts.en:
Mariamu is in her early 40s and has two daughters and one son who are in school. Mariamu is a widowed mother who makes her living by managing two businesses. She manages a charcoal store and a shop selling cosmetics. Mariamu has been in these businesses for five years now and is able to make a very good monthly profit. She opens her shop from 8 am to 9 pm each working day. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her tenth loan request which she will use to buy cosmetics for her shop. Mariamu used the previous loans (all of which paid back successfully) to start her store of charcoal and buy stock of cosmetics. Mariamu generated a profit, which she used to build a house and paid for her children's school fees and improve her family welfare. She dreams of improving her family life by owning a nice car. 

Mariamu will share this loan with her loan group" Mabibo Freedom" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her store

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.es: Nicasio se dedica a la venta de ollas, frazadas, colchones y artefactos por lo tanto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar ollas, frazadas y otras cosas más, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. Él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Marticito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Nicasio works selling pots, blankets, mattresses, and appliances. That's why he currently needs a loan to buy more pots, blankets, and other items. He appreciates the people who are a part of his dream by supporting him with a loan that he values, and he promises to responsibly comply with the monthly repayment schedule. He belongs to the community bank "San Marticito" in the Arariwa Association in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy pots, blankets and other items to sell.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.en:
Zulaykho was born in 1967. She is widowed and brings up two children. 

For more than 30 years, Zulaykho has been busy with sewing. She sews national women's dresses. She serves her clients in her house. Zulaykho has great experience in this field and developed the business little by little. Her daughter helps her with managing the business. 

Zulaykho is only the feeder and keeper of her children. Now, one of her children is ill. She must buy medicines for treatment but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy medicines for treatment of her child. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment of her child

loans.name: 16 Tân Hưng, Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng has a retail business selling dry food and general things. She is requesting a loan to purchase votive objects, dry food and general things to resell.

Hồng is 30 years old and she is married with 3 children. Hồng is the group leader of the 16 Tân Hưng, Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

In 2012, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hồng has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hồng has been involved in this business for 5 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Hồng hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase votive objects, dry food and general things to resell.

loans.name: 04-12-07-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thảo operates a food stall restaurant selling rice noodles. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork and noodles to make processed food. Thảo is 47 years old, and she is married with three children. She is the group leader of the 04-12-07-Nam Ngạn Solidarity Group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thảo has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Thảo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase pork and noodles to make processed food.

loans.name: 04-12-01-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phượng operates a food stall restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to sell. Phượng is 52 years old, and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 04-12-01-Nam Ngạn Solidarity Group, which consists of three members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phượng has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Phượng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia previously accessed a loan of 30,000 PHP that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, as well as their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

Olivia would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Olivia hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams to have a peaceful life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draws strength from studying the Word of God.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new griddle for pupusas.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta lives with her husband in Lanjazat village. Their children are married and live with their families separately. 

Mareta works at the village municipality and together with her husband also runs a farm. They keep sheep and two calves. However, the main business activity for this couple is land cultivation. Near the village where they live, Mareta and her husband cultivate tomato and grow different types of fruit trees (peach, apricot, apple and pear). Now, by applying for this loan, Mareta is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to improve her farm. She plans to purchase tomato seeds, 10 sheep, and a calf and hire workers for cultivation work. 

She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her agribusiness is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Mareta has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tomato seeds, 10 sheep, and a calf and hire workers for cultivation work

loans.name: Jose Inocente

texts.es:
José, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad, desde muy joven aprendió de su papá a elaborar diferentes clases de pan, su jornada de trabajo es de 4:00 a.m. a 12.00 p.m., realizando esta actividad ha salido adelante junto a su familia.
Con el financiamiento comprara canela, azúcar, huevos, harina, manteca, levadura, bolsas, etc., será de mucha utilidad para aumentar la producción, mejorar las ventas y las ganancias, con las cuales cancelara el préstamo y mejorara las condiciones familiares.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando y comprar una motocicleta para distribuir mejor el producto.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children, ages 8 and 3. When José was a young man, his father taught him how to make different types of bread. His work schedule is from 4:00 A.M. to 12:00 P.M. He goes about his work so that he and his family can forge ahead together.

With this loan, José will buy cinnamon, sugar, eggs, flour, shortening, yeast, bags, and other supplies that will be useful and allow him to increase his products. As a result, he will be able to improve his sales and his earnings. José would be able to repay the loan and improve the conditions for his family.

His dream is to continue working and to purchase a motorcycle so that it would be easier for him to distribute his product.

loans.use: to buy cinnamon, sugar, eggs, flour, shortening, yeast, bags, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 58-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband Irodi in a small village of the Kvareli district, Kakheti Region. Irodi is provided with a retirement pension. Eliza and her husband are unemployed. 

Eliza decided to start a business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1300 GEL to purchase a horse. Eliza and her husband will provide transportation of wood by horse. They will sell wood at a good price and will generate income. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family. Eliza awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a horse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish at wholesale.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 47 years old, married, and blessed with three children. Two of her children already finished their college education, through her patience and perseverance. 

Jenifer is engaged in direct selling of cosmetics products, shoes, and ready-to-wear products. She has been 10 years in this type of business, and her income served as her children allowances when sending them to school. Jenifer's husband is a construction worker, and when having a vacant time he operates their tricycle for passengers' transportation to generate additional income. 

Jenifer is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase her customers' orders. She will purchase cosmetics, shoes, shirts, and underwear to sell. Jenifer hope to satisfy her customers in order to encourage more people to become her customers too. If she produces more costumers, her income will also increase.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, shoes, shirts, and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en: Barno studies at the Tajikistan State University of Politics and Business. She studies at the Faculty of Law and is a student of the 4th course. She has the ability to be occupied with the Law. She is not married and lives with her parents. Her friends love her very much, because she is clever and good-natured. She has excellent and good marks, and she wants to pay to study, but her income isn’t enough. She is asking for a loan to pay for her studies and awaits your help. Your help will make happy her.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Dúo Dios Todo Poderoso Group

texts.es:
Dúo Dios Todo Poderoso
El dúo está integrado por Lesbia de 22 años de edad es originaria de Sumpango ella se dedica a la elaboración de tamales y a la confección  de tejidos  todos los días desde muy temprano empieza a elaborar las cosa que utilizaran para poder realizar sus actividades diarias ella es muy trabajadora y emprendedora tiene muchos sueños por realizar es por eso que solicitan un crédito para poder trabajar, comprar materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos y desenvolverse más en la vida así mismo colaborar en la economía familiar.
texts.en:
“Dios Todo Poderoso” (Almighty God) Group

This group includes Lesbia, age 22. She is originally from Sumpango and earns her living by making tamales and producing woven goods. Every day she wakes up very early so that she can begin making the things that she will use for her daily activities. Lesbia is a very hardworking and enterprising individual who has many dreams to achieve.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan to use for her work. She will buy raw materials for making woven goods. This will allow her to get along with her life and also be able to contribute to the family finances.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for producing woven goods.

loans.name: Ma. Consuelo

texts.en:
Ma. Consuelo is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more grocery items for her variety store. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Consuelo hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael, a father of two, lives in Kisii, Kenya. He owns a very small plot of land which he has been working on for eight years now. He has been making money by selling milk and eggs. He also grows tea on his farm. Farming has been his main source of income. Like other farmers in the region, they have various challenges including marketing of their produce and poor road network.

To meet his financial needs, he formed a small group with other farmers and joined Juhudi Kilimo (microfinance for smallholder farmers) because of the low interest rate. Since joining, he has acquired training on basic business and financial skills to manage his high business expenses. He strives to improve the living standards of his family through expanding his asset base by taking agricultural loans.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Gustavo, a sus 49 años de edad, es padre soltero de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante, trabajando arduas jornadas para generar ingresos y brindarles educación, alimento y bienestar.
Desde hace 25 años se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una carpintería ubicada en un barrio popular del municipio donde reside, allí trabaja desde las primeras horas de la mañana para generar los recursos que le permiten solventar los gastos familiares.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de materia prima (madera, puntillas, pegante industrial, pinturas), con el fin de cumplir con una producción que tiene pendiente y así entregar de manera oportuna los pedidos, esto se reflejará en un mayor nivel de ventas y de ingresos.
Gustavo manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es abrir un local y tener su propia galería en la que pueda exhibir todos los muebles que produce, así aumentaría su clientela y sus ventas, mejorando la rentabilidad del negocio para tener una mayor estabilidad económica y disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a 49-year-old single father of three children. He wants them to get ahead, so he works hard so that he can generate income to provide for their education, food, and well-being.

For the past 25 years, Gustavo has worked at his own business. He has a carpentry shop located in a popular neighborhood in the town where he resides. Gustavo works at his shop beginning in the early morning hours so that he can generate the income he needs to take care of his family’s expenses.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of supplies such as wood, tacks, industrial adhesives, and paint. This will allow him to complete his outstanding orders and deliver his products in a timely manner. These results will be reflected with an increase in sales and revenue.

Gustavo says that his greatest wish is to open a location where he can set up his own gallery for displaying all the furniture he produces. This would increase his clientele and his sales, which would improve the profitability of his business and provide him with greater financial stability. As a result, he and his children could enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as wood, tacks, industrial adhesives, and paint.

loans.name: Fodda

texts.en: Fodda is a 41-year-old Lebanese woman. She has operated a Mini-Market for the past ten years. She is a very hard worker. She does not get tired of work, as her only aim is to develop it and benefit from it. And today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy food provisions for her business, to increase her sales, and be able to improve her finances. Fodda declares that she will persist in borrowing additional Kiva loans, as she intends to keep on improving her work, and even open a new branch of her shop.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for her business.

loans.name: 05 Minh Hải Minh Lộc Group

texts.en:
Luyến is 56 years old and she is married with 3 children. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell. Luyến has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Luyến faces in her business is low profit margins.
		
She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 05 Minh Hải Minh Lộc solidarity group. In 2012, Luyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Luyến has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
		
With her business profit, Luyến hopes to buy a motorbike, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo manzanas, duraznos, membrillos, plátanos y otras cosas más, ella agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.  Ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Eulalia works selling fruits and vegetables, and so at this time she needs a loan to buy merchandise such as apples, peaches, quinces, bananas, and other things. She appreciates the people who are part of her dream in this way, since she values the loan and promises to responsibly make her payments every month. She belongs to the community bank "San Martincito" of the Arariwa Association in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as apples, peaches, quinces, bananas, and other things.

loans.name: Fanuel

texts.en: Fanuel is a 31-year-old, married man. He has two children, and describes himself to be honest. He operates a construction business where he builds houses. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy tools. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy tools for construction. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to economically sustain his business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy tools for construction.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Merlinda dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her children a good life and education.  She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products to stock in her store.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en: Shadrack is a 34-year-old, married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be sincere and focused. He operates a retail business where he sells beauty products, pencils, pens and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of pens, pencils, beauty products and other items. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stocks of pens, pencils, beauty products, and other items.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a helpful mother of three children. Through her direct selling business, Lolita successfully gave her children their education. Her business is located in their municipal public market. Lolita’s husband operates their tricycle for passengers’ transportation. Lolita is asking for a loan of P20,000 to purchase cosmetics, shirts, pants, and other ready-to-wear products to sell. She needs to stock more items to respond immediately to her customers’ unexpected orders. Lolita wishes to extend the products she sells and earn a higher income which will enable her to support and help her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, shirts, pants, and other ready-to-wear products to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace previously accessed an 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mary Grace hopes that her business will be more successful, and she dreams to give her child a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Linda is hoping to have additional units of computers and dreams to expand more. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samuel, a father of four, is a very passionate farmer based in Kisii, a rural town in Kenya, known for banana and sugarcane growing. He has been practicing mixed farming for 18 years! He also tries his hands on small business ventures during low seasons. You will catch him selling milk and eggs from his home if not working on his tea farm any day of the week. Poor roads and lack of market are some of the biggest challenges crippling farmers in his village. To gain access to financial services at a low interest rate, Samuel joined Juhudi Kilimo. He seeks to improve his family's livelihood by being able to give his children a good quality education. With your help, Samuel's plan is to acquire an additional good grade cow to increase his milk production and sales.

loans.use: To acquire an additional dairy cow

loans.name: Lumière Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mikamba est une vaillante commerçante depuis 10 ans et membre d’un groupe d’affaires «Lumière».  Senior entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans, veuve et mère de 6 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse divers articles et sociétaire d’une boutique. Elle étale ses business à domicile dans une avenue mouvementée. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter divers produits manufacturés. Elle avait débuté avec de fonds reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite progresser dans son business, acheter une parcelle, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et assurer leurs soins médicaux. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflits dans la région de l’Est Pays. Dans  photo du groupe, certaines clientes portent ses bébés.
texts.en:
Mikamba has been a hard-working shopkeeper for 10 years and is a member of the Lumière Group. A senior businesswoman at 50 years old, she is a widow and the mother of six children who all attend school.

Mikamba sells various goods and is a member of a shop. She lays out her items at her home, [which is on] a busy street. She is seeking a loan from Hekima in order to grow her businesses and is going to purchase various manufactured goods. She began with funds received from her husband when he was still living. 

In the future, Mikamba would like to augment her business, purchase a plot of land, feed her children, send them to school, and provide them with health care. She is thankful to Hekima for supporting businesswomen left out of the traditional banking system, providing them with unsecured loans, especially following the conflicts in Eastern Congo.

[Please note] in the group photo, several clients are carrying their children.

loans.use: To purchase various manufactured goods.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en:
Gulnar is 28 years old married with a daughter and a son. She has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for 8 years. She has good skills in this area and her monthly income is 400 AZN. Her husband is a farmer and helps Gulnar in gardening. 

Fruits and vegetables are very popular in Azerbaijan. People like to eat them fresh or use them to prepare juice and fruit pies. 

Living costs in Azerbaijan are very high and Gulnar isn’t able to cover her family’s demands. She applied for 1500AZN loan in order to buy new garden tools and fertilizers. Good care of garden will increase the harvest and income of the family.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Sevil is 60 years old, married, and has a daughter. She is baker and has been baking and selling bread, cookies, rolls, cakes, gingerbread for 35 years. She has good skills in this area and gets 500AZN monthly. This is the main source of the family’s income but she earns additional money raising greens and vegetables in a garden. Her husband is a pensioner and helps her in gardening.

A bakery is one of the most extended métiers in Azerbaijan because the national cuisine is various. People cook or buy flour products for everyday life and holidays. Sevil’s bakery is the most popular, and local people attend it every day.

Sevil loves her job very much and does everything in order to support the business. She applied for 1500AZN in order to rebuild old bakery and buy new bakery tools.

loans.use: to rebuild old bakery and buy new bakery tools

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a manicurist within her local community. She offers it through home service. It's been five years since she began this business. Lourdes is 22 years old with one child. She aims to have a stable source of income so she could let her son finish his studies and improve her living condition.

Lourdes would like to seek additional capital of PHP5,000 to buy various kinds of nail polish, nipper and nail cuticle. She hopes to obtain this amount of loan so she could give her child a brighter future and sustain her family needs.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of nail polish, nipper and nail cuticle for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Beryl

texts.en: Beryl is a married woman. She describes herself to be God-fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells bags. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are the general public. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bags. Her business goal is to own  a wholesale business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of bags

loans.name: Nichita

texts.en:
This is Nichita, 56, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children. She and her children are managing their household as she operates the business. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Nichita operates a food stall where she sells street foods like fish balls, squid balls and other street foods. In the Philippines, fish balls are commonly sold on street sides; it is served skewered and can be dipped into different kinds of sauces. Fish balls are somewhat flatten in shape and often made with the meat of a cuttlefish. His other products include squid balls and quail eggs. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy squid balls, fish balls and other products needed in her food stall.

Nichita dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her youngest child will finish his studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for squid balls, fish balls and other products needed in her food stall.

loans.name: Kế

texts.en:
Kế works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.  Kế lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. He is 55 years old and married.  He has four children. 

This is Kế's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Kế has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Kế faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine.  He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet and bath-room.

In the future, Kế hopes to make enough money to provide for his kids, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Sadaya

texts.en:
Sadaya is 46 years old, married, and has two daughters. She has been working as a gardener for 15 years. She raises and sells seasonal fruits in the garden. Her monthly income is 500AZN.  She has good experience in this area. Her husband is a farmer, and this brings the family additional income.

Sadaya raises and sells cherries, apples, and pears because people have high demand for fresh fruits. They like to eat them fresh or use to prepare fruit pies. They attend Sadaya’s grocery because fruits there are always fresh and tasty.

Sadaya needs to increase her income in order to be able to cover her family’s demands. She applied for 1000AZN in order to plant other fruit trees and diversify her assortment of groceries.

loans.use: to plant other fruit trees and diversify assortment of groceries

loans.name: Uson

texts.ru: Усон 25 лет, не женат, детей нет. Усон занимается полеводством и животноводством. Выращиванием овощей он стал заниматься с 2010 года с 10,000 сом (KGS), выращивает  в основном арбуз, хлопок, кукурузу. В хозяйстве есть также 1 лошадь и 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход Усона составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Усон является членом группы "Чынара", в которой еще состоит 2 человека. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, он обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для покупки минеральных удобрений и клеенки для парника. Усон намерен получить хороший урожай, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала. Доходы от кредита Усон планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и хочет накопить средства на постройку дома.
texts.en:
Uson is 25 and unmarried with no children. He works in agriculture and animal husbandry with a monthly income of 10,000 KGS. He started growing vegetables in 2010 with 10,000 KGS, and now grows mostly melons, cotton and corn. He also has a horse and 20 sheep. Uson is a member of the Chynara group along with two other people.

With the goal of further developing his business, he has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to purchase fertilizers and oilcloth for his greenhouse. He intends to have a good harvest that will contribute toward a higher income. He plans to invest profits from the loan into increasing the size of his domestic herd and wants to save toward building a house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.ru: Махабат 34 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Все дети школьного и дошкольного возраста. У Махабат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Махабат занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 2003 году с закупки 1 теленка на сумму 7,000 сом (KGS), благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Махабат, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка и 2 лошади. Также имеется 2,50 ГА земельной доли, на которой она ежегодно выращивает картофель и фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Дополнительно Махабат реализует молоко. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Махабат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом для закупки коров, часть средств она потратит на покупку овец, а на остальные деньги приобретет минеральные удобрения для улучшения плодородности почвы. Махабат намерена увеличить поголовье скота и получить хороший урожай со своего участка, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Махабат планирует вложить в расширение сараев для содержания скота и покупку земельной доли.
texts.en:
Mahabat is 34 and married with four children, all of whom are of school age or younger. She has a high school education and works in agriculture and animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began in 2003 with the purchase of one calf for 7,000 KGS. Thanks to Mahabat's purposefulness and hard work, she now has two milking cows, two calves and two horses as well as a 2.5 hectare parcel of land on which she grows potatoes and beans, both for her own use and for sale. She also sells milk, and her total monthly income is about 10,000 KGS. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Mahabat has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to purchase cows, sheep and fertilizers to improve the quality of her soil. She intends to increase her head count of livestock and receive a good harvest from her land, which will translate into an improvement in her family's finances. Mahabat plans to put profits from the loan into expanding her cattle shed and purchasing land.

loans.use: to buy livestock and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk so that she can run her cookery business profitably.

loans.name: Khirda

texts.en: Khirda is 51 years old and single. She is a pensioner who lives with her parents and earns money by raising and selling fruits (apples, pears and quince) and vegetables (greens, cucumbers, potatoes) at a local bazaar. She has been working in this field for 31 years and her monthly income is 200 AZN. In her  area, demand has been high for fresh fruits and vegetables. People buy fruits to eat fresh or use to prepare juice or fruit jam. They use vegetables to cook delicious national dishes. Khirda’s income isn’t enough to cover her living costs and pay for her parents medicines. She has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan to grow other types of fruits and vegetables and diversify what she grows for sale. This is her third loan and she has a positive client history.

loans.use: to diversify by growing other sorts of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
A loan of 250,000 Albanian Lek will help Romeo buy a part for the tractor seen in the picture. His focus for the past 22 years has been in agriculture,  particularly planting and selling wheat and fodder in large quantities.  In addition to this, he has been serving the villagers around southern Albania with his tractor.
 
A bit about Romeo’s village: It is a field area with an extremely cold climate and snows a lot during winter times. The soil is very supportive of almost all types of plants due to its moisture. Villagers prefer to keep cows versus other animals. The village is known for the yummy gold apples and also another quality called locally ‘starkinga’. Villagers make a special meal for summer called ‘summer meal’ that is made particularly with red peppers, tomatoes, garlic and onions with or without meat.

loans.use: to buy a new part for his tractor

loans.name: Eva Silvia

texts.es: Eva tiene 59 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y se dedica a la crianza de pollos y a la prestación de servicios domésticos. Junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de su hogar y es así como han logrado salir adelante. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de su hogar dado que actualmente las paredes están hechas a base de bahareque y lámina y a la fecha se encuentran en mal estado por lo que desea invertir en la reparación de las mismas cambiando el material por láminas galvanizadas para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para hacer la respectiva compra del material y así poder proceder a la mejora antes de el que invierno aparezca.
texts.en: Eva is 59 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner. She works raising chickens and providing housekeeping services. She and her husband support their household and have managed to make a living. She wants to improve her housing conditions because the walls are wattle and daub covered with sheet metal and are currently in disrepair. That is why she wants to invest in repairing them by replacing the materials with galvanized sheet metal. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to purchase the necessary materials in order to make the repairs before winter.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal and wood to repair the walls of her house.

loans.name: Yllka

texts.en:
Yllka a 39-year-old married mother of two, 19 and 11 years old, who runs a little store in the city of Elbasan where she sells used clothes.The reason why she is requesting this loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek is to stock up on inventory items. Yllka pays rent for the store. Her husband is an elementary school teacher and their children are both going to school respectively.
 
A bit about the city: it is located in central Albania on the Shkumbin River with a population of approximately 80,000 and is one of the largest cities in the country. Its name derives from the Turkish language il-basan (‘the fortress). It has four museums and is the home to the summer day festivities, a feast celebrating the end of winter and the coming of summer. 'Ballokume' cookies made from butter and corn wheat is the traditional dish served on this day. This 'summer day' has become a national holiday.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Zulfiyya

texts.en: Zulfiyya is 47 years old, single, and a farmer who earns most of her income through animal husbandry. For the last 27 years, she has earned money by selling milk, dairy products and meat at a local bazaar. She is skilled at her work, and earns 300 AZN a month. Dairy products are in high demand in Azerbaijan. People buy milk every day, along with meat and dairy products from Zulfiyya because her products are always fresh and high in quality. Zulifiyya’s income doesn’t allow her to cover all of her expenses. She has applied for a loan for 500 AZN to increase her productivity by buying cattle and fodder.

loans.use: to increase her productivity by buying cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Joyeuse Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Muhombo est une commerçante d’une expérience de 16 ans, âgée de 43 ans, mariée, conseillère et membre d’un collectif d’Affaires «Joyeuse». Elle est vendeuse de friperie(divers habits). Elle installe ses marchandises dans un marché de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 2 ballons de friperie. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de son mari. Dans son travail, elle s’entraide avec son mari, comme lui aussi est commerçant. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de microcrédit, pendant, ce moment de post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The borrower, named Muhombo, has been working in retail for the past 16 years.  She is 43 years old and married.  She is also a member and the adviser of the "Joyeuse" business group.  She sells various used clothing and displays her merchandise at one of the markets, in town.  She is requesting a loan from Hekima in order to increase her business.  She is going to buy two bales of used clothes.

Muhombo started her business with some money received from her husband.  She and her husband work closely together as he is also involved in retail.  In the future, she would like to take more loans, educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for providing microloans and supporting entrepreneurs with no access to the traditional banking system, particularly during this post-conflict period in Eastern Congo.

loans.use: to buy two bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Motomoto Group

texts.en:
Josias is in his early fifties and makes his living by running a business selling fruits. He has been selling fruits for 10 years now. He is married and the father of six children, who are in school. 

Josias works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. per working day and is able to make a small profit. Josias is requesting his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to buy fruits. 

Josias used his two previous loans to improve his business by stocking more fruits. He has successfully paid his previous loans. With his increased income, Josias covered school fees and home food expenses. 

He is thankful for Tujijenge, with its quick and affordable loans. He dreams of managing a big shop and owning a house. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, Motomoto, which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits

loans.name: Bénédiction Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ntakwinja est une commerçante et membre d’une plate forme d’affaires «Bénédiction», âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère des 8 enfants dont 6 étudient et 2 autres sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse de friperie (Sacs à mains dames) depuis 5 ans. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un marché animé de la place. Elle  sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle démarra ses activités par de fonds reçu de Hekima. Son conjoint, lui aussi est commerçant. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de sacs à mains. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser, vêtir  et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes  entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
The borrower, Ntakwinia, works in retail and is the member of a business group named "Bénédiction".  She is 41 years old, married, and the mother of eight children, six of whom are in school (the other two are still very young).  Ntakwinia has been selling used items, particularly women's handbags, for the past five years.  She displays her merchandise at a lively local market.  She is requesting a loan from Hekima in order to expand her business and she will buy one bale of handbags.  

Ntakwinia started her business with some money received from Hekima. Her husband also works in retail.  In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land, educate, clothe and feed her children.  She thanks Hekima for its support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy one bale of handbags.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is widowed with six children, none of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 

She has a business of poultry farming and has been in this business for 25 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy chicks and poultry feed. She generates additional income from frying eatables like samosas and pan cakes. She works at home and sells wholesale only and works seven days out of every week. 

Her major business challenges include transportation of chicken feeds and chicks and seasonality. She aspires to buy a piece of land so as to build poultry houses and also to build rental houses. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because one doesn't have to give collateral before one gets a loan. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food supplies in bulk to sell profitably from her table.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo se dedica a la venta de auto partes de carros y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar, frenos, timones, llantas, pistones y otros, él agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio pues valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. Él pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Alfredo works selling auto parts and, on this occasion, he needs a loan to buy brakes, steering wheels, tires, pistons, and other things. He is grateful to the people who are part of this dream in this way. He values the loan and promises to make the monthly repayments with great responsibility. He belongs to the community bank "San Martincito", part of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy brakes, steering wheels, tires, and other things.

loans.name: Alvayeriz

texts.es:
La variedad de ropa, el orden y la amabilidad que transmite Alvayeriz en su tienda de ropa usada, es lo que motiva a la clientela a ingresar. Ella es originaria de la ciudad de Camoapa, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres niños. Es una mujer emprendedora, una mujer de negocios; al mismo tiempo una madre responsable. Su prioridad es brindarle una educación de calidad y un futuro prospero a sus hijos. 
Alvayeriz solicita el crédito para aumentar el capital de su producción, requiere comprar variedad de ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres; todo con el objetivo de aumentar su clientela y obtener mejores ganancias. La tienda es su principal soporte económico, por lo tanto ella deposita su fe y confianza en el financiamiento de Kiva y MiCrédito, pues asegura que sólo junto a ellos logrará cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
The variety of clothes, the order, and the kindness that Alvayeriz projects in her used clothing store are what motivate customers to enter. She is a native of the city of Camoapa, is 30 years old, and is married with three children. She is an enterprising woman, a business woman; at the same time she is a responsible mother. Her priority is to offer her children a quality education and prosperous future. 
Alvayeriz is requesting a loan to increase her business capital. She needs to buy a selection of clothing for children, women, and men; all with the goal of growing her clientele and making better profits. The store is her main economic support, and so she puts her faith and confidence in the Kiva loan and MiCrédito as she is sure that she can only reach her goals with their support.

loans.use: to buy a selection of clothes for children, women, and men.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bracelets, rings, earrings, necklaces, lotions, creams, etc.

loans.name: Joyeuse Bus Group

texts.fr: La cliente Esther est une commerçante et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Joyeuse Bus», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants qui tous, étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des pagnes. Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché animé de la ville. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 26 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 12 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire la clôture de sa parcelle, scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The borrower, Esther, works in retail and is the member of a business group named "Joyeuse Bus".  She is 43 years old and a dynamic entrepreneur.  She is also married and the mother of three children who all go to school.  Esther sells "pagnes" (colorful African fabrics), displaying her merchandise at the local busy market, in town.

Esther has already received loans from Hekima.  She has been running her business for the past 26 years.  Her husband is currently unemployed.  With this new loan, she will buy 12 sets of pagnes.  

Esther would like educate and feed her children, as well as install a fence around her plot of land.  In the end, she is very thankful to Hekima for empowering women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, particular during this post-conflict period in Eastern Congo.

loans.use: to buy 12 sets of "pagnes" (colorful African fabrics).

loans.name: Jérémie Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kafibango est une commerçante depuis 20 ans, conseillère et membre du d’affaires «Jérémie» Senior entrepreneur, âgée de 54 ans, veuve et mère de 10 enfants, dont 7 étudient et 3 autres sont déjà maries. Elle est vendeuse souliers usagés. Elle installe son business dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 200 paires de souliers. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et la construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflit dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
The borrower, Kafibango, has been working in retail for the past 20 years.  She is a member and the adviser of the "Jérémie" business group.  She is 54 years old and an experienced entrepreneur.  She is also a widow and the mother of ten children, seven of whom are in school (the other three are already married).

Kafibango sells used shoes and she displays her merchandise at the central market, in town.  She is requesting a loan from Hekima in order to expand her business.  She is going to buy 200 pairs of shoes.  She started her business with some money received from her husband when he was still alive.

In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land and build on it.  She also wants to educate and feed her children.  She thanks Hekima for its support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system and for granting them loans without any collateral guarantee, particularly during this post-conflict period in Eastern Congo.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to deliver his product to his clients.

loans.name: Arlan

texts.en:
Arlan runs a small stall where he sells snacks, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Jakarta, an urban area. Arlan is married and lives with three people in the family house.

Arlan began working with Ruma four months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food and regional fruits.

loans.name: Elwin Alexander

texts.es:
Elwin, requiere un nuevo crédito para comprar dos estantes metálicos, en los que organizará mejor las frutas y verduras.
El crédito anterior le dio los recursos económicos para surtir de productos frescos su negocio obteniendo así más clientes satisfechos y mejore ingresos para ofrecer a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en: Elwin is requesting a new loan to buy two metal shelves, on which he will be bale to better organize his fruits and vegetables. His previous loan gave him the economic resources to stock his business with fresh produce, earning him more satisfied customers and better income to offer his family better food, clothing, and health.

loans.use: to buy two metal shelves.

loans.name: Bénédiction Bnd Group

texts.fr: La cliente Maruteke est une commerçante et membre d’une banque communautaire «Bénédiction Bnd», âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère des 6 enfants, dont 4 étudient et 2 autres sont gosses. Elle est vendeuse de souliers usagés  depuis 4 ans. Elle installe ses marchandises sur la rue dans une avenue animée de la place. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle démarra ses activités par de fonds reçu de l’IMF Kekima. Son conjoint est un technicien automobiliste. Elle va acheter 40 paires de souliers. Dans l’avenir,  elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique,en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
The borrower, Muruteke, is a retailer and a member of the "Bénédiction Bnd" communal bank.  She is 34 years old, married, and the mother of six children, four of whom are in school (the other two are still very young).  She has been selling used shoes for four years.  She displays her merchandise on the side of a busy local street.

Muruteke is requesting a loan from Hekima in order to expand her activity.  She started in this business with some money received from the microfinance institution Hekima.  Muruteke's husband is a car mechanic.

Muruteke is going to buy 40 pairs of shoes.  In the future, she would like to expand her business as well as educate, feed and buy clothes for her children.  She thanks Hekima for its support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system and for granting them loans without any collateral guarantee.

loans.use: to buy 40 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 61 years old from Nyandarua and is married. They have two children who are aged 15 years and 13 years old.

Mary is a farmer and has been in it for many years. She has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her buy seedlings and fertilizer to use in her farm. She will use the profits made to expand her business.

She hopes to cater for her family well in the near future and expand it.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Silvard

texts.en:
Silvard lives together with her son, daughter-in-law and little grandchildren (6 and 4 years old).
Silvard runs a farm. She keeps one pig and is mainly involved in land cultivation. Specifically, Silvard cultivates potato, cabbage, tomato and different greens. Silvard loves agribusiness. She asks this loan of USD 1500 to be able to increase land cultivation. With the loan's help Silvard plans to purchase fertilizer and more seeds for cultivation. As this is Silvard's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation

loans.name: Titiek

texts.en:
Titiek runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Titiek lives in Jakarta, an urban area. Titiek is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Titiek began working with Ruma six months ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: to purchase a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Jalaludin

texts.en:
Jalaludin runs a small stall selling snacks, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Jalaludin lives in Jakarta, an urban area.  Jalaludin is married and lives with six people in the family house.

Jalaludin began working with Ruma 1 year and 10 months ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti runs a small stall selling snacks, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Siti lives in Jakarta, an urban area. Siti is married and living with five people in the family home. 

Siti began working with Ruma one year ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Zuhraini

texts.en:
Zuhraini runs a small stall selling snacks, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Zuhraini lives in Jakarta, an urban area. Zuhraini is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Zuhraini began working with Ruma three years ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Adan Ernesto

texts.es: Adán tiene 49 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 18 años y  14 años de edad. Adan es un hombre emprendedor quien todos los días recorre las principales zonas de su localidad para ofrecer sus servicios de mecánico automotriz. De esta forma es como mantiene la economía de su hogar y da a sus hijos de lo necesario. Su deseo es poder contar con el servicio de energía eléctrica en su hermosa vivienda a base de madera que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer y además desea cambiar algunas tablas de madera de su vivienda que se encuentran deterioradas. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de madera y para la respectiva instalación del servicio de la energía eléctrica y así dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones para su desarrollo.
texts.en: Adán is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his two children, ages 18 and 14. He is an entrepreneurial man who travels the main ares of his community every day to offer his auto mechanic services. This is how he manages his household expenses and gives his children what they need. His wish is to have electricity in his beautiful wooden home which, with a lot of effort, he has been able to establish. He also wants to replace some of the wood panels of his home that are deteriorating. That is why he requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying wood, and to pay for installation of electricity, so he can give his children better living conditions as they grow up.

loans.use: to buy wood, and to pay for installation of electricity in his home.

loans.name: Nhóm 08 Thôn Trung Phú Group

texts.en:
Bình is 55 years old and married with two children. For the past 10 years, she has worked in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. In 2013, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and has successfully repaid three previous loans. Her most critical business difficulty is her lack of capital.

Bình is the group leader of the 08 Thôn Trung Phú Solidarity Group, which consists of five members. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. With the profit from her loan, Bình hopes that her business will do well, her family will be healthy and happy, and she will be able to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is a hardworking woman from Goris town. She lives together with her husband and two sons (ages 21 and 16 years old). Anahit is engaged in pig breeding. She currently keeps one mother pig and 16 piglets. Near the house here, Anahit and her family live. They also own a plot of arable land where wheat and some grass is cultivated. Although in Anahit’s family she is not the only person employed, agribusiness is the main income that sustains the family.

Now, Anahit asks for this loan of USD 3,000 to purchase 10 piglets and forage for the livestock. She has taken a loan from the local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back on time. 

Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Anahit has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for 10 piglets and forage for the livestock.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
Maria tiene 66 años de edad, desde hace ya 15 años se ha desempeñado como floricultora, para obtener así los recursos necesarios y sostener a su familia. Junto con su esposo y sus 8 hijos ejercen esta actividad con la cual se ganan la vida y le generan empleo a algunos miembros de su familia ella trabaja arduamente para mantener el negocio a flote, luchando con la dura competencia que existe en estos momentos en la vereda la palma.
Uno de los desafíos mas grandes con los que debe lidiar esta emprendedora mujer es la exposición de sus cultivos a los rayos del sol directo, esto hace que sus flores se marchiten muy rápido y no pueda venderlas.
Ella necesita un plástico y una lona especiales para este tipo de cultivos, pero el problema es que estos son muy costosos y Maria no tiene como comprarlos. 
Con estos elementos ella podrá preservar por más tiempo la vida de sus flores y podrá seguir adornando este mundo con hermosos colores.
texts.en:
Maria is 66 years old, and for 15 years she has worked growing flowers to obtain the resources she needs to support her family.  She does this work with her husband and their 8 children, and this is how they earn a living and generate employment for some members of the family.  Maria works very hard to keep the business afloat, struggling with the tough competition that exists at this time in the rural district of La Palma.

One of the greatest challenges that this enterprising woman must contend with is the exposure of her flowers to the direct rays of the sun.  This makes her flowers wilt very quickly, and then she can't sell them.

Maria needs plastic and special canvas tarps for these types of crops, but the problem is that these are very costly and Maria doesn't have the funds needed to buy them.  With these items, she will be able to preserve the life of her flowers and will be able to continue to grace this world with beautiful colors.

loans.use: to buy plastic and special tarps to protect her crops from the sun

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Mulyadi

texts.en:
Mulyadi runs a small stall selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Mulyadi lives in Jakarta, an urban area.  Mulyadi is married and lives with three people in the family house.

Mulyadi began working with Ruma 1 year and 4 months ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Friends Group

texts.en:
Iman is the featured borrower of the Friends group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Iman is a 55-year-old married mother of four children who has been working from her house for five years, selling women accessories and shawls.
She is a hardworking woman who puts so much effort on developing her family's living, and supporting her husband in covering their beloved children's increasing expenses.

Iman is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with newly released spring/summer collection in order to attract more customers and fulfill current customers' needs and requests.

She hopes that in the future she'll be capable of opening her wider shop that will attract more customers.

Iman is the lady at the center of the picture. As for the other group members, Sarah is the first from the left and Najat is the lady at the far right side of the picture.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with newly released spring/summer collection.

loans.name: Orfa Elena De Las Misericordias

texts.es: Orfa es una madre que le toco criar sola a su hijo, ya que su marido desde hace muchos años radica en España. Orfa por necesidad tuvo que buscar la manera de generar un ingreso para ayudar con los gastos familiares, inicialmente comenzó con una heladería pero poco después deserto de este negocio por resolver dificultades de salud, pero su visión de emprendedora no la dejo decaer ante este problema e invirtió las ganancias obtenidas con algo de ayuda de un capital que le mando su marido desde España en una nueva aventura la cual es la venta de mercancía más específicamente la venta de calzado y algo de vestuario, y poco a poco fue creciendo como microempresa, pues sus pocos clientes le eran fieles por su carisma cariño respeto y humildad que tenía al atender un cliente pues reflejaba una gran preocupación por que su cliente se sintiera bien atendido y conforme con su producto, y es esta preocupación la que la llevo a solicitar un crédito para diversificar sus productos ya que tenía un gran corazón y quería darle gusto a su clientes que le solicitaban una línea de ropa entre su cartera de venta, esta bella labor que desempeña le permite atender y ejercer su rol de madre, y de vendedora, son estas personas que valen la pena ayudar, personas que tiene como prioridad atender bien a su cliente antes de venderle el producto, para Orfa será una gran oportunidad de introducir su pensamiento de servicio al cliente ante los demás vendedores para tener una mejor calidad de servicio y una sana competencia por una correcta prestación de servicio.
texts.en:
Orfa is a single mom who raised her son by herself, since her husband has lived in Spain for many years. Orfa needed to find a way to generate an income to help with the household expenses. 

Initially, she started with an ice cream shop but a little bit later she gave up that business to resolve some health issues. Despite this problem, her vision of being an entrepreneur did not go off course. She invested the profit she got with a bit of help from money that her husband in Spain sent to her for a new venture, which is the sale of merchandise, more specifically the sale of shoes and some clothing. Little by little it grew into a small business, and her few clients were loyal because of her charm, affection, respect and humility that she had when looking after them. She reflected a great amount of concern so that her clients felt well attended to and happy with the product. It is this concern that had her request a loan to diversify her products, since she had a big heart and she wanted to satisfy the customers that asked her for a line of clothing in her sales portfolio. 

This beautiful work that she does allows her to tend to and carry out her role as a mother and a merchant. These are the people that are worth helping; people that have a priority to help their clients before selling them the product. For Orfa it will be a great opportunity to introduce her thoughts on customer service compared to other merchants in order to offer a better quality of service and a healthy competition to provide services.

loans.use: to buy a better variety to sell as a line of clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer was born in year 1963. He is married with three children; one of them is studying at first course of medical college, another is going to eleventh class and preparing for the university, and the little child is 14 years old who is also going to school. Azer’s wife is a literature teacher at the same school. 

The family is living in Baku region, but they are from the the city of Fuzuli. So over 20 years, they have been an IDP-Internally Displaced Persons. Azer has been in a taxi driver business for 15 years. 

Today, Azer wants to repair the car’s motor, and for this reason, Azer has applied to Komak company. He needs 700 Azerbaijan New Manat (AZN). For help, he says thanks to all lenders of Kiva organization.

loans.use: to repair the car’s motor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plantains and fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Malik

texts.en: Malik is a 38-year-old man, married and has a child. His wife is pregnant and in the near future Malik’s child will be born. Malik is living in the Abseron region with his wife, but they are both Internally Displaced Persons from Agdam city. Malik has a store, where he sells building materials. Today he wants to increase his business and, for this reason, he needs a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this amount, he wants to buy more products for selling. Malik gives great thanks to Kiva organization and lenders for help.

loans.use: to buy more products for selling.

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en: Teyyub is a married man. He has a child who is studying in the first course of technical school. The family members are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Lachin city, now they live in Abseron region. Teyyub has a “Kababkhana”. In here he made different types of national food; “Kebab”, “lulekebab”, “tike kebab”, “toyuq kebabi”, etc. Different types of kebab are made of lamb meat, beef, and chicken meat cooked in a brazier. Teyyub buys all of these products from villagers and, of course, these products are totally natural products. Today, Teyyub wants to repair his brazier, for this reason he needs a loan in amount of 1550 Azerbaijan New Manat. He is thankful for the support for the development of business and to the Kiva organization.

loans.use: to pay for repairs on a brazier.

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en:
Varditer is young farmer from Khot village. She lives there with her parents and 15-year-old sister. Her father used to be an army officer, but currently is retired. 

Varditer, together with her mother and sister, runs a farm. They keep six cows and seven calves and get dairy products, which they sell in the local market. 

Varditer applied for this loan of USD 1,200 to be able to purchase four more cows and enlarge their agribusiness. 

As this is Varditer's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for four calves

loans.name: Tươi

texts.en:
Mrs. Tươi works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Tươi is 54 years old and married with three children. Tươi lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tươi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Tươi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Tươi faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

In the future, Tươi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus
