texts.es: María tiene 35 años de edad, es madre oltera y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas de 3 años y 16 años de edad y su hijo de 14 años de edad. María trabaja como operaría de costura en una fabrica cercana a su localidad y es así como logra sacar adelante a sus hijos. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación de la energía eléctrica y para comprar tres ventanas para su vivienda. Espera poder contar con este apoyo dado que no posee el capital para hacerlo por su cuenta.
texts.en: María is 35 years old. She is a single mother who lives in her own home with her two daughters, 3 and 16 years old and her 14 year old son. María works as a sewing machine operator in a factory close to where she lives and this is how she supports her children. With the goal of improving their living conditions María is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the installation of electricity and to buy three windows for her house. She hopes to count on this support as she does not have the capital to undertake this by herself.

loans.use: to install electricity and buy 3 windows for her house.

loans.name: Đường

texts.en:
Đường works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Đường is 33-years-old and she is married with two children.
Đường lives with two dependents in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Đường first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.
Đường has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profits, Đường hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle.

Thu is 52-years-old and she is married with three children.
Thu lives with one dependent in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thu's first loan with The Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.
Thu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profits, Thu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called "Emmanuel", who reside in the same neighborhood. They are into the sale of silver products, jeans, eggs, firewood, fruits, cooking oil and canned fish.

The group's representative, Mabel, is 43 years old and has had little schooling. She is married to a mason named Etse. She lives together with her husband and children. The couple have four children, all in school and in their care. 

The couple jointly ensures that the diverse family expenses are covered. To do so, Mabel has been selling fruits by hawking, or through the distribution system. She gets her supplies from a market in Ghana. 

This is the second time that Mabel and the members of her group have requested financial support from ID-Ghana, with the goal of bolstering their businesses and better coping with customer demands. 

The previous loan was indeed repaid without trouble.

They will need a total amount of GHS 5,200 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes, oranges, pawpaw and pineapple to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Zulfiyya

texts.en:
Zulfiyya is a 33-year-old single woman. She is a refugee and lives with her parents in an IDP settlement. The only source of the family’s income is Zulfiya’s small product market, which sells bread, butter, eggs, sweets, cookies, oil, etc. She has been working in this field for eight years, and her monthly income is 200 AZN.

Daily products are in high demand. People buy them every day; they prefer to buy from Zulfiyya’s market because products are cheap and are of quality. People living in IDP settlements are poor, and that’s why cheap prices are very important for them.

Zulfiyya wants to expand her business and provide a wider assortment. She plans to rebuild the small shop into a big market, and help poor people to find all the products they need. 

She applied for 1,200 AZN in order to buy other kinds of products and goods.

loans.use: to buy other kinds of products and goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 46 years old. She lives in the small village of Adigeni district. 

Nona is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a plot of land where she grows maize, potatoes and haricot. Nona is very hardworking woman, and does her best to ensure a good harvest. She sells the harvested products locally. 

Nona decided to purchase a cow. 

The startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,000 gel for purchasing a cow. 

After the cow is purchased, she will start producing cheese to sell at local markets. This will increase her income. Nona awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Muafaka-Group

texts.en:
Degrasian, who is in her early fifties, is a divorcee and has two school-age children. For 19 years now, she has had a cereals business where she sells beans, rice and corn. She has a store where she keeps her cereals to sell. Degrasian does business from 07 am to 06 pm each working day, and is able to make a small extra income. 

This will be her ninth loan request from Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. Degrasian used the previous loans (all of which were paid back successfully) to restock cereals to meet demand. She used the increased income to cover school fees and home food expenses. Despite making a small return, she keeps on ploughing back part of the return to her business so it can grow. Since she is a divorcee, the cereals business is the only place Degrasian has to make a living (paying school fees, rent, family food and medical expenses). 

Degrasian never loses hope; she believe that one day she will be able to build a nice family house. 

With this new loan request, she will buy sacks of rice to sell.

She will share this loan with her loan group, " MUAFAKA-GROUP", which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, rice, flour, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en: Hafiz is 39 years old, married and has two children. They are an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) family from Agdam city, but now live in the Abseron region. His daughter is 15 years old and is going to the tenth grade at the secondary school. His son is 13 years old and also goes to school. Hafiz’s wife is a housewife and Hafiz is a master mason, who builds wall facing of stone. Hafiz learned this profession from his father and loves his job. As shown in the picture his supply of building materials is reduced so he has applied to the Komak company to purchase more building materials. Hafiz needs a loan in the amount of 1300 Azerbaijan New Manat. He is thankful to the Kiva organization and Kiva lenders for help. In the future Hafiz wants to hire an assistant.

loans.use: to buy more building materials

loans.name: Vecinos Unidos Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Vecinos unidos está conformado por diez personas dos hombre y ocho mujeres, padres y madres de familia responsables de veinte hijos. Son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región.  Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, la coordinadora es Magdalena y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, fósforos, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio  unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Vecinos unidos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Vecinos Unidos” (United Neighbors) consists of 10 members, two men and eight women. They are responsible parents who care for 20 children among them. The members are originally from Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the northern part of the region. They are known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were not able to pursue a degree and were obligated to work at an early age.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to move forward, Magadalena was appointed the group coordinator. Her business is a small store where she sells products in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, matches, juices, and sodas. Magdalena devotes approximately 12 hours each day to her business by offering her products. The purpose of her loan is to invest it as operating capital so that she can restock her business of buying and selling basic products. In the near future, she would like to generate more income.

The Communal Bank “Vecinos Unidos” is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy various products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es: Santusa nació en la comunidad de Huarancca el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo al sur de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 44 años de edad  y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras productos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo  y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Santusa was born in the community of Huarancca in the district of Colquepata and province of Paucartambo to the south of the city of Cusco. She is 44 years old and is a responsible person who makes a living in agriculture and raising cattle. She has various lands for cultivation where she plants potatoes, barley, wheat, lima beans and other products. At this time she requires the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She thanks the investors for the loan and commits to making her monthly payments with a lot of responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria nació en la comunidad de Huarancca el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo al sur de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 53 años de edad  y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras productos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abonos, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo  y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Victoria was born in the community of Huarancca, which is in the District of Colquepata in Paucartambo Province. This area is located south of the city of Cusco. She is 53 years old and a responsible person who earns her living by farming and raising livestock. Victoria has several plots of land where she grows potatoes, barley, wheat, beans, and other crops.

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy seeds and compost. Victoria is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan, so she promises to handle her payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost.

loans.name: Fredis Mauricio

texts.es:
San juan de oriente, es el Disney world de las artesanías en Nicaragua. Jarrones azules, dorados y rojos con el paisaje de las casas coloniales que abundan en la ciudad, son elaborados artesanalmente. Además, son uno de los principales ingresos económicos de Fredis, quien se ha mantenido desde hace 15 años, luchando con la competencia creativa y colorida del municipio emprendedor.  
Fredis, junto a su esposa, quien posee un amplio conocimiento sobre la artesanía debido a que viene de una familia artesana, comenzaron a elaborar y comercializar un producto original. Ahora, con la ayuda de una de sus hijas y ellos dos en el negocio, más los ingresos extras de la venta de leña y el préstamo MiCrédito-KIVA, con enfoque a saneamiento, podrán disfrutar de una vida más saludable e higiénica, ya que planean construir su servicio sanitario dentro de la casa. Lo positivo es que ahora podrá prevenir accidentes como la picadura de una culebra, ya que el pon-pon está ubicado a 6m de la casa y no tiene luz, lo que lo hace aún más peligrosos en un lugar rural y de noche.
Los sueños de Fredis no terminan ahorita, al contrario está comenzando, pues su meta es seguir creciendo en la producción del negocio, para mantener su clientela y así cumplir con sus planes a futuro como lo es conseguir un financiamiento para la remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
San Juan de Oriente is the Disney World of artisan-made crafts in Nicaragua. Blue, gold, and red vases featuring the landscape of colonial houses that abound in the city are made by hand. It is also one of the primary sources of income for Fredis, who has provided for himself since the age of 15, contending with the creative and colorful competition of the entrepreneurial community. 

Fredis, together with his wife, who offers a vast knowledge of craftsmanship since she comes from a family of artisans, began to make and sell original pieces. Now they can enjoy a healthier more hygienic life by building a restroom inside their home, with the two of them and the help of one of their daughters, plus the income from selling firewood and the loan from MiCrédito-KIVA.  
.
The good thing is that now he can prevent accidents like snakebites, since the current facility is located 6 meters from the house and does not have any lights, which makes it even more dangerous in a rural area at night. 


Fredis' dreams don't stop there. On the contrary, they are just starting. His goal is to continue growing his business to maintain his clientele, and to accomplish his future plans of obtaining financing for remodeling his home.

loans.use: to build a bathroom inside his home.

loans.name: Ana Marleni

texts.es: Ana de 35 años de edad, es bachiller al igual que su pareja, esta trabaja también, tienen dos hijos uno esta en la escuela y el otro es menor de dos años, los dos dependen de ella. No tienen negocio ya que ambos, la cliente y su pareja trabajan como empleados. El préstamo lo utilizara para terminar la construcción de su vivienda y califica de importantes estos créditos en la comunidad. Planea en un fututo seguir trabajando en su hogar y así poder tener mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Ana is 35 years old. She is a high school graduate, as is her spouse. He also works. They have two children. One is in school and the other is under two years old. Both of them depend on her. They don't have a business because both she and her spouse have jobs. She will use the loan to finish construction on her house and they qualify for the loans, which are important in their community. In the future, she plans to continue working on her home so she can have bette living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to finish construction on her house.

loans.name: Lesbia Patricia

texts.es: Lesbia de 31 años, casada su esposo es chofer de bus colectivo propio, con dos hijos los cuales ya estudian básicos.  Doña Lesbia se dedica a la venta de medicina natural para pérdida de peso, para la gripe, vitamina C,  desde hace 3 años y medio también vende cosméticos como cremas para el cuerpo, shampoo, cosméticos. También vende  comida junto con su mama en el mercado tres veces a  la semana, paches los jueves, a logrado hacer varias cosas para su negocio como para su hogar y ayudar a su familia, está feliz y satisfecha por los resultados y la ayuda que le brinda a su esposo.
texts.en:
Lesbia is 31 years old and married. Her husband is a bus driver and has his own vehicle. They have two children who are obtaining a basic education.

Doña Lesbia sells natural medicines for weight loss, flu remedies, and vitamin C. She has been in this business for 3½ years. In addition, she sells cosmetics such as body crèmes, shampoo, and makeup. Lesbia also sells food with her mother at the market three times a week, starting on Thursday. She has been able to accomplish many things through her business, such as providing for her household and helping her family. Lesbia is pleased and satisfied with the results and the assistance she has been able to give to her husband.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “El Paraíso” La cual  está constituida por 06 socios responsables y entusiastas. Gladys de 50 años de edad es casada. Ella se dedica  a la venta de disfraces hace mas de 8 años donde todo le va bien. Su mayor anhelo es implementar su local para poder exhibir sus productos.  Solicitó el crédito para la compra telas, botones y cierres. El grupo “El Paraíso” agradece a todas las personas que facilitaron este crédito. Gladys es la tercera del lado derecho y viste 	blusa blanco.
texts.en: This is the new group "El Paraíso” which is made up of 6 responsible, enthusiastic members. Gladys is 50 years old and married. She works selling costumes for more than 8 years now, and it is going well. Her biggest wish is to establish her presence in the community to display her products. She requests this loan to buy fabrics, buttons, and zippers. The group "El Paraíso” appreciates all the people who facilitated this loan. Gladys is the third from the right side, dressed in the white blouse.

loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons, and zippers.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es: Anabel nació en la comunidad de Huarancca el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo al sur de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 26 años de edad  y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras productos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo  y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Anabel was born in the community of Huarancca in the district of Colquepata in the province of Paucartambo, south of the city of Cuzco. She is 26 and she is a responsible person who works in farming and livestock. She has different plots of land where she grows potatoes, barley, wheat, beans and other products. At this time, she needs the loan to buy fertilizer. She is grateful to the investors for the loan and she is committed to making her payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a stock of beans

loans.name: Wilman Odil

texts.es: Wilman de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato,  es casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficos domesticos,tiene dos hijos que estudian, de él dependen toda su familia. Por el momento es empleado, pero además tiene mucha experiencia en lo que respecta al negocio de ganado, este es un oficio que se lo enseño su padre. El préstamo lo utilizara para mejorar la vivienda y así poder tener mejores condiciones de vida. El cliente piensa en poner algún día su propio negocio para  aspirar a vivir mejor junto a su familia y cada vez mejorar poco a poco su casa.
texts.en: Wilman, age 34, studied until high school and is married. His wife works as a housekeeper, and he has two children who are students. The whole family depends on him. Currently he is employed, but he also has a lot of experience in the business of raising livestock, which is a skill his father taught him. He will use this loan to improve his home and have better living conditions. Wilman is thinking of starting his own business one day, to aspire to live better with his family, and to continue improving his home little by little.

loans.use: to improve the home where he lives.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is from Nyandarua South. He is 26 years old and is married. He and his wife have one child who is two years old.

Reuben is a farmer and has been engaged in farming activities for the past six years. He has applied for his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him buy a cow. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to improve his business and livelihood in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Andi

texts.en:
Andi runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. Andi lives in Jakarta, an urban area.  Andi is married and lives with five people in the family house.

Andi began working with Ruma four years ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Peace & Unity Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of nine hardworking members who are successful in their businesses. They are into the sale of jeans wear, pepper, fish, groceries, sachets of water, foodstuff, rice, underwear and secondhand clothing.

Bernice, age 42, is the group's featured borrower. She is married and has two dependent children. She sells jeans and dresses. She has been doing this job for four years in a kiosk at her residence. She also buys and sells jeans wear and dresses for women, men, and children in the communities that are close to her house. Her husband helps in the sale of the products.

She is a member who engages in multiple functions in order to improve her life every day. This way she provides the best conditions that she can for her family. She has worked with this microfinance institution in four previous cycles. She affirms that she has seen improvements in her personal life and in her business., which is what motivates her to continue borrowing in order to continue progressing. 

The group will need a total amount of GHS 5,600 to be able to serve customers better.

loans.use: To buys and sell jeans and dresses for women, men, and children in the communities that are close to her house.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 42-year-old married lady. She is very talented and excels in work of stitching clothes. She has been doing it for many years. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. She has six children. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and laces to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and laces.

loans.name: Latifan

texts.en:
Latifan is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last six years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Latifan is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 47-year-old married woman and she is a mother of five children. She has run a hand embroidery business for the past nine years. Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Perveen’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household.

Perveen wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Tri

texts.en:
Tri runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Tri lives in Jakarta, an urban area. Tri is single and living with six people in the family home. As seen in the picture Tri is with her customer.

Tri began working with Ruma four years ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Nurul

texts.en:
Nurul runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. Nurul lives in Jakarta, an urban area.  Nurul is married and lives with two people in the family house.

Nurul began working with Ruma two years ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Ana Milagro

texts.es: Ana de 47 años de edad, curso hasta 9º grado y su compañero de vida esta cursando la licenciatura en trabajo social, dos de sus hijos son bachilleres y los otros cursan 9º y 7º grado. Ana es sastre, tiene experiencia en confecciones de ropa femenina. También trabaja en la venta de pupusas y tortillas. El préstamo lo utilizara para cancelar una deuda en otra institución y lo demás lo utilizara para su negocio. El cliente piensa trabajar de mejor manera en su negocio y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida con sus hijos y piensa que si lo lograra.
texts.en: Ana is 47 years old and studied until the 9th grade. Her life partner is studying for his bachelor's degree in social work. Two of their children are graduates and the others are in the 9th and 7th grades. Ana is a seamstress; she has experience making women's clothing. She also works selling pupusas and tortillas. She will use the loan to pay a debt at another institution and the rest she will use for her business. The customer intends to work as best she can in her business and she will thus be able to have a better quality of life with her children. She thinks that she will achieve this.

loans.use: to pay a debt at another institution and to invest in her business.

loans.name: Syawaludin

texts.en:
Syawaludin runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Syawaludin lives in Jakarta, an urban area.  Syawaludin is married and lives with four people in the family house.

Syawaludin began working with Ruma six months ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Yunita

texts.en:
Yunita runs a small stall selling snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. Yunita lives in Jakarta, an urban area. Yunita is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Yunita began working with Ruma four months ago because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Motip

texts.en:
Motip runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Motip lives in Jakarta, an urban area.  Motip is married and lives with three people in the family house.

Motip began working with Ruma six months ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Marsad

texts.en:
Marsad runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Marsad lives in Jakarta, an urban area.  Marsad is married and lives with four people in the family house.

Marsad began working with Ruma 10 months ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more milk to sell

loans.name: Mariyanah

texts.en:
Mariyanah runs a small stall selling drinks and mobile phone airtime credits. Mariyanah lives in Jakarta, an urban area. Mariyanah is married and living with three people in the family home. In the picture, Mariyanah is with her husband.

Mariyanah began working with Ruma three years ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom, a 49-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Kalsoom has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Kalsoom's seventh loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: Las habilidades romanas para la ingeniería combinadas con una obsesión por la limpieza dieron origen a importantes sistemas públicos de agua y aguas residuales. Los romanos no comprendían por qué eran importantes las condiciones de salubridad, pero advertían que de esa forma se hacía frente a las enfermedades. Doña Valentina no será una excepción del pensamiento romano, ella es una Señora de 60 años, madre de 3 hijos ya independientes, presenta como oficio ser bibliotecaria. Ella tiene como meta próxima la compra de láminas de zinc para la remodelación del techo de su hogar. Solicita un crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda a través de la construcción de un servicio sanitario que presente excelentes condiciones  higiénicas. Estimando que el crédito a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá asistir a su baño con más seguridad si temor a sufrir picaduras de animales peligrosos. Revelando como planes a futuro seguir invirtiendo en su humilde vivienda para lograr obtener una vivienda que le brinde excelentes condiciones de seguridad.
texts.en:
The Roman abilities for engineering combined with an obsession with cleanliness gave origin to important public water and sewage systems. The Romans didn't understand why healthy conditions were important, but they cautioned that diseases should be addressed in this manner. 

Valentina will not be an exception to Roman thought. She is a 60-year-old woman and the mother of three children who are already independent, and she works as a librarian. She has the immediate goal of buying sheets of zinc to renovate the roof of her home. She is asking for a loan to improve the condition of her home by the construction of a bathroom with excellent hygienic conditions. She estimates that the loan requested will be a lot of help to her as she will be able to use her bathroom with more security, without fear of getting stung by dangerous animals. 

Revealing her plans for the future, she wants to keep investing in her small home to be able to have a home that provides her with excellent safety conditions.

loans.use: to improve the condition of her home by the construction of a bathroom.

loans.name: Señor Del Calvario De Huariquiña Group

texts.es: “SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO DE HUARIQUIÑA” es uno de los nuevos grupos conformada por 07 socios quienes se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio minorista. Jannina tiene 34 años es conviviente con 02 hijos educando. Ella implemento so bodega hace varios años en su vivienda.  Años atrás se dedicaba a su hogar. El crédito lo invertira en ampliar su negocio con la venta de cerveza y gaseosas. Una  de las metas de Jannina es vender comida para obtener in ingreso extra. Ella en el grupo cumple la función de tesorera. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Jannina es la se encuentra sentada en medio viste casaquilla negra.
texts.en:
"SEÑOR DEL CALVARIO DE HUARIQUIÑA" is one of the new groups formed by seven members who make a living in agriculture and retail commerce. Jannina is 34 years old and in a relationship, and she has two children who are studying. She started her small grocery store many years ago in her home. Before that she was dedicated to domestic duties. 

She will invest the loan in expanding her business with the sale of beer and soft drinks. One of Jannina's goals is to sell food to earn extra income. In her group, she holds the position of treasurer. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan provided. Jannina is the woman seated in the middle; she is wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 49-year-old widowed woman, who has been running her convenience store for sixteen years to make a living and cover her expenses, ever since her beloved husband passed away.

Hala is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with spring/summer special offer products necessary for her business development.

This is Halas fourth cycle as a Al Majmoua borrower and she maintains good standing with regard to payback history.  Her previous loans were invested for the same reason, and came back with a positive impressive impact on her socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with spring/summer special offer products.

loans.name: Mlimani Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children, two of whom go to school and one of whom is grown-up. She has been running a grocery business for ten years now. She works from 8pm to midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Rehema's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock items in her store and buy chicken broilers to sell. She has paid back all her loans successfully and was happy with them. She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses. She will use this new loan to buy beers, whiskeys, wines, sodas, juices and water for her store. She hopes to sell her drinks at wholesale prices.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group "Mlimani", which has thirteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her store.

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa is a 23-year-old married Iraqi citizen. She has been working since September 2013 as a salesperson in a clothes selling shop to support her family, in which she is the sole breadwinner to three members of it.

She used to work as an accountant for seven years, but she moved to this job for personal reasons. She believes it is better for her to develop in this domain since she didn't like the accounting domain.

Since her income isn't enough to cover additional unexpected payments, Marwa is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for an important surgery she has to undergo to stay in good health and keep on supporting her beloved family members.

Through her future expected loans, she hopes to start her own clothes selling business through opening her own shop after she gets well.

loans.use: To pay for an important surgery she has to undergo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, hair cream, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Hidjran

texts.en:
Hidjran and his wife have been married and have three children. One of them is a 7-year-old son; he goes to first class. Another child is a 4-year-old daughter, and a little son is 3 years old. Hidjran’s wife is a housewife; she can’t work on an incoming business because she takes care of her children. 

The family is living in Abseron region, but over 20 years their motherland Fuzuli city was occupied, and since then they are IDP, or Internally Displaced Persons. Hidjran is a master; he has been in this business for eight years. Today he wants to increase his business. Hidjran has applied for a loan in the amount of 1300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) for buying a new apparatus and materials that are useful in his work, like wood and pegs. 

He is thankful to the Kiva organization and all lenders for the help. In the future he wants to give a good education to his children. For his business, Hidjran wants to hire an asistant.

loans.use: to buy a new apparatus and materials

loans.name: Dúo Luchadores De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Luchadoras de San Pedro En este grupo la encargada es la señora María Elena quien se dedica a la venta de frutas desde hace 5 años, situada en el mercado de su pueblo.  El verano ha llegado y la venta de fruta crece cada día, debe de comprar más seguido para que le alcance y no le quede mal a sus clientes.  Necesita nuevamente pedir un préstamo para poder comprar más fruta y aprovechar los días de verano y obtener muy buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
“Luchadoras de San Pedro” Group

This group is headed by Sra. Maria Elena. She has been selling fruit for five years at a stand at the market in her town. With summer approaching, the sale of fruit increases each day. She needs to buy more frequently so that she can keep up with demand and not disappoint her customers.

Maria Elena needs to request another loan so that she can buy more fruit. By taking advantage of the summer season, she will be able to generate good earnings.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en: Asma is a 59-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 44-year-old married mother of two children who has been running her convenience store since 1995 to provide her beloved family with the necessary standard of living.
Fatima is taking out her third loan with Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase the stock in her grocery store with special spring/summer product offers. She will also invest part of the loan to pay for her son's wedding expenses. 
Her previous loans helped her a lot in increasing her business capital and developing her family's socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: To increase the stock in her store and to pay for her son's wedding

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina nació en la comunidad de Huarancca el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo al sur de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 28 años de edad  y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras productos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo  y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Justina was born in the community of Huarancca, which is in the District of Colquepata in Paucartambo Province. This area is located south of the city of Cusco. She is 28 years old and a responsible person who earns her living by farming and raising livestock. Justina has several plots of land where she grows potatoes, barley, wheat, beans, and other crops.

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy fertilizers. Justina is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan, so she promises to handle her payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Grasiela

texts.es:
Graciela ha vivido de la venta de tortillas y nacatamales desde hace diez años.  Ya cuenta con una clientela fija,  que la busca cada domingo para desayunar este delicioso plato típico nicaragüense. Sus hijos la ayudan  en la preparación de ambos alimentos. 
Graciela desea continuar  trabajando, por lo tanto, solicita un préstamo para la compra de: Maíz, Hojas, Carne, Vegetales entre otros ,  ya que el volumen de ventas ha aumentado y no quiere quedar mal ante sus clientes.  Las ganancias serán destinadas para mejorar su negocio, su casa y para ofrecerle a sus hijos la mejor herencia que cualquier padre de familia puede otorgarle: la educación.
texts.en:
Grasiela has earned her living selling tortillas and tamales for ten years. She has a regular clientele who seek her out every Sunday to eat her delicious Nicaraguan dishes. Grasiela's children help her prepare the food.

As she wishes to continue in this job, she is seeking a loan to buy corn, leaf wrappers, meat, vegetables etc. as sales have increased and she doesn't want to disappoint her customers. Profits will be used to improve the business, her house, and to provide her children with the best gift a parent can give: education.

loans.use: Buy corn, leaf wrappers, meat, vegetables etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic goods like sugar, rice, corn, beans, wheat, and oil.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. Some years ago, she started her own business of selling cloth when her husband got severely ill. She didn't lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor. She buys cloth of different designs from the market in bulk at lower rates and sells them in her community. She has a good list of clients, most of whom are her neighbors.

She has gradually improved her business and now has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR). She is going to use this to buy an ample variety of cloth in larger quantities to add to her current stock. She would like to spend part of the profits to improve the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to buy an ample variety of cloth in large quantities.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es: Ignacia nació en la comunidad de Huarancca el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo al sur de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 47 años de edad  y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras productos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y semillas, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo  y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Ignacia was born in the community of Huarancca, Colquepata District, Paucartambo Province, south of the city of Cusco. She is 47 years old and is a responsible person, earning her living from farming and raising animals. 

Ignacia has land where she grows potatoes, barley, wheat, broad beans and other produce. She now needs a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan and promises to pay it back in a responsible manner.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan nació en la comunidad de Huarancca el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo al sur de la ciudad del Cusco, él tiene 51 años de edad  y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, él tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras productos, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, él agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo  y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Juan was born in the community of Huarancca, Colquepata District, Paucartambo Province, south of the city of Cusco. He is 51 years old and a responsible person, earning his living from farming and raising animals. 

Juan has land where he grows potatoes, barley, wheat, broad beans and other produce. He now needs a loan to buy fertilizer. He is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan and promises to pay it back in a responsible manner.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jessieca

texts.en:
Jessieca is 31 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children; one in grade school and one an infant.

Jessieca has a passion for teaching and is presently employed as a public school teacher and has been for almost two years. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. Her husband, an elected Barangay official, is also raising turkeys and chickens. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase five sacks of booster feed, five sacks of grower mass and vitamins. Other amount will be used for constructing additional building and fences. Jessieca has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future she hopes to expand their turkey and chicken raising activity.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of booster feed, five sacks of grower mass and vitamins

loans.name: Terlan

texts.en:
Terlan is a 26-year-old refugee. He is married and has two sons. The young family lives in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and educates children. Terlan has earned money raising and selling seasonal fruits and vegetables for seven years. He has good skills in this area and this brings him 200 AZN monthly.

Fruits and vegetables are in high demand. People like to eat them fresh and use them for cooking different dishes. Terlan sells his harvest at a local bazaar as cheaply as possible because he knows what is to be a refugee. 

Terlan’s income isn’t enough to cover his living costs. He applied for 1,000 AZN in order to buy new fertilizers and increase his harvest. He wants to provide his children with a good education and a good future.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and increase the harvest

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr:
Saliou, âgé de 39 ans, est commerçant depuis plus de 20ans. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants dont trois garçons et une fille de 2 ans qui est la benjamine. Son commerce consiste à vendre divers produits alimentaires. Il commence sa journée à 5h du matin pour la finir à midi. Il vend des légumes, de la pomme de terre, des épices : piment, ail, poivre ; du café dans les marchés hebdomadaires. En rentrant, il achète des céréales : arachide, mil pour venir le revendre chez lui. Saliou est très dégourdi car il se déplace pratiquement tous les jours pour ne manquer aucun marché.
Il nourrit sa famille grâce aux revenus de son activité et s’occupe aussi de leur éducation car les 3 sont scolarisés.
Saliou adore ses enfants, c’est pourquoi son vœu le plus cher est de les mettre dans de bonnes conditions de vie et leur donner un bon départ.
texts.en:
Saliou is 39 years old and has been a merchant for more than twenty years. He is married and a father of four children, of whom three are boys and the youngest is a girl of two years old.

Saliou's business consists of selling various food goods. He starts his day at 5 a.m. and finishes at noon. He sells vegetables, potatoes, spices (e.g, pepper, garlic, black pepper), and coffee in the weekly markets. Upon returning he buys cereals, groundnuts and millet, that he sells from his house.

Saliou is quite savvy because he moves around, so that he can be at a market everyday. 

Saliou feeds his family thanks to the earnings from this business, and he is also able to send his children to school. Saliou loves his children, which is why his greatest wish is to give them good living conditions and a good start in life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, potatoes, millet, coffee, and cereals to resell

loans.name: Sabina Bonifaccio

texts.es: Sabina nació en la comunidad de Huarancca el distrito de Colquepata de la provincia de Paucartambo al sur de la ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 34 años de edad  y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, a la agricultura y a la ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras productos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo  y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Sabina was born in the community of Huarancca in the district of Colquepata, province of Paucartambo south of the city of Cusco.  She is 34 years old and very responsible in her work raising small animals, crop growing and livestock-farming.  She has land where she grows potatoes, wheat, beans and other products.

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy small animals such as guinea pigs.  She is grateful to the lenders and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy small animals such as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Chivorn

texts.en: Chivorn is 22 years old. She is a single woman who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a factory laborer and earns approximately $5 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $500 to purchase timber and to pay construction fees. This loan helps her repair her house and live in good conditions. In the future, she hopes that she can buy more farmland.

loans.use: To purchase timber and to pay construction fees

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben lives with his mother and grandmother in Yerevan town. He is a student at Economic University of Armenia. To tackle his financial hardships, Ruben also works as a craftsman.

He is a very hardworking young man who feels responsible for providing appropriate living conditions for his mother and grandmother. Now, he is asking for this loan to be able to pay for his university tuition and continue his studies there. Ruben waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 37 years old, is from Nyandarua South and she is married. They have three children between 17 and 9 years old

Lucy is a farmer and has been in this business for many years. She has applied for her third loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizers. 

She hopes to expand her farming business in the near future and uplift their living standards.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Jasmina Del Carmen

texts.es: Relación entre salud- curación- gracia y enfermedad- pecado- castigado durante la Edad Media “la salud del cuerpo estuvo directamente relacionada con la salud del alma”, de aquí que las “buenas obras” permitiesen conservar una salud perfecta tanto del cuerpo como del espíritu, lo que a su vez ayudaba a alcanzar la vida eterna. Doña Jasmina es una señora de 40 años de edad, originaria de la Ciudad de Estelí, madre de un hijo que actualmente es egresado de la universidad, y nos dice que realmente la conservación de un espíritu sano nos lleva alcanzar una práctica excelente de la higiene. Ella se dedica  a la enseñanza de la educación primaria regular (les enseña a los niños a leer, escribir, sumar, restar). Solicita un crédito para la construcción de un servicio sanitario que preste todas las condiciones higiénicas necesarias. Estimando que el crédito a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda para que su familia viva bajo excelentes condiciones higiénicas. Obteniendo como planes a futuro la remodelación y construcción sistemática de su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
In Middle Ages, the relationship between health-wellness-grace and illness-sin-punishment meant that "a healthy body was directly linked to a healthy soul", so "good deeds" allowed one to conserve perfect health, of both body and spirit, which also helped to achieve eternal life.

Jasmina, 40, is from the city of Estelí.  She is the mother of a son who has graduated from the university and she says keeping a healthy spirit leads to practicing excellent hygiene.  She is a primary school teacher (teaching children to read, write, add and subtract).  The loan she is requesting is to build a bathroom with all the basic hygiene fixtures.  She believes the loan will be of much help toward allowing her family to live with excellent hygienic conditions.  Her future plans are to renovate her humble dwelling.

loans.use: To build a bathroom with all the basic hygiene fixtures.

loans.name: Bornes

texts.en: Bornes is a 43-year-old widow. She has seven children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a rural area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more firewood to sell. Her business goal is to be stable within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She also does dairy farming to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for sell

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mamadou ne connait que le commerce, depuis qu’il est tout jeune, il restait dans la boutique de son frère et aidait un peu quand il y avait beaucoup de clients. C’est ainsi qu’il a appris petit à petit le métier. Quinze ans plus tard, il ouvre une petite boutique car son capital n’était pas aussi consistant. Voulant augmenter la marchandise, il fait recours à l’IMCEC pour un financement de 500 000F. La boutique se trouve dans le marché et il ouvre de 7h à 2h du matin vu l’affluence jusqu’à cette heure, puisse qu’il y a une dibiterie à coté.
Mamadou est marié et papa de 4 enfants. Avec ce qu’il gagne comme bénéfice, il s’occupe de ses enfants et de leur éducation.
Son rêve serait d’ouvrir une grande boutique où ne manquera aucune marchandise et où la clientèle pourra trouver tout ce dont elle aura besoin.
texts.en:
Mamadou only knows how to do business. Since he was young boy, he stayed in his brother's shop and helped a little if there were many customers. From this, he learned little by little how to do business.

Fifteen years later, he opened a little shop [of his own], because his earnings were not consistent. Wanting to increase his stock, he sought a loan from IMCEC for 500,000 francs CFA.

His shop is in the market and it is open from 7 a.m. until 2 a.m. The shop is open so late, because there are many people around at a dibiterie [a grill restaurant] nearby.

Mamadou is married and a father of four children. With his earnings, he is able to send his children to school.

His dream is to open a large shop where he does not run out of stock and where the customers can find everything they need.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to resell in his shop

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora tiene 38 años de edad  y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, a la agricultura y a la ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras productos, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo  y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Isidora, 38, is a responsible person who works raising small animals, growing crops and raising livestock.  She has land where she grows potatoes, barley, wheat, beans and other products.

She is in need of a loan to buy seeds.  She is grateful to the lenders and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 49 años de edad  y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, a la agricultura y a la ganadería, ella tiene varios galpones donde cría cuyes y gallinas, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo  y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Teodora, 49, is a responsible person who she works raising small animals and livestock and in agriculture.  She has several coops where she raises guinea pigs and chickens.

She is in need of a loan to buy guinea pigs.  Teodora is grateful to the lenders and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 21 años de edad  y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, a la agricultura y a la ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cuiltivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras productos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y abono, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo  y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Hilda is 21 years old and she is a responsible person who makes a living breeding small livestock and farming.

She has several croplands where she grows potatoes, barley, wheat, broad beans and other products.

She is a member of the communal bank “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope). In this case, she needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She thanks the investors for the loan and commits to making her monthly payements with a lot of responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mariatou

texts.fr: Mariatou est une femme de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont le premier a 24 ans et le dernier 19 ans. Elle possède et gère un mini restaurant où elle vend des beignets, haricot et bouillie depuis 11 ans dans un quartier de la ville. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières en achetant sac de farine, bidon d'huile, sac de sucre afin d'augmenter ses ventes et ses profits. les bénéfices ainsi générés vont être réinvestis dans son activité pour accroître son capital et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, nutrition, loyer, santé).
texts.en:
Mariatou is a 45-year-old woman, married, and a mother of three children, of whom the eldest is 24 years old and the youngest is 19 years old. She owns and runs a small restaurant where she has been selling beignets [fried donuts], beans, and bouillie [corn porridge] for 11 years in a local part of town.

She is seeking this loan to increase her stock of raw ingredients by buying a sac of flour, a can of oil, and a sac of sugar in order to increase her sales and profits.

Earnings will be reinvested in her business so as to increase her capital. The rest of her earnings will be used to support her family's needs (education, nutrition, housing, health).

loans.use: to buy food supplies (flour, sugar, oil)

loans.name: Bebiyereye Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les cinq membres du groupe Bebiyereye ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djelibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et  se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djelibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits de la friperie de tous genres, du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois et de produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont  décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Alimatou (femme debout  à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande  vendeuse d’habits de la friperie de meilleures qualités et de tous les genres. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une balle d’habits à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Alimatou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married mostly into polygamous households, the five members of the Bebiyereye group are, on average, 34 years old and have four children. They all live in Djelibougou, one of the neighborhoods in Bamako, and they know each other from family, friendship, and neighborhood ties and from their work in the Djelibougou market.

The group members engage in small-scale commerce selling different types of used clothing, firewood, charcoal, and cosmetics. In order to increase their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan.

Alimatou (the woman standing on the far right in the photo) is a grand merchant selling different types of high quality used clothing. She plans to use her loan to buy a bale of clothing from Bamako. Sales will be made at retail in the market and from traveling around to a mixed group of customers.

From this loan, Alimatou plans to earn an average monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA which will be reinvested back into her business and will be used to support her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy used clothing

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les huit  membres du groupe Soutoura ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djelibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djelibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (oignons, choux, tomates), pâtes d’arachides et chaussures plastiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Safiatou,  debout au premier rang de la gauche vers la droite, est  une grande vendeuse des condiments qui compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 8 corbeilles de tomate, 5 sacs d’oignons, 6 sacs de choux  en gros au marché. La revente se fait en détail à Djelibougou à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Safiatou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married mostly into monogamous households, the eight members of the Soutoura group are, on average, 36 years old and have four children. They all live in Djelibougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako. They know each other through neighborhood ties and from their work at the Djelibougou market. The group members all work in small-scale commerce selling condiments (onions, cabbage, tomatoes), groundnut paste, and plastic shoes.

In order to increase their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yirwaso. They are on their first group loan.

Safiatou, standing in the first row on the left in the photo, is a great seller of condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy eight trays of tomatoes, five sacs of onions, and six sacs of cabbage at wholesale from the market. Sales will be made at retail in Djelibougou to mostly female customers.

With this loan, Safiatou hopes to earn a average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA which will be reinvested in her business and used to support her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with four children. She has a gas supply business in Nairobi town. She has been in this business for 10 years and it has been profitable. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of gas cylinders for her business. She will use the anticipated profits from her business to expand her business by buying more gas cylinders. 

This is Elizabeth's fifth loan term and she has repaid her previous loans successfully. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of gas cylinders

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les membres du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 50 ans et 8 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djalakorodji. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (oignons, macaronis, échalotes, Maggi…), huile d’arachides et de la viandes. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame  Sanata (femme  debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (oignons, macaronis, échalotes, Maggi). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter   10 sacs d’échalotes, 15 sacs d’oignons, 15 paquets de macaronis et 7cartons de cubes Maggi en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Djalakorodji et  en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sanata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married mostly into monogamous households, the members of the Benkadi group are, on average, 50 years old and have eight children. They all live in Djalakorodji, of the neighborhoods in Bamako. They know each other through neighborhood ties and their work at the Djalakorodji market.

The group members work in small-scale commerce selling condiments (onions, macaroni, shallots, Maggi…), groundnut oil, and meat.

In order to increase their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their fourth group loan.

Sanata, the woman standing on the far left in the photo, is a grand seller of condiments (onions, macaroni, shallots, Maggi). She plans to use her loan to buy 10 sacs of shallots, 15 sacs of onions, 15 packets of macaroni, and seven boxes of Maggi cubes at wholesale in Bamako. Sales will be made at retail in Djalakorodji and from traveling around to mostly female customers.

With this loan, Sanata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA which will be reinvested in her business and used to support her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: Guillermina tiene 38 años de edad  y es una persona responsable que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, a la agricultura y a la ganadería, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, habas y otras productos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer fumigar los cultivos, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo  y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 38 years old and she is a responsible person who makes a living breeding small livestock and farming.

She has several croplands where she grows potatoes, barley, wheat, broad beans and other products.

She is a member of the communal bank “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope). In this case, she needs the loan to have her crops fumigated. She thanks the investors for the loan and commits to making her monthly payements with a lot of responsibility.

loans.use: to have her crops fumigated.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for the past seven years. She has one buffalo, which she uses for milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Nasreen has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her sixth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en: Maqsood is 50 years old, married and the mother of six. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing this for the past 10 years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and laces to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons and laces.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is 31 years old, married and has been running a small general store in her community for many years with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo).  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of PKR 50,000, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a business friendly area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 34  años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar materiales como mangueras y mayas para un vivero , el desea dar asistencia a estas plantas , con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para su posterior venta, la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Rafael is an entrepreneur who is 34 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and two children.  The loan he is requesting is to buy supplies such as hoses and mesh for his greenhouse.  He wants to care for his plants in an effort to keep them in good condition as they grow so he can sell them.

The only limitation this gentleman has is a lack of money to continue expanding.  Since this is his only source of income, he is requesting a loan, his first, through FUDECOSUR.  He has never received loans from state banks and FUDECOSUR is giving him better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as a hose and mesh.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 50 years old from Nyandarua South in Kenya and is married with four children, aged between 19 and 30 years old.

Mercy has been a farmer for many years. She has applied for her third loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy seeds and fertilizer to use on her farm.

She hopes to improve her business and family's livelihood in the near future.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertlizers

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 27-year-old married man, who has been working in the wood manufacturing business for twelve years. He was only twelve years old when he started working in this domain - that's why his long experience has provided him with a special talent, which gives him customers' trust and support.

Hassan is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his business capital with necessary wood logs, and special updated new-release machines to develop his business and improve his living. This is his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan helped him a lot in developing his business, and he is looking forward to expanding his working sector further to cover his family's increasing needs.

loans.use: to increase his business capital with wood logs and special updated new-release machines.

loans.name: Omar

texts.es: Omar, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 53 años de edad  y vive solo  actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigaciones , el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el segundo   préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Actualmente no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Omar is an entrepreneurial man. He is 53 years old and currently lives alone. He asked for a loan to buy agricultural inputs, like fertilizer and insecticide. He wants to assist his coffee crops in order to keep them in good condition during their development and obtain a good quality product. 

The only limitation this man finds is the lack of the money he needs to continue growing, since he depends on this activity to get ahead. This is why he requested this loan. It’s the second loan he is receiving from FUDECOSUR.

He doesn’t have any other loans with national banks at the moment, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with the most simplicity and a much smaller interest rate.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Shamiem

texts.en:
Shamiem is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her own business of milk sales. At present, she has two cows and two buffaloes. She counts a good client list and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is from Masis. She lives with her husband and 33-year-old son. The whole family is engaged in agriculture, including beekeeping. They currently keep 60 colonies of bees, get high quality honey and sell it locally. Due to their hard work, the farm provides them with sufficient income for covering basic needs. 

Susanna now asks for this loan of 3,000 USD to enlarge her agribusiness. She plans to renovate the greenhouse and purchase rose seeds for cultivation. As this is Susanna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.
