loans.use: to pay for rose seeds and to renovate her greenhouse.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
At the age of 47, Nazeeran is a married woman. She has six children. She has been involved in the business of selling animals for a period of about three years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals. She wants to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat, aged 51, is a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Musarat’s husband. Three years ago, the couple started a business selling animals. They purchase small animals at low prices and after raising them for a year or two, sell them out to the people of their locality. They earn a good amount of income to support the needs of their family. For the improvement of their business, Musarat has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals. With this loan, they will definitely expand their business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge  tiene la edad de 61 años, es casado y vive con la esposa y un hijo actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una novilla para cría   y cuando estén grandes venderlos y obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a el a salir  adelante. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jorge is 61 years old. He is married and he currently lives with his wife and one child. He is asking for a loan to buy a heifer to raise so that, when it’s grown, he can sell it for a profit.

Raising Livestock will help him get ahead. He hopes to expand with this project and to achieve his goals, so that in the future he can have a better quality of life and financial stability for him and his family.

This is the first loan he has obtained from FUDECOSUR. He has never received loans from state banks and FUDECOSUR is giving him better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Rutbel

texts.es: Rutbel un hombre trabajador,  tiene la edad de 49 años, es casado y vive con la esposa y una  hija actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado de cría, el cuenta con una área de terreno con pasto de cuido y desea poder comprar dos novillas para que se reproduzcan  y con ello obtener una ganancia. El negocio del ganado le ayudará a el a salir  adelante. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y logre sus objetivos y así pueda en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el segundo   préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Actualmente no registra préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rutbel is a hard-working man. He is 49 years old, married, and lives with his wife and a daughter. He wants this loan to buy breeding cattle. He has a plot of land planted with pasture and he wants to buy two heifers to have them bred and make a profit.

Raising Livestock will help him get ahead. He hopes to expand with this project and to achieve his goals, so that in the future he can have a better quality of life and financial stability.

This is the second loan he has obtained from FUDECOSUR. He currently has no loans from state banks and FUDECOSUR is giving him better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy breeding cattle.

loans.name: Hidayet

texts.en:
Hidayet is a married man and father of three children who lives in the Abseron region. His wife is a housewife and doesn’t bring in any income. His oldest child is 15 years old and is in the eleventh class of secondary school. His second child is 13 years old and also goes to school, and the youngest is 10 years old.

Hidayet has been a taxi driver for 8 years. He adores his family and in order to support them he works very hard. Today he needs a loan to the amount of 600 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to change the tires on his car, so he has applied to Komak Credit Union for the loan. 

Hidayet is very thankful to the Kiva organization and all lenders for their help. 

In the future he wants to change his car.

loans.use: to change the tires on his car

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis is 45 years old. She is married and she and her husband are blessed with three children. She is in the farming business and her husband helps in the business as well. She has been farming for 4 years.

She currently makes a monthly income of KES 9,500 and would like a loan of KES 15,000. She would like the loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings, and to pay for labor. She anticipates that her farming will expand, and with the profits she will be able to pay for her children's school fees. 

Her hope is that in the future she will be able to buy a lot of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings, and pay for labor

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 24-year-old single woman with 1 child. She describes herself as optimistic. 

She operates a retail business where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more maize to sell. Her goal is to build a wholesale business within the next 5 years. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, tiene la edad 54 de  años, está casado y vive con la esposa. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de unos cerdos y el concentrado para el engorde de cerdos. El cuenta con varios cerdos a su poder y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus padres y crecer con el proyecto de cría de cerdos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Jorge is 54 years old, married and lives with his wife. With the loan he wants to buy some pigs and pig feed for pig fattening. He already owns many pigs and he wants to feed them with this feed so they become fatter faster. He wants his animals to have the ideal weight in order to sell them later at the market of his town or in nearby places. He wants to generate more earnings for his well being and that of his parents, and be able to grow his project of raising pigs. It is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not had other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with better conditions and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is 33 years old, married and has two children. One of them is age 9 and a pupil in the second class. Another goes to preparation for school, and he is age 6. His wife is a tailor.

Elnur’s family have been IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Agdam city for 20 years already. Today they are living in the Absheron region. Elnur is a master. He rents a factory and there Elnur makes iron for building foundations, after which he sells these products and earns a monthly income to provide for his family.

Now he wants to buy a new apparatus which is necessary in his business, so Elnur has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Elnur greatly thanks the Kiva organization for the loan. In the future he wants to have his own factory.

loans.use: to buy a new apparatus

loans.name: Anees

texts.en: Anees has expertise in embroidery and is using her skill to provide for her family. She started this line of work at a very young age. During initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her community to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors, and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en: Aneela, a 52-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Aneela has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Aneela's fifth loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Hajran

texts.en: Hajran is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (also shown in the photo) at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of their five children. Recently, she requested a loan of PKR 55,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Lira

texts.en:
Lira lives in Meghri with her husband and 28-year-old son. Lira's husband works at a local clinic.

Lira is engaged in agriculture. She keeps two cows. To enlarge her farm and earn more income from agribusiness, Lira has applied for a loan of $3,000. With the loan, Lira plans to purchase a cow, calf and forage for feeding the livestock. As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

Please help this hard-working woman with the expansion of her farming business.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, a calf and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japeth is a 36-year-old man from the Kakamega region, which is in the western part of Kenya. He is married, with two children who are ten and four years old.

He has a hardware shop. He has been doing this for the last 12 years and earns a monthly income of KES. 30,000. He has applied for his first loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which he will use to buy materials like timber. He will use the anticipated income to reinvest in his business.

He has a dream of developing his business to help him support his family.

loans.use: to purchase more hardware items

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 50 years old from Nyandarua and is married. They have one child who is 13.

Julia is a farmer and has been for many years. She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizer to use on her farm.

She hopes to farm more in the near future so as to boost her income, which will in turn help improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 29-year-old married woman. For about 2 years she has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors with the packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors with the packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Haleeman

texts.en:
Haleeman is a 48-year-old married woman. She has five children.

She started a business selling cloth six years ago. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

She is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 10 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. As a mother, she is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health.

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy packs of grains, sugar, tea and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of grains, sugar, tea and beverages

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for the past five years. She has two milking cows and one buffalo. She has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 29-year-old, married mother of three children. Fifteen months ago she started her own women's clothes and perfume selling business to support her beloved husband in earning their living, and she works hard to provide her children with the best education.

Faten is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with the newly released spring & summer collection.

This is her first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. She is hoping that through future loans, she will be able to introduce her customers to new products such as women's shoes, to diversify her products and to develop her socioeconomic status.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with newly released spring & summer collection

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 28-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself as trustworthy. 

He operates a retail business where he sells cereals, fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 13 years. His primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of sufficient capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals, fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 36-year-old woman from Nyandarua and is married. She and her husband have two children aged 13  and 7 years old.

Jane is a farmer and has been running her farm for many years. She has applied for her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy a dairy cow. The cow will give her some milk to sell.

She hopes to improve her livelihood and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 25-year-old single lady who has been working selling clothes from her house for three years. Alaa is a hard worker who puts so much effort to develop her living through developing her business and responding to her customer's needs.

Today, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business merchandise with a newly released spring and summer collection to attract new customers and develop her business. 

This is Alaa's first cycle as a Al Majmoua borrower; her future acquired loans will be invested in expanding her business and increasing her business capital.  She might also move her business outside her house if she finds out that her customers are not comfortable coming to her house, although most of them feel comfortable and enjoy the privacy of easily trying on clothes.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a newly released spring and summer collection.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a 43-year-old man from the western part of Kenya in Kakamega county. He supports three people in his family, and is married to Mrs. Klensia, who is also a business person. Timothy has three children who are 3 and 6 years old, and one who is 3 months old.

Timothy has an Art Center, a business he has been doing for the last ten years. He comfortably earns a monthly income of Kes 18,000. 

He is taking his first loan with VISIONFUND KENYA, which he will use to boost his business by buying artifacts for crafting. He will use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business.

His dream is to own a shop and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy artifacts for crafting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more salt, onion, rice, oil, etc. for her business.
